results.description:
Because of the 30 seat strict limit for Room 505 and the demand for seats I am asking each DNNY member to RSVP RIGHT NOW so I then can reserve one seat for you while we still have seats. (They will be all taken and then you will not be able to get in on Sunday, Nov. 1 at 2pm sharp. 

Again, make your reservation right now by emailing me directly with your full name and asking for one seat to be reserved for you.


Nick

Date:Sunday, Nov. 1, 2015

Location: CAP 21 Studios, 18 West 18th St., (Between 5th Ave. & 6th Ave., South Side of Street), 5th Floor, Room 505, NYC

Time: 2pm-5pm Please arrive 10 minutes in the lobby before 2pm meeting begins in the assigned room! Ask the Welcome Desk person for “Nick Curto's room assignment” if you need help in finding the room. Try to be on time as late arrivals may disrupt the meeting.

Topic(s): “Methodical Illusion & Methodical Deception”

Featured Guest Speaker: REBEKAH ROTH

Program (Live Event):Rebekah Roth, author of the much talked about book Methodical Illusion followed by her second book which is receiving rave reviews, Methodical Deception, both being hailed as "game changers" and "in a class of investigative reporting all by themselves" that blows the lid off the official story of 9/11 with newly uncovered facts that are truly riveting. Also, we have extended this meeting time one more hour till 5pm because of the huge scope and details of Rebekah's research and to allow more time for a Q&A, so the DNNY meeting will be running from 2pm to 5pm!

Bio: Rebekah Roth enjoyed a nearly thirty year airline career working as both a flight attendant and an international purser. She was trained as an emergency medical technician and served as a volunteer firefighter.

Her expertise and training as a flight attendant allowed her to research the events of September 11, 2001, with an insider’s knowledge that eventually lead her to discover details and answers to some of the most haunting questions surrounding that infamous day in our history.

Rebekah enjoyed a very exciting life both in the air and on the ground and because of that, was encouraged by co-workers to write a book. As she began to do that, she discovered that ten of the accused 9/11 hijackers were still alive. Several of them were also airline employees employed with Saudi Arabia Airlines and that they had had their identifications stolen years prior to 9/11. At least four of the accused hijackers threatened to sue the U.S. Government and the FBI if they did not stop using their names and identities.

That discovery, along with the refusal by the U.S. government to discontinue their false accusations, ignited her curiosity. After thousands hours of research, using official government documents, print and video media from 9/11, and several books, Rebekah discovered that there were also at least two women involved in the 9/11 event. Using her personal knowledge of in-flight procedures, FAA hijacking protocols, the state of Massachusetts and cell phone technology, she discovered yet to be exposed details concerning the planes, the passengers and the perpetrators which are woven into “Methodical Illusion”.

In the months following the release of Methodical Illusion, Rebekah had several people contact her with more information that had never been made public, so she decided to weave that new information into a sequel and the “Methodical Deception” was born.

The novel format helps the reader to learn about the FAA protocols and behaviors that would be expected by the flight crews, along with other information about people and corporations Rebekah discovered were involved in the planning or execution and/or the financial gain from the fourteen years of wars in the Islamic countries of the Middle East.

Rebekah's mission in choosing to write these books was to help the person who had never investigated 9/11 or had always had some doubt about the official story, to see the event through the eyes of an airline professional as her main character, very much like herself wakes up to the truth and discovers what happened to the planes, the passengers and crew members that unforgettable day in our history.

Meeting Format: The meeting will be done on either Skype and will start promptly at 2pm so please be on time. Your co0peration on this is appreciated. Please plan to attend what is bound to be one of the most interesting DNNY meetings to date and invite your interested friends to join us!

For questions/comments or Press please contact: Nick Curto, DNNY Director/Co-Founder: E-mail: [masked] Phone/Text:[masked]

Meeting Details: Admission $10 per person. Children 12 and under admitted free. Our treasurer will collect your admission fee in the meeting room before the program begins.


R.S.V.P. Strongly recommended for people attending the meeting for the first time. Provide full name, e-mail address and cell phone number per person.

3 Important Notes:

1. No food or beverages are allowed in any rooms of the venue except bottled water that may be brought into the venue. You can also purchase chilled bottled water at the Welcome Desk in the Lobby for $1.
2. Please silence your cell phones when entering the meeting room.
3. No photos may be taken or sound recording is ever allowed at any of the DNNY meetings.

Please visit: www.dnny.info

results.description:
Deadline for submission of stories to be critiqued is Monday of the week preceeding the Meetup. On Tuesday, an email will be sent, listing the stories to be critiqued and in what order. Print out and mark up your copies in advance or read and mark up electronic comments.

Stories can be any length up to approx. 7,000 words. Flash fiction welcome.

You can submit your story to me (Marcy) directly, or submit to Dropbox per the Procedures (see below). My email is [masked].

Please make sure your manuscript is properly formatted. Read through our Short Story Group Procedures for guidelines and an example, as well as advice for a constructive critique. Having manuscripts already formatted makes the critiquing process easier.

Most of the meeting will be spent critiquing work of group members. There is a structure to make sure critiques are as helpful as possible for everyone involved, so writers leave with a clear idea of what to do next with their stories.

We also spend time talking about writing, sharing news and information, and getting to know one another. It's always easier to take constructive criticism from someone you know!

Flash pieces: If there is time (and there usually is), we can critique one or two last minute flash pieces that weren't submitted. Best method is to print out a copy for each participant. We will read the story there and give on-the-spot critiques.
results.name: Marcy's Short Story Meetup

results.description:
[Cross-posted from NYC Stoics]

Want to learn the basics of the theory and practice of Stoicism? Then join us at this meetup! 

Since 2012, a multi-disciplinary team centered at the University of Exeter composed of classicists, philosophers, psychologists, and psychotherapists have put together a free, distance-learning course called Stoic Week accompanied by online support. For a week, you'll be given daily readings and exercises to learn the basics of Stoicism and how to put it to practice in the modern world. They also test Stoicism's efficacy by administering validated psychometrics before and after Stoic Week to see if and how Stoic practice works.

Stoic Week 2015 runs from November 2-8. And, as we've done for the past couple of years, the NYC Stoics will have meetups bracketing Stoic Week to help give you extra support for your practice.

This meetup is intended to help you sign up for Stoic Week if you haven't already (I'll try to bring a computer). We'll also cover the introductory material. Finally, we'll have plenty of time for open discussion to answer both basic and advanced questions about Stoicism. So, if you're new to Stoicism, this is a great meetup for you to attend, whether or not you plan on participating in Stoic Week 2015!

To prepare for this meetup, please do the following:

• Sign up for Stoic Week 2015 if you are able to and want to participate (you don't have to participate in Stoic Week 2015 to attend this meetup though, as we're also having open discussion around Stoicism)

• If you signed up successfully, browse the "preliminary" section of the Stoic Week 2015 website, and read the introductory material of the Stoic Week 2015 Handbook (to be released October 31 in PDF, ePub, and HTML, up to but not including Monday's assignment)

• Come prepared with any questions or discussion points you'd like to bring up for our open discussion period

For more information about Stoic Week, please read this blog post.

Finally, please note that Daylight Saving Time ends Sunday 11/1 (the day of the meetup) at 2AM, so make sure you account for that!
results.name: Introduction to Stoic Week 2015 (and Stoicism in General)

results.description:
Note: I need to postpone the meetup to the 3:05 show.  Sorry for any headaches.


----


Young housewife Helena has always dreamed of opening her own business. When a fully-furnished vacant space opens up, she decides to finally fulfill this dream by opening a neighborhood grocery store. On the same day she signs the lease to the shop, her husband Otávio is suddenly fired from his job as an insurance executive, leaving Helena to support her husband and daughter alone.

The role reversal at home threatens to overturn the established structure of her domestic universe and ultimately begins to affect her personal relationship with her family. As pressure surmounts, Helena's temper flares and catapults her into a psychological breakdown. When the brick walls of her building start to crumble, groceries disappear, and a mysterious black substance begins creeping through the tiles of her floor, HARD LABOR takes a dark and suspenseful turn.

Is it supernatural, or is it the manifestation of Helena's paranoia and disintegrating psyche? A subtle neo-noir thriller wrapped in unconventional horror elements, HARD LABOR is a disturbing approach to an otherwise common crisis of a middle class family struggling to make it in a capitalist society.

http://www.cinemavillage.com/chc/cv/show_movie.asp?movieid=3520

----------------------------------------------

A good pick for the spirit of Halloween weekend.  And our first Brazilian pick.  The film starts at 3:05 and I will be there about 20 minutes before.

Looking forward to seeing you there. 


-John

PS. If anyone has suggestions for a good post-movie bar near East 12th where we can sit and have a big table then please let me know.  I would love to have at least one candidate establishment by Sunday.

• Come prepared with any questions or discussion points you'd like to bring up for our open discussion period


For more information about Stoic Week, please read this blog post.

Finally, please note that Daylight Saving Time ends Sunday 11/1 (the day of the meetup) at 2AM, so make sure you account for that!
results.name: Introduction to Stoic Week 2015 (and Stoicism in General)

results.description:
Central Park is one of the most beautiful parts of New York City!  It is even more stunning as the fall colors are at starting to show below the city skyline.  This opportunity does not last long and there is no better way to experience it than to be with dozens of fun and friendly members of our group !  Your guide will share with you the history of the park from its heyday to decline and then rebirth. He will show you amazing pictures  from before the park was there to vintage shots from the late 18 and 1900's.  You will learn of it's construction, design, special secrets and more as the sun shines on a crisp fall day.

We have timed the tour to end in time for the 5:30 mass at Holy Trinity


Can I come alone? Yes 98% of those attending will come on their own.

Won't the park be crowded because of the marathon?  Not too bad by that time, beside we will be starting away from the main area and get to finish near the finish line to get to see all the excitement.


What should I wear?  Dress for the weather

What if it rains? We will monitor the weather and send out a final notice by 8am on Saturday morning. Refunds will be sent only if the tour is canceled

Where do we meet?  You will meet the group at Good Enough to eat Restaurant on Columbus and 85th at 3pm sharp.  The NYC Marathon is that day so make sure you check the train schedules

Your guides number is[masked] in case you can not find the group.


We are raising funds for the San Pedro Mission in the Dominican Republic.  100% of the proceeds will be donated to the mission. Suggested donation is $15 please bring cash or make check payable to CRC.

results.description:
This weekend is promised to be very warm. So, lets take a chance and learn something new about the city!

This tour is about East village. We will start from Tweed House, the great example of governor`s  greed. Then we will move up north through the court sector where you can learn about the famous court cases in the history, architecture of the buildings and place. Then we move to Chinatown where you can imagine the times of 1850 and notorious gangs of Five Points! The riots and crimes where happening there on each corner, and they still have their historic spirit. Then, we will walk to the Little Italy and visit the places of the infamous Italian gangsters, FBI surveillance, crime spots, stop by in Museum of American Italian, try Italian ice and cannoli ( only for the group minimum of 10 people). The end of the tour will be in SOHO with the story of uniqueness of this little part of the city.  

The damage (cost): just $10
results.name: TOUR! NYC Courts, Chinatown, Little Italy and SOHO!

results.description:
Join us for an evening of collaborative sound art and chaos poetry! In this Creative Safe-Space for individuals with past or present experience with mental health issues or extreme states we will be exploring:

1. DADA POETRY

Dada was an artistic movement in the early 1900s that explored randomness, accidents, and incongruence in general. For this activity, we will be drawing inspiration from (though not necessarily copying) the following dada writing technique, invented by writer and performance artist Tristan Tzara:

Take a newspaper.
Take some scissors.
Choose from this paper an article the length you want to make your poem.
Cut out the article.
Next carefully cut out each of the words that make up this article and put them all in a bag.
Shake gently.
Next take out each cutting one after the other.
Copy conscientiously in the order in which they left the bag.
The poem will resemble you.
And there you are—an infinitely original author of charming sensibility, even though unappreciated by the vulgar herd.


2. COLLABORATIVE AUDIO COLLAGE

We will be creating live, generative sound collages by looping segments of audio and video we find on the internet. You may need to come to fully understand. Just come.

As always there will be plenty of time to hang out and get to know each other during and after the event.

Hope to see you there!

-Josh K.

Note: the number of RSVPs for this event in this meetup is not representative of how many people will be at the actual event, as these events are being advertised in several ways outside of this meetup.
results.name: DADA POETRY + COLLABORATIVE AUDIO COLLAGE!

group.name: PROPELLER: Mental Wellness Through Community & Advocacy

From Pussy Riot to Malala, few of today's struggles do not owe some debt to the unsung heroines of the international Suffragette Movement. results.description:
TOEFL/TOEIC Workshop・TOEFL/TOEIC対策の講座


What's going on?

JCAG offers TOEFL (Test of English as a Foreign Language) and TOEIC (Test of English for International Communication) workshops for all of you interested in preparing for the tests. The TOEFL tests and measures the ability to use English at the university level, and the TOEIC tests and measures the ability to use English in an international business environment.


(Details)


- TOEIC sessions are held once a month on the first Sunday, and the remaining Sundays are devoted to the TOEFL. This week, we are focusing on the speaking portion of the TOEFL test.


- The lessons focus on all the aspects of the tests (reading, writing, listening, and speaking) as well as other aspects such as pronunciation and composition ability in a focused yet fun and productive environment.

When & Where:

Date: Every other Sunday from 4:30pm-7:00pm

Location: Atrium at Citigroup Center
153 East 53rd Street (53rd Street and Lexington Avenue)
New York, NY 10022

Cost: These sessions are free of charge, but there is a suggested donation of $5 that will help to cover the cost of the printing materials.

To RSVP, email us at:　 [masked]


If you have any questions, please feel free to email us.

We look forward to seeing you soon!

 ****NOTE*****

1.) This event is run by JCAG organizers who are following a lesson plan that is prepared in advance, so we ask that native English speakers be aware of this when participating. 

2.) Due to the fact that the organizers dedicating their time to help with the event, we ask that people be considerate in terms of the time. Sessions will be cancelled in the event that students do not show up within 40 minutes of the start time.

皆様、

多くの方々のご希望や期待に応じて、我々JCAGはいよいよTOEFL (Test of English as a Foreign Language)・TOEIC (Test of English for International Communication) 対策の講座を開催致します。TOEFLは、英語圏の高等教育機関が入学希望者の外国語としての英語力を判定するための試験で、TOEICは英語によるコミュニケーション能力を検定するための試験です。


(内容)
レッスンはテスト(読解、ライティング、聴解、会話)に基づき集中したものになります。
又は発音、作文の強化等にも集中し、楽しみながら、効率的な環境でテストに励めるように指導致します。


日時と場所:

results.description:
Queen Salons are monthly gatherings designed for graduates of the 3-day Queen’s Code for Life workshop (formerly Celebrating Women: Regarding Ecstasy and Power™ workshop and commonly referred to as the “Queen Course”). If you have recently taken the Queen's Code for Life workshop and want to participate in the Queen Salons, please email <a>[masked]</a>. 

A Queen Salon is a safe and sacred space where you can connect with sister Queens, share your wisdom and energy, nurture and expand your Queen, and help each other embody your best and truest selves. We hope you will be excited to participate, create, laugh, and fill your tanks with your sister Queens in this loving Queen community.

In a Queen Salon, we will: 

• discuss and explore PAX material

• share personal triumphs and challenges

• strengthen our abilities to honor ourselves, our men, and our realms 

Join us for a casual evening of tank filling fun. 

This month's topic - Being a Queen of Compassion

Practicing Compassion for ourselves and others can create the space for deep understanding, appreciation and cooperation. It is a Feminine Form of Power which gives us access to being able to influence and contribute to our Realms. When directed inwardly, it can open new ways of honoring what really keeps us in “Queenly shape” and gaining awareness of what "throws us off". Let's go deep within ourselves as we look with compassionate eyes at ourselves and our Realms and explore the benefits of this Feminine Power.
results.name: Queen Salon - Topic: Being a Queen of Compassion

results.description:
This is a fun & unique event where you can go back in time and relive the days of the American Gangster. At the same time, make some new friends, meet some singles...and maybe more!

We will meet for a pre-mingle at 4:30pm at a local bar/pub near the museum, where we will hand out the tickets and head over to the museum at 5:30 for our 6pm private tour.

The pre-mingle location will be sent to the email address used to buy ticket, closer to event date. Food/drink will be available for purchase at pre-mingle. This event is not meant to be a gender balanced or age/ethnic specific. All are welcome.

Package for the tickets & pre-mingle - $29.75 to $39.75 (depending upon how early you purchase your ticket). Must Prepay to attend. An RSVP alone will not hold your spot. 

Get your tickets ASAP at this link - http://dljparty.ticketleap.com/gangster/

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FiRbqNyVskg

About the Museum: 

Housed in a former speakeasy, the Museum of the American Gangster isn’t obvious on a casual stroll down St. Mark’s Place. If visitors know to look for number 80, though, they pass through a black gate and up a flight of stairs, where a plethora of artifacts and exhibits awaits. 

The museum focuses on American organized crime through the decades, which includes profiling mob bosses, Prohibition-era gangsters, serial bank robbers, and dastardly Scooby-Doo villains. 

The New York Times praised co-owner and tour guide Lorcan Otway as "so encyclopedic that touring the rooms takes hours," as he expounds upon America's unique relationship with hedonism and straight-laced morality. 

In the Wall Street Journal, correspondent Alexandra Cheney mentions noteworthy finds including the museum's genuine Tommy guns, vintage whiskey bottles, and old copper stills. 

GET TICKETS HERE - http://dljparty.ticketleap.com/gangster/
results.how_to_find_us: Pre-Mingle location will be sent to you after ticket is purchased, closer to event date
results.name: American Gangster Museum (Private Tour w/ Pre-Mingle) MUST PREPAY

Housed in a former speakeasy, the Museum of the American Gangster isn’t obvious on a casual stroll down St. Mark’s Place. If visitors know to look for number 80, though, they pass through a black gate and up a flight of stairs, where a plethora of artifacts and exhibits awaits. 

The museum focuses on American organized crime through the decades, which includes profiling mob bosses, Prohibition-era gangsters, serial bank robbers, and dastardly Scooby-Doo villains. 

The New York Times praised co-owner and tour guide Lorcan Otway as "so encyclopedic that touring the rooms takes hours," as he expounds upon America's unique relationship with hedonism and straight-laced morality. 

In the Wall Street Journal, correspondent Alexandra Cheney mentions noteworthy finds including the museum's genuine Tommy guns, vintage whiskey bottles, and old copper stills. 

GET TICKETS HERE - http://dljparty.ticketleap.com/gangster/

results.description:
Have you ever been to one of those escape games, where you have a solve a real-life puzzle with a group of friends (or strangers) before the time runs out?

I don't really want to go alone, but it totally looks like it's worth trying in a group!

You can read more and buy tickets here: https://goo.gl/ecQHQn

Here's their description:

Prepare for an hour of insane fun, team building, and laughter - as you are about to be trapped in a room with a zombie! (Please arrive 10-15min early. You will spend 60 min in room, with a 10 minute wrap up afterward. So budget 80-90 minutes!)

You and 11 other adventurers will enter a room and are challenged to find the clues, solve the riddles, and get the key to escape.... or get eaten. As the clock dwindles down from 60 to 0, every 5 minutes the hungry zombie's chain gets longer and the danger zone increases. Communication and teamwork are musts if you want to make it out alive.

Does that sound like fun? I definitely want to check it out!
results.name: Let's Try This Zombie Escape Game!

The museum focuses on American organized crime through the decades, which includes profiling mob bosses, Prohibition-era gangsters, serial bank robbers, and dastardly Scooby-Doo villains. 

The New York Times praised co-owner and tour guide Lorcan Otway as "so encyclopedic that touring the rooms takes hours," as he expounds upon America's unique relationship with hedonism and straight-laced morality. 

In the Wall Street Journal, correspondent Alexandra Cheney mentions noteworthy finds including the museum's genuine Tommy guns, vintage whiskey bottles, and old copper stills.


GET TICKETS HERE - http://dljparty.ticketleap.com/gangster/

results.description:
Have you ever been to one of those escape games, where you have a solve a real-life puzzle with a group of friends (or strangers) before the time runs out?

I don't really want to go alone, but it totally looks like it's worth trying in a group!

You can read more and buy tickets here: https://goo.gl/ecQHQn

Here's their description:

Prepare for an hour of insane fun, team building, and laughter - as you are about to be trapped in a room with a zombie! (Please arrive 10-15min early. You will spend 60 min in room, with a 10 minute wrap up afterward. So budget 80-90 minutes!)

You and 11 other adventurers will enter a room and are challenged to find the clues, solve the riddles, and get the key to escape.... or get eaten. As the clock dwindles down from 60 to 0, every 5 minutes the hungry zombie's chain gets longer and the danger zone increases. Communication and teamwork are musts if you want to make it out alive.

Does that sound like fun? I definitely want to check it out!
results.name: Let's Try This Zombie Escape Game!

Museum of the American Gangster Tour for Singles

This is a great event where you can step back in time and relive the days of the American Gangster.  At the same time, meet some fun singles, make some new friends and maybe more at this great  event.

==================================================== 

How it works 

The tour starts at 6 PM SHARP, however we will have a pre-mingle at 4:30  at a local bar/pub (location announced only to those who registered/paid) where we will introduce you to the other attendees and give you admission tickets to the museum.

Next we head to the museum for a Guided Group Tour.  

Note: This event is open to all ages and is not meant to be gender/age specific. 

=============================================== 
Itinerary

4:30 PM- Premingle to meet other attendees

*6PM- Group Tour

==================================================

The museum focuses on American organized crime through the decades, which includes profiling mob bosses, Prohibition-era gangsters, serial bank robbers, and dastardly Scooby-Doo villains. 

The New York Times praised co-owner and tour guide Lorcan Otway as "so encyclopedic that touring the rooms takes hours," as he expounds upon America's unique relationship with hedonism and straight-laced morality. 

In the Wall Street Journal, correspondent Alexandra Cheney mentions noteworthy finds including the museum's genuine Tommy guns, vintage whiskey bottles, and old copper stills. 

GET TICKETS HERE - http://dljparty.ticketleap.com/gangster/

results.description:
Join us as we continue watch the Season 1 finale episodes as we continue our THRONES Countdown to Season 6!

We start with all of Season 1 and go straight through to the end of Season 5. Guess what? By the time we finish all five seasons together it will be time for Season 6!!! Yay! We can socialize  from 4:30PM to 5PM, then we begin the show at 5 promptly. A short intermission for reactions, then the second show. We have to clear out by 7:30PM.


This week we have:


Episode 9 ""Baelor""

Episode 10 "Fire and Blood"


All are welcome. If you have never watched Game of Thrones before and want to see what all the fuss is about, come on in and be enlightened. If you are a full fledged Maester trying to survive the Long Night between seasons come join us and watch the marvelous series again while vicariously enjoying the newbies reactions to the Game of Thrones.

NOTE- Newbies must identify themselves so us Maesters will have notice that you are there so we turn off MST3000 level of commentary!


This is a NEWBIE friendly event so our usual rules do not apply. Please no spoilers about the show or books in this newbie friendly environment (including this comment section). Anything already watched by the group as part of the Countdown is fair game to discuss by all, but no discussing the resolutions of things in the presence of our newbies. (Maesters will have their own anything goes events and time after the show). Newbies are of course welcome to theorize and forecast, but those of us who actually know "shall not pass" the information!


You can BYOF (bring your own food) and BYOB (bring your own beer and/or other drinks). There is a 7/11 on 33rd and Madison, a Wendys and a Smashburger and $1 Pizza on 33rd and 5th, and a Chipotle on 31st and Park (and other eats nearby too).
results.name: Game of Thrones Series Recap- Season 1 Finale Episodes 9 & 10

results.description:
• PLEASE, PLEASE arrive ready to read at 5PM!

•  Pot-Luck--Please remember to bring something to eat or drink to share with the group at the break;

• Please arrive on time. Subways are erratic on Sundays. Check the MTA schedule, text--or call--if you arrive late[masked];

• Please bring your own script; 

• Please do not wear perfume, cologne etc as some of our regulars have allergies and we sit in close proximity to one another;

• PLEASE REMEMBER TO CHANGE YOUR RSVP IF YOUR PLANS CHANGE;

Characters

Act 1

Clive, a colonial administrator
Betty, his wife, played by a man
Joshua, his black servant, played by a white
Edward, his son, played by a woman
Victoria, his daughter, a ventriloquist's dummy
Maud, his mother-in-law
Ellen, Edward's governess
Harry Bagley, an explorer
Mrs. Saunders, a widow (played by the same actress who plays Ellen)

Act 2 (25 years later)

Betty, now played by a woman (normally the same actress who plays Edward)
Edward, her son, now played by a man (normally the same actor who plays Betty)
Victoria, her daughter (normally played by the same actress who plays Maud)
Martin, Victoria's husband (normally played by the same actor who plays Harry)
Lin, a lesbian single mother (normally played by the same actress who plays Ellen/Mrs. Saunders)
Cath, Lin's daughter, age 5, played by a man (normally the same actor who plays Clive)
Gerry, Edward's lover (normally played by the same actor who plays Joshua)

Cloud 9 is a two-act play written by British playwright Caryl Churchill, workshopped with the Joint Stock Theatre Company in late 1978 and premiered at Dartington College of Arts, Devon, on 14 February 1979.[1]

The two acts of the play form a contrapuntal structure. Act I is set in British colonial Africa in the Victorian era, and Act II is set in a London park in 1979. However, between the acts only twenty-five years pass for the characters. Each actor plays one role in Act I and a different role in Act II - the characters who appear in both acts are played by different actors in the first and second. Act I parodies the conventional comedy genre and satirizes Victorian society and colonialism. Act II shows what could happen when the restrictions of both the comic genre and Victorian ideology are loosened.

The play uses controversial portrayals of sexuality and obscene language, and establishes a parallel between colonial and sexual oppression.[2] Its humour depends on incongruity and the carnivalesque, and helps to convey Churchill's political message about accepting people who are different and not dominating them or forcing them into particular social roles.

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, timed it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds will be honored only with a minimum of 24 hour cancelation.  No refunds for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

The school entrance is located on East 109th street between 2nd and 3rd avenues (near 2nd avenue) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right) and someone will open the door for you.

For questions,  use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

every 1st, 3rd, & 5th Sunday

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

BEGINNER AND INTERMEDIATE LESSONS: 6:00-6:45 PM

from 9/7-12/7, the intermediate lesson will be a performance class, see details below

---------------------------------------------------------------------------

-BEGINNERS WELCOME! We have a Basic lesson to start the night and some fantastic local instructors on hand to guide you, so tell ALL your friends!

-Featuring a wonderful mix of rotating DJs.

-Low cost, high fun at a nice venue

-Only $7 before 5:15 PM for more than 4 hours of dancing fun :-)

-2 Lessons: Basic & Intermediate at 6:00 PM

-Dance Party starts at 6:45 PM and goes 'till 12:00 AM

-$7 before 5:15 PM, $12 after

***************************************************************

------IMPORTANT ANNOUNCEMENT------From 9/7/14-12/7/14-----

In place of the intermediate class, we'll be offering an intermediate level routine and performance opportunity.

We will be teaching and cleaning the routine on 9/7, 9/21, 10/5, 10/19, 11/2, 11/16, 11/30

You will perform in the show on Sunday, December 7th.

There is NO CHARGE for the class!

All you need to do is pay for the admission to the dance and show up by 6:00 PM!

 

What YOU get out of this:

1) The opportunity to perform for a group of supportive dancers

2) The opportunity to learn, practice, and utilize skills that help you understand musicality, presentation, partnering, and phrasing.

3) A TON OF FUN

What We Need From YOU:

1) Just YOU - partner NOT required

2) The choreography will be taught over the first 5 sessions. You need to be in attendance at least 3 of the first 5 Sundays. You also need to attend the review sessions on the last two Sundays (11/16 & 11/30). So in total, of the 7 choreography sessions, you need to attend at least 5.

***************************************************************

All night drinks specials!

* $6 Sangria

* $16 1/2 Carafe of Sangria

* $5 Corona

* $2 Bottle of Water

 

LOCATION:

Dancesport

22 West 34th St, btw 5 & 6 Av

4th floor

Look forward to seeing you there!

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Pssssst: This dance is part of a collaboration of multiple dance styles using the same venue to offer different dance styles all at the same time. There's Bachata, Salsa, Zouk, Kizomba, and West Coast Swing all happening at the SAME place, at the SAME time, for the SAME price! So, you have the chance to check out FIVE different dances all for the price of 1!  The evening starts with a Bachata Lesson at 5:00 PM.  For More Information:  https://www.facebook.com/events/308507872585674/

results.description:
TNYA Water Polo is an LGBTQ friendly team with practices at John Jay College Friday 7:30 – 9:00 pm, Sunday from 6:00 – 7:30 pm, and Tuesday 8:00 or 9:00 - 10:00 pm at the Chelsea Rec Center (for Rec Center members only). For full information on the team, please go to www.tnya.org. 

The first practice is free and we love getting new players! Please let the coach on deck know if it's your first time with us and feel free to message Alex Barclay ahead of time if you have any questions. You will need to bring a swim suit appropriate for water polo, a towel, goggles and a lock. If you would like to practice with us regularly, you must become registered with US Water Polo at the silver level and pay our annual membership dues.

We ask that any practice participants have some prior experience playing water polo and be able to swim a hundred yards in a row in less than two minutes. If you have a swimming background and are interested in learning water polo, please read the pdf below thoroughly and contact Alex Barclay. The coaching is typically geared to an intermediate level of play and we do work on basic skills at every practice. Everyone should be familiar with the basic rules and concepts of the game, as outlined in this pdf: http://www.tnya.org/wp-content/uploads/2014/07/Polo_Beginners.pdf

Practices typically include a swim set and some conditioning at the beginning, drills, and scrimmaging for the last 30-45 minutes (it's also ok to sit out for the scrimmaging portion if it's your first practice). Bob or Jeff are the typical coaches. We strive to create a positive and welcoming environment and do not tolerate any unsportsmanlike conduct. There are at least four tournaments we compete in each year and practices will adjust in the weeks before the tournaments to prepare participating players.
results.how_to_find_us: Walk in. Pool is straight ahead. Tell the desk you're there for water polo.
results.name: TNYA Water Polo

results.description:
This event is hosted by Date Walking - The Easiest Way to Meet Someone Special.  


Join a bunch of singles in their 50s and 60's from multiple Meetup groups for a Singles Pizza Crawl. 

What is this Date Walking I keep hearing about? See the answer here: http://datewalking.nyc 

What is a pizza crawl and how does it work? It goes like this: We will be visiting 3 award-winning pizza places within a relatively short walking distance from each other that serve slices. We will consume a slice and then head to the next place to consume another slice and so on. When we have completed our pizza-eating crawl we can move onto more important matters, like drinking.


For those of you who can't or don't want to eat 3 slices, I have a solution: You can buddy up with someone and split slices so by the end of the crawl you will only have eaten 1 and a half slices. Problem solved. 

We will meet at 6 PM at the base of the Washington Square Park Arch and get to know each other for 30 minutes. Be advised that if you show up even 1 minute late you will miss us.  

How will you find us? Look for the group of people standing at the base of the Washington Square Park Arch</a> and then look for the tallest guy there. That will be Beau, your <a href="http://www.meetup.com/DateWalking/">Date Walk organizer. If you are unsure you can call Beau at[masked] and he will wave you over to where the group is. 

When you come to the event pay $10 and I will provide you with a ticket that’s good for 30-days. Hold onto the ticket and come to any/all Date Walking events for 30 days. Just show your ticket and you're good to go. 

Why am I paying you a fee for a place I can go to for free? See the answer here. 

If you have any questions prior to or on the day of the event, please do not hesitate to give me a call or text at [masked]

Thank you, 
Beau, your Date Walking Organizer 
  Call/Text:[masked] 
Email: [masked] 
Date Walking | Facebook | Twitter

results.description:
Prepay at http://www.weekenddating.com/upcoming.shtml?eventid=5930 is required. 

Sunday, NOVEMBER 1st @ 6 PM 
(Premingle at 4:30 PM) 

**Exclusive Private tour for our group.. The museum will be closed to the public** 


Museum of the American Gangster Tour for Singles

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FiRbqNyVskg 


This is a great event where you can step back in time and relive the days of the American Gangster.  At the same time, meet some fun singles, make some new friends and maybe more at this great  event.

==================================================== 

How it works 

The tour starts at 6 PM SHARP, however we will have a pre-mingle at 4:30 at a local bar/pub (location announced only to those who registered/paid) where we will introduce you to the other attendees and give you admission tickets to the museum.

Next we head to the museum for a Guided Group Tour.  

Note: This event is open to all ages and is not meant to be gender/age specific. 

=============================================== 
Itinerary

4:30 PM- Premingle to meet other attendees

*6PM- Group Tour

================================================== 

About the Museum:

Housed in a former speakeasy, the Museum of the American Gangster isn’t obvious on a casual stroll down St. Mark’s Place. If visitors know to look for number 80, though, they pass through a black gate and up a flight of stairs, where a plethora of artifacts and exhibits awaits. The museum focuses on American organized crime through the decades, which includes profiling mob bosses, Prohibition-era gangsters, serial bank robbers, and dastardly Scooby-Doo villains. The New York Times praised co-owner and tour guide Lorcan Otway as "so encyclopedic that touring the rooms takes hours," as he expounds upon America's unique relationship with hedonism and straight-laced morality. In the Wall Street Journal, correspondent Alexandra Cheney mentions noteworthy finds including the museum's genuine Tommy guns, vintage whiskey bottles, and old copper stills.


- BUY TICKETS
results.name: Museum of American GANGSTER tour/ pre-Mingle - (Must Prepay)

results.description:
We will be hosting our 2015/2016 indoor doubles tennis season at Cary Leeds Tennis Center!  (<a>Click here for directions</a>).

Each session will consist of 2 hours of competitive doubles tennis on Sunday nights from 6pm to 8pm. 


Here's what you need to know:

REQUIRED EXPERIENCE LEVEL [3.0]
The required level for this meetup is 3.0. In other words, you should understand the rules of doubles tennis and be able to serve and hit groundstrokes consistently. 

If you are a beginner that's still learning the basics, unfortunately this meetup isn't for you. For those beginners, I am working on an indoor option for you... stay tuned. 

RSVPing + FEE
The fee for our indoor meetups is $20. This fee needs to be paid upfront to solidify your RSVP.  After you RSVP, you will have 24 hours to make a payment. If the payment is not made, I will remove your RSVP to make room for someone else.

Each meetup will start with a 4-person RSVP limit. I am booking one court at a time this year. Once the first court is booked and paid for. I will open up the RSVP list for the next court. DO NOT BE DETERRED BY A WAITING LIST!

PAYMENT INSTRUCTIONS
While I would prefer to use meetup's option for payment, the fees they charge would make it less cost effective for everyone involved. So, I will contact everyone individually (or through the meetup comments) to request payments via PayPal. 

My PayPal email address is [masked]. 

WHAT SHOULD I BRING?
Bring your racquet + a fresh brand new can of tennis balls. 

WHAT WILL HAPPEN DURING THE MEETUP?
First, you will be assigned to a court.
There will be a 10-minute warmup.
After that, we will begin play.

RULES DURING PLAY
Standard USTA rules will apply with the following provisions:
1 Set Matches
No-AD games (this means there will be no deuce. At 40 all, whoever wins the next point takes the game.)
If the set goes to 6 all, you will play a No-AD tiebreak (first to 7 wins).

WHAT HAPPENS WHEN WE FINISH A SET?
After your set is complete, you will stay on the same court and switch partners with the other team.  I intend to have this planned out beforehand so expect an organized sets of matches for the night.

ANYMORE QUESTIONS?
If you have any other questions, concerns, or comments; please send them to our head organizer, Frank Tirado via email.

(Leader- Joanne)

New Rules: RoundRobin 3 teams of 4 players. Teams rotate every 10 minutes. Please bring a white shirt, a dark shirt(black,navy,dark grey) and a bright colored shirt(red,blue,yellow,orange,pink,green)

We'll have a dark team, white team and the colors team

Arrive on time 6:15pm!!! Late comers will wait on the sidelines to be placed in the game.

We start at 6:30pm.

4v4 small goals

Rules:

Fun Play
No Sliding
Goals after half point only.
kick-ins.. no throw ins.
Corner kicks.
Kick-off at midpoint after each goal.

To promote generosity, honor and respect, PS2G plays clean soccer!! This means No Cursing, Insulting, Complaining, Arguing or Fighting! We welcome you if this is your usual style and you want to change your attitude to fit our culture.

The fee is  $4 via paypal, The proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

Bring indoor shoes or sneakers, Dark,colors and white shirt

Please be sure you are definitely showing up when RSVPing.
Refunds are only given when PS2G cancels a game. If the game is canceled, please go to this link <http://ps2g.org/games/refund-request>; for a refund.

There is a minimum of 3v3 with 6 RSVPs needed to have a game. Game will be cancelled if this number is not reached 1 hour before the game time. Check comments for updates from Game Leader.

If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free. http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G enables soccer players to organize fundraising pickup games that support our charity network ultimately promoting the safe play of soccer for disadvantaged children.

Disclaimer By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.

results.description:
"Tuning the mind, body, and soul"-Gaynor

The sound and silence meditation group meets every Sunday. The meditation begins with 30 min. of  toning*, 30 minutes of silent meditation, In the last 10 min. there is time for a brief discussion, questions, or sharing.


According to Gaynor (1999, p. [masked]), "Sounds enters the healing equation from several different directions: It may alter cellular functions through energetic effects; it may entrain biological systems to function more homeostatically; it may becalm the mind and therefore the body; or it may have emotional effects, which influence neurotransmitters and neuropeptides, which in turn help regulate the immune system-the healer within. Music is organized sound that has potent emotional effects and stimulates memories, associations, and highly developed  psychological states with clear impact on our healing systems."

 Toning* in your own voice is a very powerful tool for self-healing, relaxation, personal growth, opening creativity, and helping to balance life experiences.Toning is the elongation of a note or tone using breath and voice to assist you to get still enough to meditate.
It is great.....
• If you have a difficult time getting still enough to meditate;
• If you desire higher states of consciousness;
• If your communication energy center seems blocked;
• If you breathe too shallowly;
• If you need immediate grief or stress relief;
• If you're depressed;
• If you need more confidence or zest;
• If you have trouble listening, focusing or being in the moment

We look forward to seeing you at the next scheduled meet-up!Please e-mail me at [masked] if you have any questions or concerns.
results.name: Sound and Silence Meditation

Every week dozens of CRC members and friends gather to socialize, network and connect following the 5:30 mass at Holy Trinity. It is a great way for new members and those who have been coming out for a while to meet others in our community.  This week we invite you join us in the parish center under the church for a free Pizza Party! 


Please RSVP so we can figure out how many pies to get.

Can I come alone?  Yes, many people come on their own.  We will have council members looking out for new members to introduce to others.

What if I belong to another parish or went to an earlier mass?  That's fine, just come for the party.

How should I dress?  Like you did for mass

What is the cost and what is included?  There is no cost but if you would like to make a donation we will accept it!

We do ask that you consume responsibly so that everyone can have something!


How long do you guys stay?  Usually till about 8:30-9pm

There will be a meditation, sharing, educational readings, role playing and fun activities as well as support for each other.

results.description:
New Swing Dance Session With Spencer @ The JCC in Manhattan

334 Amsterdam Avenue, New York, NY @76th street

 with  Spencer Weisbond

Six week, progressive session

  102: Advanced Beginner -  7:30 -8:30pm Advance in Jitterbug and East Coast Swing by learning more involved patterns with harder footwork. Build your dance vocabulary and partnering skills. This class is the prerequisite for Lindy Hop (level 3), which is the grandfather of all swing dances and has 8-count patterns. No partner needed


  103: Lindy Hop﻿ Pre-Intermediate 8:30- 9:30pm
Bring all your moves together into complete sequences. Learn new eight-count patterns to make your dance more intricate and expressive.  

  Teacher: Spencer Weisbond please call me with questions about your level[masked]
Level one is now on Wednesday nights!
  Register and pricing below:

  Level 102:  http://ebiz.jccmanhattan.org/personifyebusiness/Programs/ProgramDetail.aspx?pid=633153420</a>

Level 103: http://ebiz.jccmanhattan.org/personifyebusiness/Programs/ProgramDetail.aspx?pid=634125361<a href="http://ebiz.jccmanhattan.org/personifyebusiness/Programs/ProgramDetail.aspx?pid=631567294">

</a>

Spencer has been dancing swing since 1998. He has studied Lindy hop extensively with 4 time world champion and 8 time American champion, Nathalie Gomes. Spencer had led the outreach program for Hop Swing And & Jump dance studios at local venues around NYC.
Spencer has had his own program in swing at the JCC in Manhattan for over 8 years, and also teaches privately. He has taught for Lincoln Center’s “Midsummer Night Swing” He currently organizes the New York City Swing Dance Meetup Group, which has over 3400 members, making it one of the most active swing dance clubs in the world. Spencer also co-founded the popular NYC dance  event “Swing Remix”. <a href="http://www.SwingRemix.com">www.SwingRemix.com </a>

<a href="http://ebiz.jccmanhattan.org/personifyebusiness/Programs/ProgramDetail.aspx?pid=135408">

results.description:
Great Meetup this sunday! It was good to see everyone, i like that alot of people met each other. Were doing this again this sunday but back to the 8pm show, the club wasnt too happy that there were so many of us in the bar for so long and it makes sense. I dont have the lineup yet but i will update it as i get it tomorrow. See you then! Were gonna continue doing this as long as the club lets us.

This is a special Meetup, we finally got a deal with Stand Up New York the hottest club in New York City to let us in free of charge and see comics like Amy Shumer, Godfrey, Kevin Brennan and top names, this is NOT an amateur show like alot of the meetups. I just ask that everyone who Rsvp's really do their best to show up AND MAKE IT ON TIME. as you know I dont charge for this meetup so come out see the hottest comedy show and maybe even make some new friends. this sundays line up includes the below.

Host: Maddog Mattern, Jared Freid (MTV), Sam Morril (Last Comic Standing, Conan), Greer Barnes (In Living Color), Teddy Smith (Comedy Central), Steve Marshall and pretty much any comic you see on Comedy Central these days drops by and shows up on the lineup who knows who might drop by usually its Amy Shumer or Judah Friedlander.

I will be at the front end of the bar by the iphone charger as usual to meet with everyone and give you tickets for free admission and have everyone sit together so we can all share laughs. Try to be early the show starts at 8 and everyone sits at same table but i do this earlier so all of you can meet your fellow meetup members.

This is a 2 show ticket, so if you show up for the 8 you can stay for the ten also which has a different but also comedy central lineup. Or if you would like to come for the 10 you can just say meetup at the door and they will point you to me.
results.name: Comedy Central Meetup at Stand Up NY Complimentary Tix, Sam Morril, Greer barnes

results.description:
We've planned this now as a weekly meetup, so that everyone in the group can get together even if the moderator can't be there.

If Darren can't make it to introduce everyone (he can't this week), could someone please take it upon themselves to 1) stake out the big table a little early, 2) Lead a go-around-the-horn o? introductions at 8pm, and 3) Time the 60 minutes of writing time and let everyone know when it's 9 pm.

As always,

Please RSVP only if you can make it, and update as soon as possible if your plans change. We have had far too many no-shows.

You will see progress in your writing project by spending the minimum of a single hour per week on it. This is your practice/focus time, so I hope to see you there.

Join other writers for an hour of focused writing!

7-8 pm - Show up early, stake out a spot and either socialize or get a jump on writing.
8:00 - Start. Introductions, and we'll share what we're working on
8:05 - Get down to business. An hour of silence and solid writing!
9:05- Brief follow up. People are encouraged to share experiences & ideas, network or take off as they like. Feel free to keep writing if you've got the momentum going! Be aware Argo closes at 10pm.
If you're spending too much time THINKING about writing, come and join us for a session of focused writing. It may just be "pipe-cleaning" for now, but you'll feel better showing up at the page. No one will see what you've written or give you unsolicited advice.

WHERE: Argo Tea Cafe, Columbus Circle Subway Station. 1792 Broadway.

SOME TIPS:

Argo has plenty of outlets - we will be on the back, large table.
Seats are hard to come by, and I can only save so many, so please, come on time! If you come late, we might have already started.
The music and occasionally nonmember conversation can be loud, so bring headphones too.
WiFi is available with purchase.
It's a little chilly, so if you get cold bring a sweater.
And it goes without saying that buying a cup of joe or a snack from Argo for being nice enough to host us will bring you good writing karma.
If you aren't sure you can make it, please don't RSVP! Come on time or even a little early, as it can be difficult to save seats.
results.name: NYC Shut Up & Write Meetup! - Columbus Circle

results.description:
10,000 PB&Js is a volunteer led organization meets each week in White Plains & the lower east side to make and assemble several hundred meals and then distribute them in small teams throughout Manhattan to the homeless. 

The PB&Js and Hershey Kisses are their starting point: a means to begin a conversation, to listen and lay the foundation of trust necessary to offer more substantial help.

This event is for PB&J DISTRIBUTION:


Volunteers gather on East 11th for orientation, then break up into teams of 3 or 4 volunteers who distribute food, clothing & toiletries on pre-assigned routes. Finish times vary by team: some will be done before 11 pm and other teams might work until midnight. 

THIS IS A RECURRING EVENT!
10,000 PB&Js typically feeds a couple hundred neighbors each Sunday and would be thrilled to extend a up to 6 distribution spots for our group each week!


TO JOIN
Please email P.J. directly at [masked]. Or check out their Meetup group: www.meetup.com/10000PBandJs

Good nutrition is the core, for good health and successful weight loss, and good energy nutrition is important as well.

This will help you to relax, recharge, replenish, and will help you with stress eating, cravings, and to keep focused, and to feel better about your body and yourself.

A special and delicious vitamin essence, will fill you up with good nutrition, which will help you fill up with the good stuff, therefore you will feel more satisfied with less food, and helps you to absorb the nutrients your body needs.

This will also relax and strengthen your adrenal glands, and help to revitalize all of your glands and organs.

I really hope you enjoy this gift, and if you have any questions  concerns, please let me know.

It's that easy, and then you can just relax and enjoy! Do not worry about falling asleep, because the energies work great while you're sleeping. They will work even if you are distracted or if you forget.

results.description:
This one workout will keep you amped up all week long. Seriously, give it a try and you will be hooked!


The exercises may change from week to week, but it is always a Tabata-style interval workout: 20 seconds of high intensity work followed by 10 seconds of rest. Then repeat! Exercises include sprints, burpees, squats, situps, box jumps, step ups, pushups, dips, and other “no-frills” exercises.


Warm up beforehand by running, biking, or walking. We start promptly at 6:30 AM and the workout only lasts 31 minutes. Show up a few minutes early to meet people and get yourself pumped up.

results.description:
Every week we will have a different prompt for our weekly photo project.  This week’s theme is Texture.

Each week beginning early Monday morning, you can begin uploading your photos to our meetup album for the week’s theme.  The group won’t actually meet for this event, it’s an individual online challenge for each of you to get your creative juices flowing, share photos in the group, comment and critique each other’s shots, and above all have fun. 

Albums will remain open, so you can upload photos any time after that Monday morning start time but you’ll get the most feedback during the initial week the theme is posted.  You also don’t have to restrict yourself to photos taken during that week for the theme, they can be from past shoots you have done or the weekly prompt can be used to motivate you to shoot something new.

results.description:
Do you ever wonder:

How do I attract the RIGHT guy?
How to identify unavailable men early on?
What do men want in a committed relationship?
How do I get him to want to commit to me?
How do I keep him?

If you want to get answers to these and other commitment-related questions, then I have great news for you.

My F.REE 21-day video training event “From Dating to Commitment” is about to open and I want you to be the first one to join. 

I personally interview each of the 21 industry’s top Dating and Relationship experts over several weeks. Like me, most of them happen to be in a committed relationship and have helped thousands of smart professional women create meaningful and lasting relationships.

Click here to join now:
http://www.fromdatingtocommitment.com

Here’re some juicy details of what you’ll discover HOW TO:
-> Recognize red flags that will instantly tell you he isn’t commitment-ready during the first few dates.
-> Avoid the most devastating mistakes women make that sabotage their relationships and make men pull away. 
-> Get clarity about whether he and you are exclusive without assuming things or scaring him away.
-> Use a controversial strategy that will prevent you from getting into a non-commitment trap.
-> Learn shockingly simple techniques that will tell if a man you’re dating is open to and ready for a committed relationship.
-> Understand what men really want in a committed relationship and what makes men commit.
-> Inspire him to initiate a conversation about being exclusive early on in the dating process.
-> Talk about commitment with confidence and ease that will make you irresistible and desirable to him.
-> Make him think it was totally his idea to ask you to be his girlfriend or wife and let him act on it.
-> Walk away from a man who’ll never commit to you and let go of the hope that he’ll eventually change.
-> And much more…

You’ll also unlock the male mind and find out WHY:
-> Men don’t commit. 
-> Ultimatums don’t work.
-> Sex doesn’t lead to commitment.
-> Women value commitment.
-> Men make a decision to commit.
-> And much more… 

Plus, you’ll get over $1,197 in FREE GIFTS from all the experts.

The raw, intimate and vulnerable stories of not only discovered secrets, lessons learned, wins and successful results but also uncovered blocks, mistakes, pain and failures are what makes this video training event REAL, relevant and timely. 

Click here to join now: http://www.fromdatingtocommitment.com

You don’t have to struggle trying to figure out this “commitment thing” on your own. You don’t have to feel confused, anxious and uncertain about your love life. Like me, most experts personally have gone through what you might be dealing with right now. We’ll answer your biggest
questions that block you from enjoying a lasting and healthy relationship. 

It’s time to create CLARITY around your love life and help you get into a COMMITTED RELATIONSHIP that will give you love, certainty and fulfillment that you want and deserve. 

Imagine what it will feel like to never wonder what he’s thinking about you or never worry about where your relationship is going. imagine what it will feel like never questioning if he wants to be with you. 

Imagine situations in which you feel loved, desired and appreciated.

Imagine being invited to his cousin’s wedding and being introduced to everyone as his girlfriend. 

Imagine meeting your mutual friends for couples’ dinner and hearing him proudly say, “We got engaged!”

Imagine saying “I do” in your dream wedding surrounded by your closest friends and family. 

It’s priceless. 

If you want to feel desired, appreciated, confident and secure in your relationship for the long term—even for a lifetime—then it’s time to join us in this commitment-shifting event. 

But don’t just take my word for it. Join us and test it for yourself: http://www.fromdatingtocommitment.com

With love,
Polina
results.name: From Dating to Commitment Free Video Training Event

results.description:
"It was deep it was soulful, it was techno, it was disco, a kaleidoscope of sounds, it was truly underground. It was an essential mix in the cloud where we could dance and sing out loud. It was New York, Ibiza and Miami all wrapped up into one. There were speakers the size of skyscrapers and the stars they flickered like strobes, and everybody loved everybody else...I must have went to house heaven, because nothing’s that divine."                                                       

—Roland Clark

That’s right, we’re calling on all our DJ's to contribute for our weekly radio shows broadcast www.soundboxonline.com. What better way to keep those decks moving and keeping them from stagnating by pooling the tracks that tickle your fancy and inspire you as a DJ.


A mix is a great way to showcase your talent, the tracks that get you bumping and the tracks that have inspired you on the path of DJ-ing. So think of the bedroom as your house of worship. Honor it, pay reverence to it and give us a damn good mix worthy of the pantheon of the DJ gods on Mt. Olympus. 


Some common ground rules to ensure a quality mix and ensure serious commitment:

•  House, deep-house, tech-house, techno, minimal, EDM or any other genre that fits into the house category.


• High quality mp3/wav 320kbps. 

• Record a 1 hour mix without peaks, in other words; no clipping!


• Transitions need to be well segued, near flawless

• Sample mix required to ensure DJ commitment and whether or not you make the cut for the radio show


• A great profile pic


So once you’ve ticked all these off the list, you’re on your way to getting your DJ mix broadcasted. We’re especially reaching out to our new and beginning DJ's looking to make their mark. Send us a link where we can download your mix. Also send us a picture, so we can add it to the visual in case your mix has been selected for the weekly broadcast. Looking forward to hearing some great mixes.


Ayelmer Veenstra --- LMR

A.D.G. 

~ pls. send the visual and the link to (download) your mix to: [masked]

results.description:
A message from John:

I have noticed there are models that have joined the group that would like to start modeling with TheModels’Den (TMD). 

If you are a model and you want become a TMD Model you need to be interviewed and attend this casting call.

Please note the interviews and test shoots start at 3:30pm and end promptly at 6:00pm The last model intake will be at 5:00pm. When you RSVP you will be contacted for an approximate start time. 

Be prepared to be interviewed like you are applying for a job, not a modeling position. I am not looking for one time models but models that want to work consistently; that are team players; can collaborate with other models and have traits to work independently. 

What I look for in the interview: personality, personality, personality! It is imperative that applicants be naturally hospitable! Models must be honest, with a good sense of street smarts and have business sense; be a problem solver and resourceful; have a creative mind; and be a good communicator and responsible. ( RELIABLE with punctuality at the top of the list falls in line with being responsible). 

Bring a resume if you have. I’m looking for experience in any job or school. Have you ever volunteered for community service, helped organize events, played in a band, or do you have dancing experience, etc..?

What to expect as a model in TheModels’Den:

If you think that getting paid $200 for 2-1/2 hours is what it’s about, Then this job is not for you. You are an independent model with TMD promoting you. You will only succeed if you put all your effort into the events. It means: taking the time to be creative, research and scout venues, contact studios, make reservations, post your events and be in constant contact with members to listen to their suggestions and see if you can produce an event they request. 

This takes time and the photographers know it. Take shortcuts and it can be clearly seen at the events. That is why I am actively involved with the planning process until the model develops a constant work flow. 

In most cases for every hour an event is in length: it takes just a long to plan it and then some. 

STOP! If you want to model only and not put the work into it the prep, you best not apply. 

TMD offers models the opportunity to choose their own hours, pay, location and the type of modeling they want to do. All in the environment they choose. They decide whether to use a hairstylist or use a make-up artist. 

TMD offers photographers the opportunity to attend an event that is not overcrowded but an event that is well managed with photographers limited to a specific amount ( typically 3) where only one photographer is shooting at one time. 

Photographers are not required to provide pictures to models, saving the photographer countless of hours of editing. Editing only because they feel obligated to!

TMD recognizes that events like these are the photographers safe haven where they can come and practice, experiment, try new techniques or new equipment without having to be committed to anyone. Beginners and pros come for that purpose. 

WHY FREE MODELING IS NOT GOOD For anyone: 

For the photographer - Free model means trade for pictures. The problem is that time is money and editing pictures end up costing more money than paying a model. 

For the model - waiting for a trade in most cases ends up being a disappointment. The photos are not what they expected and in many cases they just don’t receive pictures. 

TRANSPARENCY is important at TMD - we value everyones time! We find the best models that can model effectively that show up, are willing to accommodate reasonable requests that permit the photographer to try new approaches that allows the photographer to improve their skills.

And sometimes the images just don't come out as expected! Lesson learned and we all still end up a happy family — on to the next event!

results.description:
Join Michael Rosenblum, founder of the New York Video School (www.nyvs.com) and author of 'iPhone Millionaire," as he explores what it takes to start your own video production business. Drawing from his wealth of experience working with BBC, The Voice of America, NYT Television, the Travel Channel Academy and more, Michael explains how we are at a critical point in the development of the video creation industry. With tips from his book, Michael will demonstrate just how easy it is for you to start and grow your own video production business this day and age.

This presentation will be held as two (2) repeat sessions - once at 4:00 PM and again at 6:00 PM. Please RSVP for the session that you'd like to attend.

ABOUT MICHAEL:
For more than 25 years, Mr. Rosenblum has been on the cutting edge of the digital videojournalist revolution. During this time, he has led a drive for video literacy, and the complete rethinking of how television and online video is made and controlled. A regular blogger for The Guardian (UK) and The Huffington Post, Michael is the author of Videojournalismus (Germany) and iPhone Millionaire: Six Weeks To Change Your Life (McGraw Hill 2012). His work has help found and shape the BBC's national network,  the Voice of America, NYT Television, and more.
results.name: Start Your Own Video Production Business With Michael Rosenblum

That being said, I reserve the right to remove you if I am not familiar with you or your abilities. If the  questions are not answered, I will also remove you from the going list.

Make sure you have a copy of the map, a headlamp, and minimum 2 liter of water.  If you fall behind during the hike, you must be prepared to finish on your own. Faster hikers are not obligated to wait for slower hikers. You must feel comfortable hiking out on your own should you fall behind. We would love to have everyone join but due the nature of a fast paced event we can not make accommodations for those who are unable to hike independently. This is not mean, it is for your protection as well as the safety of the group. If you are unsure whether or not this is for you, please email me with any questions.

Heavy rain may cancel and would be determined that day if necessary.

results.description:
45 minutes of diving into the teachings, techniques, and practice of Meditation, for new and experienced Meditators.

All meditations are meant to purify our heart and bring our mind to its natural condition. Our consciousness is inherently pure, eternal, full of knowledge and bliss. But somehow or other it has been covered by and adulterated by so many misconceptions, so many desires, so many longings, so many anxieties about what we want and what we don’t want. 

When you look into a mirror, you see yourself. But what if that mirror has been neglected for hundreds of years? There are layers and layers of debris, dust, dirt and filth. And when you look into that mirror, all you see is the dust and the dirt that is accumulated, and all that you think is “This is me!” But when you clean the mirror, little by little you start seeing the image of yourself. And when the mirror is actually clean, you see who you are. Meditation is for that purpose; prayers are for that purpose; spirituality is for that purpose: to cleanse our heart, to cleanse our life-style so that we can actually directly experience our own essence, which is eternal, full of knowledge and full of love
results.name: Let's meet up and Meditate

results.description:
We will be reimbursing you for your train ticket. Please keep your receipt! There will be a shuttle taking you between the train station and the hearing. 

To arrive in Long Beach by 6pm, the trains leave at 4:40pm or 5pm. However, come even if you will be late. It doesn't matter what time you arrive, it just matters that you come! Train schedule 

This is our last chance to send a powerful message to Governor Cuomo urging him to veto this dangerous proposal!

Port Ambrose is a liquefied natural gas (LNG) port that has been proposed for the New York Harbor. 

This project would damage our marine ecosystem, place us at risk from terrorist attacks, and promote the industrialization of our coastline. It is also proposed for the same site as a wind farm. Port Ambrose would block a green, clean, renewable source of energy.

Fortunately, Governor Cuomo, as well as New Jersey's Governor Christie, has the authority to veto the project.

We need EVERYONE to turn out and send a message to Governor Cuomo that we will not allow our oceans and beaches to be put in danger. The time is now....tell Cuomo to veto Port Ambrose!

Port Ambrose Final Hearing

November 2nd, 2015

6pm-10pm

Long Beach Hotel, 405 East Broadway, Long Beach, 11561

We'll be there along with our friends at Food & Water Watch, Surfrider Central Long Island Chapter, Sane Energy Project, Clean Ocean Action, United for Action, Catskill MountainKeeper
results.name: Port Ambrose Final Hearing

results.description:
The Grassroots Alliance has long worked to stop Port Ambrose LNG. These are the FINAL PUBLIC HEARINGS in NY. This is our last official chance to say NO to this project. We really need everyone to attend and testify. 

The NJ hearings take place on Nov 4+5. November 6th opens the 45-day window for the governors to veto Port Ambrose. If the governors do not act, it's an automatic approval. To get them to veto it, we need massive turnout at each hearing. More info about Port Ambrose here. 

This is a crucial project to kill: If it passes, it's a deal breaker for the Rockaway wind farm. That would be a massive loss: for green energy, for green jobs, for the safety and welfare of the entire NYC and Long Island communities.  

The January hearings were held in a remote location on an icy, zero-degree day, and we STILL had 600 people present. Let's double those numbers this time!


Long Beach is an easy ride from Penn Station or Atlantic terminal in Brooklyn. The hotel is a 19-minute walk from the LIRR station in Long Beach, and groups are working on arranging shuttle cars and possibly buses for those who can't make the walk. Stay tuned for more about that later. 

Please just plan on being there by any means you can. Also please attend the training on Monday, Oct 26th (see that meetup to RSVP for that).
results.name: TESTIFY AGAINST PORT AMBROSE LNG

Overview:

Using Ecommerce tools, like WixStores, allows you as a small business owner or entrepreneur to easily build a stunning online store and become an effective merchant! Join David "Dedi" Scwartz VP of Ecommerce, Boost and Bookings as he provides you with key insights and actionable information such as:

1. The importance of stunning ecommernce store design as a tool to solve the trust crises for small merchants 

2. Everyone can sell - How diy tools can allow anyone to easily start an online store

3. Be an effective merchant - What tools are out there that can allow you to drive more traffic to your ecommerce store

About the Speaker:

David "Dedi" Schwartz is VP of eCommerce, Bookings and Boost at Wix. David is the successful founder of several start-ups including Jogli (DMG), PeerApp Technologies, and WebMap Technologies. Drawing on his vast and diverse experience, David has guest lectured throughout the high-tech industry as well as at the Hebrew University MBA program on issues ranging from product development and management to marketing and innovation trends. 


About the Venue:

Thank you to Wix.com for hosting us at the Wix Lounge. Wix.com enables you to build a free and professional online presence, just the way you want it. With an HTML5 drag-and-drop website editor, 100s of web apps, designer-made templates, and tons of features, Wix gives you the tools to launch and manage your online presence.

So what are you waiting for? Sign up for a free Wix workshop today!

This is a class in technique although, when you've conquered a song technically, then I will coach musicality and performance. Class size is limited. Fee is $20/per. You may audit the class once (without participating) for $10. Let me know when you sign up if that's your intention.

  Room assignment will be printed on the electronic billboard opposite the elevators on floor 16.

   People at the front desk are helpful and friendly and the Cafe on the floor has great coffee and cookies, sandwiches, <a>pizza</a>, etc.

   I've been asked to post this:

Dear Members: I am Mr. Harrington's agent/rep. Mr. Harrington teaches privately coaching established actors and singers. For years his private rate has been $120/hr for this service. He started teaching through Meetup earlier this year and has as his goal to bring professional level instruction to the public at a rate that leaves no one behind. This demands tight scheduling of both his time and the room rental with Ripley-Grier Studios.For these reasons, I will be insisting to him that "no shows" be dropped from the group. The policy is this: If you RSVP you better show up. If you cancel you better do this by 4:00 pm the previous day.A word to the wise...Michael T. Harvey

results.description:
Come for the sheer joy of moving to the music, in a nurturing and supportive setting.

Whether you have never danced before or want to continue, this is a class for you.

The classes are one hour and half in length and provide quality instruction.

Ballet is one of the most healthy and intense forms of dance.
It can provide a complete full-body workout, increasing your flexibility, range of motion and strength.

It’s also a great alternative to aerobics.

The classes are on-going, join in anytime.

PRICES Walk-Ins: $20.
Package: $180 for a card of 10 classes (over a course of 6 months).
Talk to us about multiple class per week discount!

ABOUT THE INSTRUCTOR
Bruce Weitzmon is a choreographer, dancer and teacher. His work has been presented in the U.S.A. and Canada. Bruce was the director of the Theater Dance Center, a non-profit dance education and performance organization in Rockland County, founded in 1981. After many years directing TDC, he returned to New York City to teach. Now after more than 10 years there, he is returning to offer a weekly schedule of classes in Nyack, NY.

VISIT US ON FACEBOOK
For more about the Dancers’ Art class schedule, rates or any additional information please visit and like Dancers’ Art on Facebook at www.facebook.com/DancersArt or call[masked]-1973.

Thank you for making our now WEEKLY event "Jadore le French" a great success : c’était ma première surprise partie :-) Pictures posted below ! Let's meet again at Cellar Bar to speak French (or at least try a bit with Manhattans).

French is not such a difficult language. If Rocky Balboa can speak Russian, if Rambo can speak Dari, then everybody can speak French, just a question of time :-) The new format "Jadore-le-French" is even nicer than our "Pardon-my-French" of last year.

http://crepesanddelices.com


Come and get rewards by :

1. Dressing super nicely

2. Showing progress in your French skills (whatever you start from)

None of these are an obligation, neither a demand, just an incentive for rewards (perfumes, hats, free bottles of wine etc.).

Who are the organizers ? Yara, Handsome President, and Jean-Philippe, Glorieux Président. Since 3 weeks, Amelia, aka Superamelia, has joined the team as Hostess Étincelante.

IN THREE YEARS, WE HAVE ORGANIZED HUNDREDS OF SOCIAL EVENTS, FRENCH LESSONS/WORKSHOPS, FRENCH CONCERTS (including launching Flo, now superstar!) etc.
