results.description:
Topic: EDI

Electronic data interchange (EDI) is the computer-to-computer exchange of business documents between companies. EDI replaces the faxing and mailing of paper documents.

EDI documents use specific computer record formats that are based on widely accepted standards. However, each company will use the flexibility allowed by the standards in a unique way that fits their business needs.

Linda will demonstrate a project that uses data in an EDI format.

The project includes:

• Locating the data.

• Filter form.

• Selecting zip codes to be used in the data base.

The Microsoft Conference Center, is free of charge, at 41st Street and 8th Avenue, (NorthEast corner... i.e. not in Port Authority). Ignore the note on this page, which says, "Max: 1 person". We never max out room capacity. The reason it says it's maxed out, is because I can't sign you up through meetup.com. To RSVP, please send an email to: LindaEwen at nyc dot rr dot com, with your first and last name. We plan on meeting on the 1st Monday of every month, but occasionally there are changes. You should receive an email, if there's a change. I suggest you print out any email response you receive, even though it's not required. The Conference Center's security department, requires your first and last name, so please include your full name, within the body of your email. A photo ID is mandatory. Sometimes, the map on this meetup link above, is incorrect, so please write down the address. If you don't get an email back from anyone, within a day or two, please send a 2nd request.It's OK, to be half an hour early and use the free coffee machine. Try to go early, if it's your first time, in case you are not registered properly. If you arrive, and the the security personnel informs you of a registration problem, don't be alarmed, they will assist you. Please be patient, (no seating limitation). For those who sent their first email request, on the day of the event, this process may take half an hour, and the cut off time for confirmation is 7:00 PM. If you would like to use meetup to remind yourself, find the duplicate listing of this event at http://www.meetup.com/Spreadsheets/events/calendar/

results.description:
Since PUNTO Space is a new performance and events venue with space to rent to artists and also the home of the resident theater company, Nettles Artists Collective, we decided to kick-off a series of performance labs! For our firstMeetUp, we thought a social media cheat sheet lab was a great way to show our space off because with so many demands on artists and an abyss of social media options, we couldn't help but wonder if there wasn't a social media shortcut that could make our lives a little easier.  

Performing arts professionals, artists and actors, we are thrilled to invite you to join PUNTO Space and the Nettles Artists Collective, in a social media cheat sheet lab presented by Kissing Lions Public Relations.

Anyone who knows PUNTO Space, knows we love the arts! All performing arts professionals welcome!

At PUNTO Space, we know how essential it is to stay in an authentic place as an artist while you share your story in your own unique way on media platforms you understand.  It's not always easy for performers to navigate, but that is why it's especially important to have creative resources, camaraderie within your creative community and the ability to collaborate in a space that embraces who you are!  

To attend this FREE MeetUp, you must RSVP above and join our group.  Take a look HERE!

Book your rehearsal space at PUNTOSpace.com or call[masked]

<a href="http://bit.ly/PuntoSpace"></a>
results.name: PUNTO Performers Lab: Social Media Cheat Sheet!

results.description:
This is a weekly improv class appropriate for all levels (including beginners).  The focus will be on scenework, rather than games.

-- Are you a bit shy and looking to get more comfortable with your public speaking? 


-- Are you a working professional hoping to be a bit more spontaneous during your meetings and interactions with co-workers? 

-- Or are you an actor or improv comedian looking to take your craft to the next level or get more reps?

Then this is the class for you! In this class, you will learn the fundamentals of scene work (role playing). You'll be on your feet quite a bit as I'm believer that you learn (and have more fun) through doing rather than hearing an instructor talk. Brief individual notes will be given, if that's what you're looking for, and tailored to your level of experience. At the end of each class, I'm confident you'll feel a sense of accomplishment that will leave you more energized and excited to tackle the challenges of everyday life, whether at your work place or in your personal life. 

Each class is $10, and the fee is used to help cover the cost of the room rental, Meetup fees, and website.  Guaranteed satisfaction or your money back.  

Hope to see you there,

Steve

www.improvnow.com

www.facebook.com/improvnow

Steve Ling is an alumnus of the improv programs of the Upright Citizens Brigade, Peoples Improv Theater, Magnet Theater, & Annoyance Theater.  He regularly produces and performs improv, musical improv, & hip hop improv across NYC.
results.name: Improv NOW! - Monday Improv Scenework Class 6-8pm ($10)

The Alley Boost Expo VIP Mixer will be a private mixer the day before the Alley Boost Startup Expo that will be made up of exhibitors, sponsors, press, and investors. We are making 50 tickets available to the general public.

The evening will be made up of startup/tech networking and story sharing. If you don't have a specific agenda, hang out and mingle with like-minded folks and enjoy the great atmosphere. Who knows who you'll meet or what you'll learn! You must be 21+ to attend.

You can learn more about the Expo here - https://www.eventbrite.com/e/alley-boost-startup-expo-tickets-17364991156

Thank you to our sponsors!

Businesses are dynamic. Commercial Real estate is not. PivotDesk is an office-sharing marketplace that matches offices with excess space to companies that need it. Flexible agreements eliminate the risk of a long-term lease, allowing entrepreneurs to offset costs so they can focus on what's most important—growing their business. 


Moisan Legal P.C. utilizes technology to foster a collaborative client/attorney interaction. Our goal is to be your ongoing strategic resource and enable your business to operate effectively. 

For nearly 20 years, Premier has been the Bay Area's go-to staffing resource for the emerging growth and tech industries. Today, Premier brings their expertise to New York City, where they continue to place rockstar candidates in the functional areas of Administration, Operations, HR and Sales. From Contract/Temp to Contract-to-hire and Direct hire, Premier helps disruptive companies find the best talent to fuel the growth of their business. 


TeachCode was developed through piloting an introductory, standards-based Python curriculum at a high-needs urban school. The pilot study showed that detailed materials, paced appropriately with proper support, yielded positive results for teachers and students who had never written code before. TeachCode was developed to address the needs of business teachers or others who want to help children learn about code and STEM, but who do not have the skills in technology to develop age appropriate, differentiated curriculum and assessments.

The TeachCode curriculum is created by educator, software test engineer, and TeachCode founder Dr. Jessica Ingrassellino. Jessica has taught the teach code curriculum in schools to students from sixth through twelfth grades, and she feels strongly that learning to code should be available to both teachers and students for low or no cost. 

TeachCode seeks to bring the opportunity to learn code to people in the most underserved communities: people who are consumers of technology, but who might not get to create with or for that technology. Additionally, TeachCode seeks to bring communities together through partnerships between colleges, K-12 schools, and TeachCode, to create a supportive learning environment that inspires students, supports teachers, and encourages lifelong learning for all.

Vantagon is a technology company focused in developing software solutions for collaboration and research. Unlocking the potential in Life Sciences breakthroughs with better data management and artificial intelligence, as well as providing productivity solutions through Taskflight, its enterprise management app for tasks and objectives.

Hey Bartender! Take Monday off! 

Mise Technologies, the premier developers of applications for bars and restaurants, has just released Stockboy. Stockboy is our subscription-based inventory management app for iOS and Android devices. With Stockboy, bartenders are able to perform inventory, find the best suppliers, create and send POs, and generate reports on usage and cost of goods sold. What once took hours will now take mere minutes, saving you not only money but some sweet, sweet time. 

Stockboy, it's everything you need for inventory management in one place.

A LEAN Business increases Cash Flow, Productivity, Customer Satisfaction and Profits with one simple activity. Taking time to understand: What are we doing? Why are we doing it? And howwell are we doing it? Monitoring your business processes will prevent “waste and inefficiencies” from choking the business and unlock the growth and profits desired.

Using the LEAN methodology, we can help you simplify processes, identify problems and fix them. We also train your business managers, project managers and analysts how to use tools to keep your business LEAN.

Attend a Free Webinar on “How to Create a Lean Business” – Register at http://myleanbiz.com/freewebinar

Contact us today to learn more! (718)[masked] --[masked] 

Washington Law is a boutique law firm representing startups, small businesses, and individuals. We invest in developing long-term client relationships and take pride in providing tailored, cost-effective strategies to meet our clients'’ needs. The firm represents a wide range of clients including tech startups, entrepreneurs, investment firms, real estate companies and fashion and beauty lines. With a broad array of experience in practice areas including business law, intellectual property, technology, civil litigation, media, estate planning, and real estate, we provide effective, knowledgeable counsel to tomorrow's business leaders.

English 3 students will already have a working knowledge of the basics of English conversation and will be able to read and to write simple paragraphs.  They will be introduced to compound verb tenses. The principal objectives of Level 3 are to enhance the students’ fluency, their vocabularies and their comprehension of spoken and written English.  Students will actively participate in activities drawn from real life.

Inglés Nivel 3 alumnos ya tendrán un conocimiento práctico de los conceptos básicos de conversación en inglés y serán capaces de leer y escribir párrafos simples. Los alumnos también serán introducidos a la combinación de los tiempos verbales. Los principales objetivos de nivel 3 son mejorar la fluidez de los estudiantes, mejorar el vocabulario y mejorar la comprensión general de inglés hablado y escrito. Los estudiantes participarán en actividades similares a varias posibilidades de comunicación en inglés en la vida real.

Level 1 is an introduction to the Spanish language. Students will learn to form and answer simple questions and hold simple conversations on topics such as family, home, food, health and employment. Through interactive dialogues, games and songs, the structure of simple sentences in the present tense will be practiced.

El Nivel 1 de español es una introducción al lenguaje.  Los estudiantes aprenderán a formar y contestar preguntas sencillas y a mantener conversaciones sencillas sobre temas como la familia, el hogar, la alimentación, la salud y el empleo.  A través de diálogos interactivos, juegos y cantos, se practicará la estructura de oraciones sencillas en el tiempo verbal presente.

Our small, yet intrepid band of heroes returns to Everlund, staggeringly powerful, evil, magical artifact in tow. Their intent is to do as they were instructed and deliver the artifact to the grubby hands of the one who hired / coerced them to retrieve it in the first place.

But their travel plans are interrupted. They meet a rather troublesome elf named Danis and agree to travel with him. But this alliance lasts less than a full day and night when Danis attempts to pilfer the mage's spellbook. He's exiled from the group...so to speak.

The bigger problem they have is an overwhelming fog that has clouded their journey. When it finally lifts, they learn they're not in Elysia anymore. And that's when the werewolves come.

Our weekly Meet Up will take place at Scotty's Steakhouse and Comedy Cove in Springfield, just a bit off of exit 9B on Route 24! The address is 595 Morris Ave, Springfield.


There is a world of gaming outside of the traditional Monopoly/Scrabble/Risk/etc. Be adventurous and come learn some new games that will change the way you think about board games!

We begin gathering around 6pm and are fully underway by 7pm.

Because the event takes place at a restaurant that serves alcohol, there are strict rules against gambling of any form.  Guests under 21 are welcome, as it is a restaurant. Since they are letting us use the space for free, they expect that we will order food and drink, so there are some rules:

1.  No outside food or drink, not even bottled water.

2. Please plan on ordering food and/or drinks.  Support the venue.

3. Tip the waitstaff generously.  15% is standard, but 20% is even better. We want them to love having us there, and in this case, money does buy you love.


We bring some of our games, but feel free to bring your favorites, or learn one of ours! And don't be shy about learning new games, we are more than willing to teach a new player! Can't wait to see you there.

results.description:
Currently, over 50 percent of the world’s population lives in cities. By 2050 over two-thirds of people will reside in urban environments. Although city living has many advantages, residing in cities is often associated with a high cost of living, and high crime rates, and large population density. Research has also shown that people who grow up in cities process negative emotions such as stress differently from those who move to the city as adults. These and other factors often result in severe or prolonged stress. Could the stress of city life be increasing the risk of mental health disorders? Does city living make the brain more susceptible to mental health conditions? Do people living in cities and rural areas differ in the way that their brains process stressful situations? If scientists are able to detect which aspects of city life are most stressful, these findings may help to improve the way urban areas are designed. Please join our speakers as they discuss these and other significant questions affecting stress and the city.

www.germaninnovation.org

www.heidelberguniversity.org

The Heidelberg University Association and the German Center for Research and Innovation cordially invite you to a panel discussion on

Stress and the City

Monday, November 2, 2015, from 6:30 p.m. to 8:30 p.m.

with

Prof. Dr. Andreas Meyer-Lindenberg

Director, Central Institute of Mental Health, Mannheim, Germany

Professor and Chairman of Psychiatry and Psychotherapy, Heidelberg University

and

Dr. Andrew Rundle

Associate Professor of Epidemiology, Mailman School of Public Health,

Columbia University

moderated by

Irmintraud Jost

Executive Director, Heidelberg University Association

at the

German House, 871 United Nations Plaza (First Ave. at 49th Street), New York, NY

RSVP by October 29 by clicking here.

http://form.jotformpro.com/form/52805976850971


This event is free, but registration is required.  MUST BRING PHOTO ID!!! Seating is limited.

Reception to follow

results.description:
You are invited to join us for a data science study session. On Monday, November 2, we will kick off with an introduction on Gaussian processes. We will explore Gaussian process regression as an efficient way to optimize a system's parameters, not only for machine learning problems, but also in our day-to-day lives.


Image: Aol building entrance

Image: Aol floor plan (we'll be at Roebling)


Before you attend, here is a preparation checklist:

1. Sign up for a github account. This will allow us to more easily share code and collaborate together. (https://github.com/)


2. Make sure you can log in to our chat room with your github account. This is the place to ask questions. (https://gitter.im/NYDSSG/chat)


3. Join our google mailing list. This will allow you to access and contribute to the tutorial list that the group is working on. More importantly, this lets you team up with other students on tutorials that are interesting to you.


Our goal is to create a friendly and productive environment where we can build skills together with fellow data scientists. It doesn't matter if you use Python, R, or Excel, have 2 years of experience or 2 days, everyone is welcome to join. But to make it worth your time, check out the tutorial list FIRST. Pair up in a group if you see something interesting. Otherwise, add a tutorial so that others can join you. It's more fun to learn together.


Many thanks to Aol, who is graciously lending us their space.


We look forward to seeing you on Monday!


Here is our current tutorial list.
results.name: Data Science Study Session (@Aol)

To join us at this course it will be assumed that you have already watched Shawn's course on how to design a RESTful API (http://pluralsight.com/courses/web-api-design).  This course covered how to design a RESTful API while avoiding the dogmatic religion of REST but embracing the best of the pragmatic parts.

results.description:
Here it is! The work days end with darkness now and for most of us it becomes a dreary time of limited activities to do. With the weather forecasted to be in the mid to high 50's at night, this event is going to be heaven!

- SEE THE INCENTIVE BELOW - 

Monday is coming and I'm offering a workshop limited to 6 photographers. I have Monica, a model from TheModels'Den, attending as the specimen to be worked on ;) She is up for torture! To work in a workshop is not that easy, so let me thank Monica now while she is still talking to me... Thank you Monica :-)

Join us this Monday From 6:15pm to 9:15pm and if we get a full house it may go to 9:30pm

A great workshop on the use of 2 off camera flashes -
In the first 45 minutes it will be a solid lesson on light positioning, filters, and working with ambient light. 
Learn how to adjust the flash intensities for proper exposure.

Then the lesson continues as we move from Time Square to a nearby street alley.  Watch how a simple street can be turned into an illusive nightmare. 

Wish I could invite more photographers.. but quality of the lesson is most important to that of quantity of students.  Each will have time to have hands on shooting, but it doesn't mean if you are not shooting you are not doing, at least not with me it doesn't.  When I teach, everyone is involved in each shot taken. You will see the results, see how and why so you can replicate your own visions in the many shooting opportunities the TMD Models will be offering. 

Of course it's $109  - that's 1 model and 1 instructor giving you a darn good 3 hour lesson.  There is no early bird, no discounts and this event will not cancel regardless of how many people show up.  

If my flash triggers do not function on your camera, you will be shooting with my Nikon Df. You will love shooting with it too! You might just not give it back. Hmm, maybe not a good idea.

Payment is due in full upon your RSVP.

Recommended lenses: 
Wide prime! or at least a wide zoom with f2.8 

Normal lense, hopefully prime or zoom in that range having a 2.8

Tele - 200mm best being a f2.8 

Don't have a fast lens?... not to worry, your quality will suffer as we bump up your ISO and the bokeh won't be as delicious but at least you will come out with some serious new found knowledge and the hunger for some fast lenses. 

========================================

Some of you know me well: I am a sick puppy. I don't stop teaching and I can keep going to the wee hours if people didn't have jobs to go to.  I plan to persuade some of you to keep going after the shoot! 

Monica won't be so willing, I'm sure, especially after 3 hours of being tormented. But I have plans to head to Mcdonalds that's open 24 hours or any other whole in the wall that has a plug for my laptop. For those of you that want to be completely irresponsible to lose a few hours sleep I'll be uploading selected images to discuss varying techniques to edit and post process.  Keep buying me coffee and I'll keep going... Last train out of NYC to NJ is my only restriction. 

Here's a bit of an incentive:

Book this workshop and TMD will offer you $20 off any of Monica's events to the end of this year that she offers through http://www.meetup.com/TheModelsDen-NewYork/.  If she doesn't host at least 3 events for you to take advantage of before the end of the year, I'll make it so you can use the $20 towards any model in January! So it is written so it be done.

So come! RSVP now. 


Cheers! John
results.how_to_find_us: You will see the group with camera's and backpacks. hard to miss. My cell - 347-746-2001 (john)
results.name: WORKSHOP - Getting Prepped for night photography & multiple flashes

results.description:
Here it is! The work days end with darkness now and for most of us it becomes a dreary time of limited activities to do. With the weather forecasted to be in the mid to high 50's at night, this event is going to be heaven!

- SEE THE INCENTIVE BELOW - 

Monday is coming and I'm offering a workshop limited to 6 photographers. I have Monica attending as the specimen to be worked on ;) She is up for torture! To work in a workshop is not that easy, so let me thank Monica now while she is still talking to me... Thank you Monica :-)

Join us this Monday From 6:15pm to 9:15pm and if we get a full house it may go to 9:30pm

A great workshop on the use of 2 off camera flashes -
In the first 45 minutes it will be a solid lesson on light positioning, filters, and working with ambient light.
Learn how to adjust the flash intensities for proper exposure.

Then the lesson continues as we move from Time Square to a nearby street alley.  Watch how a simple street can be turned into an illusive nightmare. 

Wish I could invite more photographers.. but quality of the lesson is most important to that of quantity of students.  Each will have time to have hands on shooting, but it doesn't mean if you are not shooting you are not doing, at least not with me it doesn't.  When I teach, everyone is involved in each shot taken. results.description:
-posted by Melissa F.-


Come join Ann, Melissa and all the friendly, awesome people attending this event for dinner at the Whole Foods in Jericho on the first Monday of every month at 6:30 pm. What a great way to start off the week!

This VLI gathering at the Whole Foods store in Jericho is a casual event. Show up at 6:30, or show up later than 6:30. It's totally fine to drop in when you can. 

The store's food bar is vegan-friendly (vegan items are clearly labeled, ingredients are listed).  You pay by the weight of your food. (A typical total is $10-11.) 

As with all VLI meetups, please bring only vegan fare to the table. 

(Our policy is "at VLI meetups, the food is always vegan, and everyone is treated with kindness." In other words, we expect everyone to enjoy a vegan meal together. Even if you or your guests don't think of yourselves as "vegan.")

We'll be hanging out in the eating area, at least until 9:00 (the store closes at 10). Be aware that as it gets later in the evening, the food bar may run out of the more popular items.

NOTE: Whole Foods offers durable bowls, but not durable utensils. So **remember to bring utensils for yourself** to cut down even more on our trash. You could bring your own water bottle, too.

Hope to see you there!

One last thing: even though this gathering is more casual than other restaurant outings, we still appreciate if you can keep your RSVP up-to-date. That way, we know whom to expect/how many seats to save. Thanks!
results.how_to_find_us: Look for us in the dining area.
results.name: VLI Meetup: Dinner at Jericho Whole Foods

Book Details:
Paperback: 352 pages
Publisher: Vintage; Reprint edition (June 2, 2015)
Language: English
ISBN-10:[masked]
ISBN-13:[masked]

Book Description: (From GoodReads.com)


An audacious, darkly glittering novel set in the eerie days of civilization's collapse, Station Eleven tells the spellbinding story of a Hollywood star, his would-be savior, and a nomadic group of actors roaming the scattered outposts of the Great Lakes region, risking everything for art and humanity.

One snowy night Arthur Leander, a famous actor, has a heart attack onstage during a production of King Lear. Jeevan Chaudhary, a paparazzo-turned-EMT, is in the audience and leaps to his aid. A child actress named Kirsten Raymonde watches in horror as Jeevan performs CPR, pumping Arthur's chest as the curtain drops, but Arthur is dead. That same night, as Jeevan walks home from the theater, a terrible flu begins to spread. Hospitals are flooded and Jeevan and his brother barricade themselves inside an apartment, watching out the window as cars clog the highways, gunshots ring out, and life disintegrates around them.

Fifteen years later, Kirsten is an actress with the Traveling Symphony. Together, this small troupe moves between the settlements of an altered world, performing Shakespeare and music for scattered communities of survivors. Written on their caravan, and tattooed on Kirsten's arm is a line from Star Trek: "Because survival is insufficient." But when they arrive in St. Deborah by the Water, they encounter a violent prophet who digs graves for anyone who dares to leave.

Spanning decades, moving back and forth in time, and vividly depicting life before and after the pandemic, this suspenseful, elegiac novel is rife with beauty. As Arthur falls in and out of love, as Jeevan watches the newscasters say their final good-byes, and as Kirsten finds herself caught in the crosshairs of the prophet, we see the strange twists of fate that connect them all. A novel of art, memory, and ambition, Station Eleven tells a story about the relationships that sustain us, the ephemeral nature of fame, and the beauty of the world as we know it .



Editorial Reviews:


from Amazon.com

An Amazon Best Book of the Month, September 2014: A flight from Russia lands in middle America, its passengers carrying a virus that explodes “like a neutron bomb over the surface of the earth.” In a blink, the world as we know it collapses. “No more ballgames played under floodlights,” Emily St. John Mandel writes in this smart and sober homage to life’s smaller pleasures, brutally erased by an apocalypse. “No more trains running under the surface of cities ... No more cities ... No more Internet ... No more avatars.” Survivors become scavengers, roaming the ravaged landscape or clustering in pocket settlements, some of them welcoming, some dangerous. What’s touching about the world of Station Eleven is its ode to what survived, in particular the music and plays performed for wasteland communities by a roving Shakespeare troupe, the Traveling Symphony, whose members form a wounded family of sorts. The story shifts deftly between the fraught post-apocalyptic world and, twenty years earlier, just before the apocalypse, the death of a famous actor, which has a rippling effect across the decades. It’s heartbreaking to watch the troupe strive for more than mere survival. At once terrible and tender, dark and hopeful, Station Eleven is a tragically beautiful novel that both mourns and mocks the things we cherish. –Neal Thompson  --This text refers to the Hardcover edition.

results.description:
Hi Everyone
We are postponing our winter squash theme until next December. Instead we will be hosting Sarah Owens, founder of BK17 Bakery, an artisan microbakery specializing in sourdough that serves both NYC and Louisville, KY. Sarah will be in town for the release of her new book, Sourdough: Rustic Recipes for Breads, Sweets, Savories, and More, which is being released on November 3. 


Sarah will give a slide show presentation and then we will have the opportunity to sample some of her sourdough breads.    Learn more about Sarah's story in Edible Brooklyn: How Fermentation Saved One Woman’s Stomach.


Best,

Angela Davis

NYC Ferments Co-organizer

Cookbook author Sarah Owens will explain the nutritional benefits of lactic acid fermentation and introduce the basics of using sourdough as an ingredient in breads, sweets, savories, and more. As she guides listeners through a 45 minute slide lecture, Sarah will discuss how she came to using natural leavening and how the power of sourdough has the potential to improve digestive health. Samples of recipes from her book will be on offer to nibble!

Copies of the beautifully photographed Sourdough: Rustic Recipes for Breads, Sweets, Savories, and More will be available for sale by the author, making an excellent addition to your collection or a special holiday gift for your favorite baker.

SARAH OWENS is a professional horticulturist, former steward of the Cranford Rose Collection at the Brooklyn Botanic Garden, and the founder of BK17 Bakery, an artisan microbakery specializing in sourdough that serves both NYC and Louisville, KY. Sarah's customers receive freshly baked goods delivered through a subscription based on seasonally available ingredients and stone-ground heritage grains. She has been featured in Edible Brooklyn, on Gardenista, and on 66 Square Feet. She has also appeared on The Martha Stewart Show.

results.description:
The Future of the Ticket

This is our 7th event, and we're thrilled to introduce a global event registration platform, Peatix based in NYC! Expect to learn about:
• Starting up in Japan & the early days of Peatix
• Stories of going global & US event market
• Visions and future of Peatix


Please visit and sign up Peatix before you come! (Optional) 

If you want to learn about cross-cultural business between US-Japanese markets, discover new technology, and meet other enthusiastic technologists, please come and join us at Pivotal Labs! (and hang out afterwards at a bar nearby)


Agenda: 

-6:30pm  Door opens/ Networking 
-7:00pm  Opening Remarks        
-7:15pm   Speaker : Taku Harada - Co-founder & CEO, Peatix 
                 Group Discussion for Peatix Business 
-8:00pm  Announcements & Open Networking

About Peatix 
Peatix is a global event registration platform that provides event organizers with powerful tools to create, promote, manage and sell out events of all sizes. Peatix’s innovative, mobile-centric solution for event management has served over 60,000 events since its inception in May 2011. From concerts to conferences, and everything in between, Peatix empowers organizers while enriching the event experience for attendees through social interactions and event discovery in its mobile applications (iPhone, Android) and mobile website. And thanks to the lowest ticketing fees available, and fully customizable event pages, event organizers can promote, sell tickets, and manage their events with considerable ease.


Speaker 

Taku Harada

Taku founded Peatix together with his former colleagues at Amazon, and has served as its CEO since its inception. Taku also held the position of Representative Director and CEO of YOOX Japan until August 2009. Prior to YOOX, Taku held various positions at Amazon Japan including head of its mobile and online marketing divisions. He also launched the iTunes Music Store in Japan while at Apple in 2005 and led its marketing team. Taku began his career at Sony Music Entertainment's international business affairs division in Japan. He holds a B.A. from Yale University.

A special thanks to Pivotal Labs for providing us a space for our event!

We hope that this event will be a place where Japan & NY people can come collaborate. Looking forward to seeing you all!

Masa, Yu & Toby
results.name: November JPNYC Startups Event- The Future of the Ticket

Mahamudra is a Sanskrit word which means union of bliss and emptiness, the very essence of Buddhist Tantric meditation. It is an imaginative step-by-step spiritual training that guides us toward an experience of unparalleled peace and clarity. From this experience, we gain insight into ultimate truth, and the wisdom to live a meaningful life. These teachings help us to integrate all of our spiritual practices into a unified progression toward lasting happiness.

$15.00 suggested donation. No one turned away for lack of funds.

A supportive, invigorating environment for both the beginner and the experienced. Learn. Get your chops up. Prepare material. Grow.

Isn't it just about time?

Becoming an professional actor is a progressive process.

results.description:
Please join us Monday Nov. 2nd as we sit down with Architect and Senior Design Manager at Apple David del Villar to find out what it takes to balance creative focus and career trajectory. 

Summary:


From the start of an architect’s academic and professional career, it’s promoted, glorified and encouraged to work for firms with esteemed names. The trajectory of these firms, and the individuals associated with them, are extremely well documented throughout the architecture community often times following similar career paths. David del Villar’s career trajectory however, is nothing short of unique and impressive. Starting as an undergraduate architecture student in Spain, David has moved on from the GSD, Rafael Moneo, and Diane von Furstenberg. Now a Senior Design Manager at Apple, David’s responsibilities include overseeing multiple teams across different trades, foreign and domestic code compliance, contract negotiation of consultants, and working closely with internal executives, operations managers, and real estate teams for projects all over the world. Built-In is pleased to welcome David del Villar and hear his story.

Moderated by Mike Zee, Head of Operations @ Built-In

Men's Pick-up basketball in Hunters Point, Long Island City.

The cost is $10.75 for this session. 

Once you RSVP to a specific session, no refunds or credits will be offered. Please be 100% sure that you can attend before committing to that session.

It is a regulation sized court, but we divide it into two games simultaneously with each playing 4x4. We will do our best to break up the teams evenly at the outset, after which it's the luck of the draw based on who's sitting and who shoots in from the losing team. There will be a sign-up list for each court, and players from the losing team must shoot foul shots to play next, not be chosen by those already sitting.

All skill levels are encouraged to attend. Please have a fun, positive, and supportive attitude. No fighting, rough playing, or screaming allowed. You will immediately be asked to leave the gym.

No food or alcoholic beverages allowed into the school. Save it for after the game.

All games must end by 8:45pm

From Grand Central it's 3 minutes/1 stop on 7 Train. Take 7 train to Vernon Jackson. Walk straight back towards the River to Center Blvd(in the direction of the city).

LOGLINE: A disgraced surgeon returns home one night to find a bundle of cash and a high­-tech briefcase which can create a flawless mask, all of which leads him down a sinister and deadly path.  (Thriller, Science Fiction)


• Review the Script

• Talk about The Craft / The Business. 

• Like NYC Screenwriters at Facebook.com/NYCScreenwriters

• Follow @Scriptfeed on Twitter


To Do 

• Download the SCRIPT from our "FILES" section the week before our meeting. Read it and come prepared to give your constructive commentary.

• Members who bring written reviews go first. :)

• If you sign up after the PASSWORD email blast (1 week before meeting) then email/message [masked]. 

• Please do not distribute passwords, scripts, or materials you obtain from RSVPing to Collective workshops.

Thanks and see you soon!

ABOUT THE SCREENWRITER: One of the main reasons David Benoit writes, like many of his favorite authors, is to express self reflection in storytelling which in turn projects what it means to be human. The human experience is different from other animals in that we have a conscious and can reflect on our lives. Hopefully, David's self­ reflective stories engage the audience and make them contemplate their own human nature.

results.description:
Beyond Faith is a support group for young people under 30 who are currently, or have in the past, gone through the often difficult process of leaving Christianity. Beyond Faith is for the person who doesn't quite fit in with the pack, a person whose ideals and beliefs do not jive with their peers, family members, or loved ones. This can be a tough journey, especially for those whose family and friends are unsupportive of their doubts and lack of belief. Our group aims to create a safe space of support, community, inclusiveness, and encouragement on this journey away from Christianity and towards a reason-based worldview. For some, just the idea of entertaining serious doubts about faith can be dangerous and overwhelming, and Beyond Faith seeks to ease the process and create a warm, welcoming and optimistic environment for like-minded folks on the same path.


Beyond Faith is open to any young people who identify as atheist, agnostic, Humanist, or who are having doubts about Christianity. We are open to any and all denominations of Christianity. Beyond Faith is a safe space for women, people of color, LGBTQ people, and those who are differently-abled. Because of this, the facilitators and participants of this group will be expected to keep member identities, meeting locations, and content confidential to protect everyone involved.

In order to ensure the confidentiality and safety of our group members, please email [masked] with the following questionnaire for the location details.


New Member Questionnaire:
In an effort to ensure all members of this group are respectful and open to others, we ask that you fill out this short questionnaire so the organizers can tailor the group to its members. We have a zero-tolerance policy for evangelism at our meetings; people attending for the sake of evangelizing will be asked to leave. We do this in an effort to protect our members and ensure that our group is a safe space for all attendees.

This is NOT an application, all serious members will be invited regardless of answers to the questions below.

1. Why are you interested in Beyond Faith?

2. Can you tell us a little about yourself (including name/age/where you're from), and how your experiences have brought you the point you're at now? [You only need to share as much as you are comfortable with]

3. Do you define yourself as any/all of the following: atheist, agnostic, humanist, nontheist, or any other term?

4. Where would you consider yourself on your journey out of Christianity and into atheism/agnosticism/nontheism/etc?

 

Please feel free to reach out to us if you have any questions. You are welcome and encouraged to bring friends and family members that you think may benefit from this group as well. We look forward to having you!

 

As there is limited space, we ask that you only attend if you are under the age of 30. If, however, you are older than 30 and are very interested in attending, or have attended our discussions in the past, please send us a private message and we may be able to work something out.
results.name: Beyond Faith: An Ex-Christian Student Support Group

results.description:
How to be unconditionally happy?

A mind that is calm, without anticipation and agitation is the birth right of all individuals. A mind that is in the present moment will be happy.

What can get you to that state?

The rest you gain by reposing in yourself is deeper than the deepest sleep. The deeper your rest, the more dynamic your activity is. By being peaceful and happy you can turn your body into a power-house by generating an inner source of energy.

Meditation is simple and is a practical way to recharge and rejuvenate; empowering you to do more of the things you love.

Come join us for free guided session and experience the power of meditation.

Workshop Contents:

- Understanding the nature of the mind
- Relaxing Breathing Techniques
- Guided Meditation
- Introduction to the Happiness Course and Sudarshan Kriya

results.description:
Hope and Faith

Sura 15 Aya 56

And who but those who have gone astray abandon hope of the Lord’s mercy?

All of us can find ourselves in situations where we face daunting obstacles. You or someone you love can be severely ill, your business or career can be in a crisis, or you can be badly hurt by people you love. There are people who have been wrongfully arrested and put in prison for long periods of time. There are women who have been abandoned by their husbands and left with children to raise. You feel like you have fallen into a well and there is no way to climb out.

 This aya teaches that it is a mistake to give up hope. Hope is another word for faith. Hope means believing that from every crisis some good will emerge, and it does for those who keep hope alive under all circumstances.

The nature of hope will be discussed in our meeting, as well as methods for staying hopeful in distressful situations

You are welcome to bring healthy snacks to share after the meeting.


Our discussions are based on the book 'The Quran and The Life of Excellence.'

  Notice: The attendees will be requested to contribute $ 5 each to help with the cost of renting the meeting room.
results.name: Quran Discussion in Manhattan-Hope and Faith-Part B

results.description:
Wake up to whole new relational spaces and touch into parts of yourself that bring a deep nourishment and inspiration.

REGISTER: https://circling.eventbrite.com/

The evening will begin promptly at 7:00 pm.

Please be punctual and check-in prior to 7 pm in order to support the flow of the evening. Late arrivers may need to wait until the second circle to join if the first circle has already begun.

Each Community Circling Practice Night will be facilitated by a trained Circling Facilitator.

Participation is limited
Registering guarantees your spot

NOTE: if you are new to Circling you must attend an intro session before participating in a Circling Lab. Intro sessions are offered one Monday each month from 6-6:45 and the last Monday of each month at our Community Circling Nights during the 7-10 pm event

Upcoming dates are listed below!

What’s it like to experience Circling?
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KmIhCf06Osg

What are the benefits of Circling?

Circling is a fresh way to develop presence and richer connections with those around you. It can provide fundamental and often unseen insights that, once seen, create new and exciting opportunities. It provides a doorway into flow experiences and breathes life into sometimes vague spiritual concepts and ideas.

Through Circling individuals can start to develop trust in a deeper intelligence in themselves and others. Part of what makes it special is that, although it is based on complex ideas, it is simple and empowering to take part in. We believe it to be one of the richest tools for human development in the world today because it works on so many levels.

What is Circling?

Circling is a practice where the attention of a small group is skillfully focused on an individual. This person gets to feel the impact of being supportively seen by others while also experiencing their honest in the moment feelings. The process revolves around connection, understanding and a deep authenticity between people. It involves bringing a greater awareness and appreciation into our connections with others and can be considered a relational meditation because of this. It is a paradigm-shifting practice that is supported by wide ranging research in how adults learn and develop. For more about information about Circling visit AuthenticWorld.com or www.circlingeurope.com

In order to secure a spot, you must pay in advance on Eventbrite. $20 per session or $55 for 3-sessions in one month $70 (does not include Community Night) for 4 sessions in one month  (does not include Community Night)

https://circling.eventbrite.com/

Walk-in registrations may be accepted if seats are available. Walk-in registrations: $25

Questions about Circling and Authentic Relating NYC?
Contact Amy at [masked]

LOCATION: Reflections Center for Conscious Living
227 E 24th Street (between 3rd and 2nd)
NY, NY 10010

August 17:  Experienced Circlers Only

results.description:
https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/kTxMx_NaIDyW8z1CgXgvl-fQSU3DqwuGIHbi7TwVy7Hx-2RvbIgay3P-Dz6KSOpNE94n7PI-5eg4k9N8ByXyYvHb3tbCgoJ6uH55HFL-iLqQcFUcncoXqG5RI_bz4FgC3MwVX-iu

Join Be Social Change on Monday, November 2nd from 7 PM to 9 PM for Storytelling Fundamentals - Crafting Tales That Captivate Any Audience with Minna Taylor of The Engaging Educator.   

===========================================

LIMITED TICKETS AVAILABLE! This is a paid class. Be sure to purchase your ticket here: bit.ly/StorytellingNov2

**BSC Unlimited pass holders get a 50% discount on this workshop**

===========================================

Everyone loves a good story. Whether you are teaching a lesson, leading a meeting or presentation, or going on a date, storytelling is an incredible approach to effective communication. But what makes a story stand out, and engage the listener? A dramatic hook, a funny anecdote or a solid button – all can encourage looking, increase understanding and snag the audience.

This workshop uses interactive activities to teach the basics of good storytelling. Students will learn tips and tricks to make their stories fun, engaging, and interesting, and have a chance to workshop the beginnings of story with personalized feedback.

WHAT YOU’LL LEARN

• How to craft a good story

• What elements are necessary for a story to be effective

• Dramatic tips and tricks for making any story interesting and engaging

WHO THIS CLASS IS FOR

• Professionals, entrepreneurs, creatives, and communications strategists/marketers looking to work on their storytelling skills

• Professionals who have a story they are looking to polish for presentation

Educators who want to use storytelling in their education plans

INSTRUCTOR BIO

https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/zzpCJHNHH4ghMlBYqos4OHGDNDBrGH-zixcQ5EDwZ5CzmlaTnbH916TZpTUr1l33KpuwEOmhZ22lfeV1Y4Uk2TKtnkvupfzQPjH8GtTiXkJrnO7KgfUyxBtrEaSa0hyOtn5-e-OY

Minna Taylor is a NYC based communication coach. Her company, Energizeyourvoice.net, focuses on helping professionals discover their full voice in order to unlock their full potential. She coaches people into presence and rediscovering their authentic self through personalized programs suited to the individual or institution. Her methods are founded in business strategy with a heavy emphasis on play and moment to moment discovery.

Her teaching specialties are public speaking, presentation skills, and team building. She has a BFA from NYU Tish in association with The Atlantic Theater Company and an MFA from Brooklyn College with a concentration in speech and vocal production. She is a working Voice Over artist and comedy film producer.

https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/Rfn6U1iSX0rBUmM_iBWL1aoK0X1tm8Zwz6legFg_pmrLweSsLWwppPeV97Wu6GbIdj2v86LKgw5C-a5nTEvSsgB6ByvFwU0qxXrPij7QsLUAHoVXt4yAU9gxQA_FA5K5qQfVGa0

Realizing the connection between improvisation and communication, The Engaging Educator (@TheEngagingEd), specializes in customized improv-based education. We provide classes that enhance public speaking, creativity, flexibility, positive risk-taking, teamwork and more by flexing improv muscles. Beyond our classes for educators and professionals, we also specialize in improv for high school students, corporate workshops, and improv for individuals on the autism spectrum, as well as individuals with cerebral palsy.

The Engaging Educator is a passionate and talented team of educators, facilitators and professionals. Each of our Engagers brings a distinct style and energy to our brand of "Yes, And," and all believe in the power of Improv as Continuing Education.

SPACE PARTNER

This event is proudly brought to you by Soccer Beyond!

Learn more on SoccerBeyond.com or Facebook.com/SoccerBeyond.

Details - Fun, interactive, effective.

75min. This Soccer Workout will help to increase your leg power, core and upper body strength, overall agility as well as mental strength. This is a Coed Soccer Lesson. Please bring a ball if you have. Sneakers, running and turf shoes are fine. Bring some water or sports drink and maybe sun blocker. Please note our Waiver of Liability and 24hr Cancellation Policy below. More details follow.

Rain or Shine - If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Our sessions will be held as scheduled if weather allows. Thunder or snow and ice are among the reasons for sessions to be canceled/ moved. BUT: Don't make assumptions - you will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved. As the weather changes quickly in NYC, occasionally we may make the final decision about 90min prior to session start. If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Cancelled/ Moved Sessions - You will always get notified!

Every time we have to cancel a session, if possible, we move it to the same day and time of the following week. In this case, all players keep their spots. Please email us prior to the rescheduled event, if you can't make and wish a refund or credit. The 24 hours cancellation policy applies. You will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved.

Requesting a Refund

To request a refund 1) change your status to "not going" and 2) send us a note with the Paypal transaction number related to the payment for the respective session. Refunds are processed once a week - please be patient.


24 Hours Cancellation Policy

A full refund/ credit will be given if cancellation is received at least 24 hours prior to lesson start. Full payment is required thereafter. Our cancellation policy also applies to package holders.


Waiver of Liability and Hold Harmless Agreement

By RSVP'ing for this event you certify that you are physically fit such as you are able to participate in this program. You therewith voluntarily release CoachFrankNYC/ Soccer Beyond, LLC from any and all liability resulting from or arising out of your participation and/ or receipt of instruction. results.description:
PLEASE READ:

Welcome all writers and thank you for joining!

Our agenda is as follows:

7-7:05 - chat

7:05-7:30 - introductions (please be on time for intros)

7:30-8:00 - set writing goals for upcoming week & share obstacles

8:00-8:30 - provide feedback for the chosen pieces & choose new works for following meeting

8:30-9:00 - craft discussion

9:00-9:15 - wind down & poll group

How to receive feedback:

IF you would like to be critiqued, you must attend at least one meetup to become familiar with and understand the format of the meetings. Attendees are expected to eventually submit work for feedback. In the preceding meetup we choose two writers to be critiqued. The third work is a backup if time permits. Please read them all as well as the craft essays in the "Files" section under "More" tab.

How to post:

1) Post only if you have been chosen to be critiqued and by Friday at noon. (For critique outside of meetups please post in "Pages" in the menu above.)

2) Before Posting: Long-Form Length: 3,000 words or 10 pgs max (can be shorter)

If submitting poems, max 3 a person

Double-spaced (unless for aesthetics)

11-12 point font (no smaller or larger)

Number your pages

*The organizing team maintains the right to remove pieces from circulation


3) Post in Files under More tab with this description:

- Name

- Meetup date

- Description of your work


- Type of feedback you would like

- Fiction or non-fiction specified


(As description box allows.)

When critiquing: (Always use "I" when critiquing)

1) Each person is allotted 5 mins. The writer is also allotted 5 mins to respond after everyone has spoken.

2) Share what worked and/or what you liked/ enjoyed and why.

3) Offer suggestions/ constructive criticism for improvement.

*Caffé Bene has a large assortment of coffees and teas and tasty things to eat. Please pay for your space with a purchase from the establishment.

See you there,

Dan

347 - 743 - 1854
results.name: Critique, Goal Setting, & Craft Discussion

results.description:
Join Be Social Change on Monday, November 2nd from 7PM to 9PM for our class on Intro to Facilitation - Fundamentals in Becoming an Effective Facilitator with Kristina Drury, Founder and Creative Director of TYTHEdesign.

===========================================

LIMITED TICKETS AVAILABLE! This is a paid class. Be sure to purchase your ticket here: http://bit.ly/BSCFacilitation101Nov2

**BSC Unlimited pass holders get a 50% discount on this workshop**

===========================================

 Are you looking to enhance your leadership skills while infusing your work with more collaboration? Facilitating activities (design thinking based and beyond) with your team or community can lead to more team collaboration, greater team capacity, and productive communication with your community. This intro class answers ‘what is facilitation?’ and will demystify why you facilitate collaboration, your role as a facilitator, when to prepare a facilitated collaborative session and how to build it around your own style.

In addition to introducing the foundational basics of facilitation, we will model a participatory activity to demonstrate tips and tricks to guiding a collaborative experience. Identifying the tools and strategies to maximize working with the various stakeholders involved with your project, program or organization. This class gives an overview of the key tenets to being a strong facilitator, introduces design-based facilitation frameworks, and provides TYTHEdesign's own examples of implementation. Come ready to learn, ask, and engage!


WHAT YOU’LL LEARN 

• The basics of facilitation

• Keys to being a strong facilitator

• Strategies for building your collaboration session

• Activities that demonstrate how to brainstorm in a participatory design process

WHO THIS CLASS IS FOR

• Individuals interested in facilitation and relatively new to the role or looking for a refresher of the basics

• Individuals from all professional or educational backgrounds interested in developing their group management and leadership skills

• Managers looking for tools to activate collaboration within their teams

• Professionals who work in community engagement or are about to begin community engagement projects or programs

• Individuals looking to add creative thinking methodology to their work

INSTRUCTOR BIO

https://lh4.googleusercontent.com/3aFiMB9DK24Lk63e1fTvsZZNdyDCg9UmgzQRBAyFQNoAHnZsLnLSp_JT5ry1YV-hp1oxqjIDyYE40KSJx2t90kB91ZsJG-YJbhQhDheqaFOJ-fXVvVxYy2E9jzhPin3HRGrDRJ4

Kristina Drury (@TYTHEdesign) founder of TYTHEdesign, is a social entrepreneur, designer and educator. TYTHE, a social impact firm, uses the lens of design and strategy to support organizations build their capacity in the social good community. Under her leadership TYTHE has increased the community impact of over 75 local and global social good organizations including the NYC Dept. of Education, Citi Community Development, Public Policy Lab and California State Library System. Recently, Kristina has been named a UNDP Innovation Expert. Prior to starting TYTHE, Kristina co-led the nonprofit Project H and worked in corporate social responsibility consulting. As an educator she has taught classes, workshops and training to build the capacity of over 600 change-makers, leaders, and entrepreneurs. Her teaching and speaking experience includes engagements at the Clinton Global Initiative University, Cooper-Hewitt Museum and New Museum’s Ideas City Festival.

You can learn about Kristina’s current work here and find out more about her background here.

SPACE PARTNER


The Centre for Social Innovation (@csiSL) is a home for nonprofits and social entrepreneurs in New York City. They’re building a movement of passionate people committed to a better world. Learn more at http://nyc.socialinnovation.org/

Refund Policy: Refunds can be issued in full up to 48 hours prior to the start of the class by contacting Be Social Change.

results.description:
Topic: Cross Country Challenge

Speaker: Air Safety Institute Presenter

When we talk about safety, we normally tackle one issue at a time—thunderstorms one day, taxi clearances the next. But out in the real world, any given flight can bring together a whole range of interconnected safety issues:

Fly through that precip…or deviate and cut into my fuel reserve? Climb above that scattered layer…or risk airsick passengers? Fly with an underinflated nose strut…or delay and fly in worse wx?

Our new seminar reflects that reality. You’ll follow along as we “fly” two fictional trips, answering questions (and debating answers) along the way. From preflight planning to tie-down technique, if it’s related to the flight, it’s fair game!

Click here for seminar details and for how to receive Wings credit.

NOTE: There is no online registration for this event.

The Air Safety Institute's safety seminars qualifies toward AOPA Accident Forgiveness and for the safety seminar portion of the FAA WINGS program.

ASI safety seminars are funded by generous donations from the Conrad N. Hilton Foundation and pilots like you.

results.description: The purpose of this group is to establish a safe place where people can deal with the pain and isolation brought about by the ending of a significant relationship. We are not a singles group or a dating network. Instead, we are a family where it is safe to be ourselves. The goal of the meeting is to help members to develop into healthier, more complete, independent, loving men and women. We hope that by being together, listening to each other, and by sharing our experiences, strength and hope, we will learn to see the value of life in a new context. For the first hour of each meeting members share their experiences. The second half of the meeting is reserved for a guest speaker relating to either the legal or emotional aspects of separation/divorce. We meet every Monday eveing at the Church in the Highlands, 35 Bryant Ave. White Plains, New York. We are a mixed group of men and women. There are about 50 members, with approximately 20 attendees per meeting. There are no fees, new members are welcome, no reservation is necessary. We pass a basket at each meeting and suggest a five dollar donation per meeting to cover the cost of the meeting place and coffee/cookies served at the meeting.
results.name: Separation and Divorce Recovery Group Weekly Meetup

I was born with internal properties which I have not chosen. Then, the environment, my family and the education I received operated on me from the outside and built me in a certain way. And thus I live, as a result of these two conditions, which I have not defined. 

All of a sudden a question awakens in me: “Why am I alive? What for? ” I didn’t choose this question either, it simply awakened from within me. This is the beginning of the awakening of the “point in the heart” and it pulls me to a higher world. Here, the possibility of choice begins.” - Dr. Michael Laitman. 

Join us for a casual evening of discussions, Q&A, and lively workshops with other like minded seekers guided by experienced Kabbalah teachers. We’ll watch thought provoking clips over coffee and treats as we learn about the basic principles of the Wisdom of Kabbalah as taught by Bnei Baruch.

results.description:
YC Grad - Raven Tech Recruitment @ NYCCEO


Come join us now!  CEO and Founder will be here to share his story and recruit on the spot! Get your tickets now! 

Nov.2nd

7:30pm-9:30pm

424 Broadway, Unit 602, New York

Introduction of the company 

Raven is an extremely intelligent crow and it often shows the strange behavior which other animals cannot understand. In the story of Bible, a raven picked up Jesus’ shroud to bring Jesus back to life and anew era came out.

Founded in May 2014, Raven Tech's mission is to make our lives easier, more elegant and more efficient with the power of technology and design. As one of the fifth batch of graduates from Microsoft Ventures Accelerator, and the only startup from Mainland China enrolled in the Y Combinator W15, Raven Tech raised $3MM for Angel round from ZhenFund and Matrix Partners China, and $15MM from DCM, ZhenFund, Matrix Partners China and YC for Series A round. Now the company has offices in Beijing, China and the Silicon Valley, USA.

Learn more about Raven: 

https://www.crunchbase.com/organization/raven-tech

Founder&CEO

Cheng (Jesse) Lu, founder and CEO of Raven Tech, was born in 1990 in Xi’an Shaanxi Province, and graduated from University of Liverpool, UK. He started his business while he was still in university. Jesse is one of the "2015 Forbes 30Under 30: Entrepreneurs”.

渡鸦科技创始人兼 CEO，吕骋， 1990年出生于陕西西安，毕业于英国利物浦大学，大学期间开始创业，福布斯 2015 年 30岁以下 30 位创业者之一。

Our product

RavenTech is focusing on the next generation of human-machine and human-human interaction system, which is called Project Flow. Music Flow, a pure simple music player, is the music feature of Project Flow. Although MusicFlow came out by accident, it leads a new fashion of design and interaction for music players.  

Flow,is the way users interact with mobile phones and intelligent terminals in the future, meaning taking off all the covers and shells of Apps. With the shell free architecture, innovative Project Flow will bring up a direct answer to the commands, rather than activating an App.

About the recruitment

Core members of Raven Tech including Jesse Lu is having a road trip across the nation, from SF to NYC and visit 12top universities seeking for talents. We are eager for geniuses and artists to join us. Everyone may identify themselves as crazy ones, yet few will be respected. And you, might be one of the ravens making the ridiculous dreams real. We are Raven Tech, the missionaries of the new era.

包括吕骋在内的核心团队成员将从旧金山一路开车前往纽约，拜访12所顶尖高校，只为找到向往的人。我们希望天才和艺术家们加入我们的团队。每个人都会把自己视为为生命痴狂的人，然而只有少数人实现了他们的价值。幸运的你，将有机会成为一只实现梦想的渡鸦。

Please feel free to send your resume and cover letter to [masked].

NYCCEO于2012年在Meetup社交网站上发起并快速成长为纽约最具影响力的创业服务组织之一，是连接美国东西岸和中国创业圈的桥梁，宗旨是力求为创业公司寻求优秀人才，为创业项目寻求投资资金，为各种合作寻求对接信息和合作伙伴。我们每个月会定期举办各种形式的创业主题活动。自创立以来一直与中美顶尖的创投和科技公司合办活动，活动嘉宾代表机构包括顺为资本，IDG，真格基金，小米，Amazon,Google，jet.com，中国联通，长城会等。NYCCEO现有超过1,500名来自纽约金融，IT，科技，时尚，设计等各领域的优秀人才。

results.description:
Student Testimonial:

"Bodhi meditation has a focus on healing energy, you can experience this at each session. Much higher level of meditation in group than I can achieve doing my own practice. I was very happy to find a meditation group that was focused on bringing together community members to practice meditation. Bodhi meditation is unique because they offer free sessions to the community. Nan is a wonderful teacher, and very compassionate person. You can sense that she has extensive experience in oriental medicine including acupuncture, herbal medicine, and energy healing,. Thank you Nan. ” Joe, Bodhi Meditation class Wednesday October 29, 2014


--------------------------------------------------------------------

Come and experience how this unique meditation can help you purify your body/mind and unleash the creative power within you.

* Increase self-awareness
* Stronger emotional intelligence
* Greater mental clarity, focus and inspiration.

Bodhi Meditation

Energize your body

Strenthen your mind

Bodhi Meditation is a form of energy healing.

Bodhi Meditation is unique in the following ways

1). It channels universal energy rather than working with what’s within one person. It transcends the genetic and physical limits of just one being by relying and drawing energy from the entire universe.

2). The entire human body is the receiver of this energy. The energy’s effects on the body do not rely on certain meridian paths or pressure points of the body, which are the common requirements for many types of the Qi Gong practices.

Students will experience two forms of Bodhi Meditation.

* Seated
* Movement

Your class instructor is Nan Ni Gilbert. Nan is a NYS licensed acupuncturist and Chinese herbalist. Nan is also one of the most advanced Bodhi Meditation energy healer in North America


Time:. 7:30 PM – 9:00 PM

Day: Mondays

Where: Room #102, Freeport Recreation Center

130 E Merrick Rd, Freeport, NY 11520

Contact: Nan, [masked],[masked]

**The Bodhi Meditation classes at the Freeport Rec Center are free but all participates are required to have a Freeport Rec Center Activity Card.  The cost is $5.00 for Freeport Residents and $10.00 for Non-Residents. It's a one time annual fee payable to the Freeport Rec Center. If it's your first class please arrive early to purchase your activity card.

 -------------------------------------------------------------------

I leave you with Master JinBodhi's Golden Words:

(Editor's note: The following phrases were suggested by Master JinBodhi and subsequently introduced to his students as a daily practice. Starting your day by loudly reciting these phrases three times, either all of them or a select few, will bring you energy and joy. Give it a try and experience how uplifted you feel...)

1.Self-Confidence

I am most compassionate.

I am most confident.

I am most tolerant.

I am most courageous.

I keep my word.

I am most punctual.

I can do anything.

2. The Power of Knowledge

I am full of wisdom.

I am most knowledgeable.

I love reading.

I love observing.

I love listening.

I love thinking.

I take decisive action.

3. Life Purpose

 I am a gift from the Universe.

I am most charming.

I am most talented.

I can sing most beautifully.

I like challenge.

I am responsible for my actions.

I will fulfill my life purpose.

4. Cause and Consequence

（not for reading loud）

What you give is what you receive.

Care for others, and you are taken care of.

Smile at others, and they will smile at you.

Treat others with sincerity, and sincerity will be given to you.

Make trouble for others, and trouble will find you.

Frequent generosity begets abundance.

Seek to give, not to be rewarded.
results.how_to_find_us: The Freeport Rec Center is just west of the Meadowbrook Parkway on Merrick Road

results.description:
One of our members, Mercedes, has a free, live R&B and Jazz set at one of Harlem's newer restaurants, Harlem Besame  (Harlem Besame Facebook Page). Let's meetup and show her some support and check out a new spot in the process! The flyer for her event is below.

Our Meetup

We'll meet at Harlem Besame at 7:45pm, where there will be an area reserved for the group to check out the music which starts at 8pm. Wait service will be available to order food and drinks from the menu. If you have any questions or can't find the group, feel free to call or text Daniel at 774.275.3646. 

Directions to Harlem Besame

Take the #2 or #3 trains to 125th Street and walk avenue west to 125th street and Adam Clayton Powell Jr. Blvd. The restaurant is on 124th street & ACP Jr Blvd. The A, B, C, or D trains are also nearby and the M2 bus also san alternative. 

Public street parking should be available near the restaurant and a parking garage is located on 124th street between Lenox Avenue and ACP Jr. Blvd.
results.name: Live Jazz Music Set & Social Mixer @ Harlem Besame - Free to attend!

results.description:
Join our Christmas Blues Rock Ensemble in time to perform a great Holiday show in December!
We’ll be playing Christmas classics “Merry Christmas, Baby”, “Please come home for Christmas”, “JIngle Bell Rock” and more!
We’ll have 10 practices and then perform on Sunday, December 13th at Arlene’s Grocery at 3pm. SHOW

The show will be at Arlene's Grocery in the East Village December 13th at 1pm(soundcheck) and doors at 2pm. Our show will be at 3pm. Arlene's is an awesome show venue with professional stage, sound and lights, everyone will be miked or amplified. If you are coming to rehearsal with a portable amp you should also bring it to the venue.

We will have a drummer and a singer TBA.

There will be tickets for this show, they can be purchase before hand (starting in November) at $5 or at the door for $10.

There is a show fee of $30 for each ensemble member that will go toward venue, sound engineer and hired musicians costs.

Arlene's Grocery is strictly 21+ and no children will be allowed at the show even if they are accompanied by the parent, I'm sorry:( :(

There are two bars on site and lots of food spots and great restaurants in the area for before or after the show.

CALENDAR

Our practice schedule starts Thursday 6-8pm on October 1st.

It is important that you attend to as many as you can if you plan on performing, a required 7 session minimum will be necessary to perform and VERY IMPORTANT that you come to the last 2 practices which will be with a drummer and a singer
results.how_to_find_us: between 7th and 8th Ave

results.description:
Dancing is so much fun, I really feel alive when I am dancing Salsa! It's Friday night, you should go out and have some fun! Go out and meet some new friends!

Please join us for another FREE Salsa dance party, a 2 hours fun networking event with 2 hours of non-stop Salsa music and dancing 

Dancing non-stop is a lot of fun.

Salsa dancing for more than 2 hours is a really fun way to exercise and burn off all the calories. Dancing is a good workout, it may "improve your health and give you more energy". We will rotate dance partners every five minutes, so that each person will make many new friends during this fun networking event.

Name tags will be handed out to each guest during the start of the event for the open space networking session.

The best and really nice Salsa music will be playing on the high quality BOSE sound system, over the last 5 years we have created a collection of 1000 Salsa songs.


Friends from 12 networking groups will be attending this event. 


Business Owners may apply for a free Vendor Table to promote their business during this event for free.Each vendor is required to give out some type of free gifts to our attending guests. • RSVP: To enjoy the reduced admission , Mention the code that you will see in the comment section, it is different every week !!

• Price: $10 if you RSVP on the meet up. 

• Time:  8 pm- 2am ( Salsa Lesson at 7.00pm)


• Address: Taj Lounge, 48 W 21st St, New York

• What to wear: Dancing is about movement and enjoyment. We recommend wearing comfortable clothing that allows you to be flexible and relaxed. In order to be able to move comfortably across the floor, we advise that you do not wear rubber-soled shoes.

• Do I need a partner ?: No, you don’t need to bring a partner. We rotate during the group class, It will give you the opportunity to dance and meet different people.

This will be the official Korean beginner's class. The class material will be provided. We will go through all the basics and foundations, and practice with fun activities.

If you know how to read Korean letters(Hangul) you can join the class. If you haven't learned at all but would like to join the class, please email me.

Since I need to book a space ahead, please consider your RSVP seriously and let me know if you can't make it after you said YES to come.

The location will be either near Bryant park or Korea town. The exact location will be sent to members privately. Please, email me at [masked] with your contact number if you can come. I will send mine so we can communicate better when the meet up happens.

The class fee will be $15 per person. Once you commit for 4 weeks series of classes it will be $40. Please, note you won't get a credit if you cancel your attendance on the same day. Be prepared for the class! :)

We may hang out and mingle after the class. I'm very excited to see you all and look forward to it! 
If you have any questions,please leave a comment.

results.description:
Take a a chance and learn something new. Come to our Argentine Tango for Beginners classes and see what all the passionate fuss is all about.  If you learn the right way from the start, you will not develop any bad habits.  Mayte will take you through the concepts, steps and techniques able to get you moving quickly on the dance floor so you can start being a part of the beautiful social dance scene in New York City, Westchester and surrounding areas. 

Come enjoy the pleasure of live music, great performances, wonderful friends and the joy of moving to the music in a warm embrace. If you've already learned other dances, come and improve your sense of balance, elegance, leading and following while taking on this Argentine wonder and discovering a new way to move and express yourself.

We'll look forward to seeing you there.

results.description:
TurnOn - yourself, your relationships, your sex. This is the place to excavate what you truly desire. Have you wondered how to create the relationships you want? Experience the intimacy you crave? Where you can say the honest truth to your partner, your family, your lover and yet stay grounded in yourself?

We believe that no matter what type of relationship you desire, human connection is at the basis of genuine relating. We play a set of intimate communication games that let you sharpen your relating skills and hone your attention. You get to shed off the layers that keep us from being seen, be vulnerable and feel more alive. We play 3 games (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). It's a refreshing change from the typical “Hi, how are you?” conversation. You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. At the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation. What class you can take and what we have to offer so you can work towards having the intimacy you want.

Come early, doors close at 8:10p. COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

For questions contact [masked] |[masked]

Can't make this one? Visit us at www.turnonny.us

https://youtu.be/8OWkv9zms4E
results.name: Slow Sex (good we promise!) and Intimacy - learn more

We believe that no matter what type of relationship you desire, human connection is at the basis of genuine relating. We play a set of intimate communication games that let you sharpen your relating skills and hone your attention. You get to shed off the layers that keep us from being seen, be vulnerable and feel more alive. We play 3 games (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). It's a refreshing change from the typical “Hi, how are you?” conversation. You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. At the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation. What class you can take and what we have to offer so you can work towards having the intimacy you want.

Come early, doors close at 8:10p. COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

For questions contact [masked] |[masked]

Can't make this one? Visit us at www.turnonny.us
https://youtu.be/8OWkv9zms4E
results.name: TurnON New York City

results.description:
Come and join us for an evening of fun and TurnOn. How often do we get an opportunity to be real with each other in NYC?


We play 3 communication game (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). Imagine meeting new people in an environment where people felt comfortable to be themselves. That's what we have created.

It's a refreshing change from the typical networking or bar conversation.

You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

At the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation. What class you can take and what we have to offer so you can have the life that you want.

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. In an hour and some you may even forget for a moment you are in New York City.

OneTaste NYC is an organization teaches Orgasmic Meditation, otherwise known as OM. The games we play at TurnON are designed to create the visceral sensation of Orgasm/OM in your body, without having to actually do the practice (or remove any clothing!).

It's a friendly invitation to play and push your edges in a way that feels good. This allows you to stretch yourself and inspires self-discovery!

Come early, doors close at 8:10p.  

COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

For info contact [masked]
