results.description:
Monday, 11/2 from 8 – 9:30 pm with  Chris Pelham

Reading assignment: ACIM Textbook ch. 16, section 7

A Course in Miracles and A Course of Love classes are $20 each

Know your life purpose and the meaning of your current situation clearly. Communicate with your Inner Teacher. Heal yourself and others.

These ongoing classes focus on mind training designed to help you to experience the lessons and wisdom of ACIM. 

Each Monday class contains some lecture from the ACIM Textbook and/or Urtext, some discussion and Q&A, and typically 20 – 30 minutes of meditation, creative visualization and/or spiritual reading practice in order to experience mind change.

Thursday classes skip the lecture to devote more time to discussion and practice.

Our primary goal in these classes is for each student to learn to listen to the guidance of Holy Spirit and live his/her life with certainty and peace. Slowly, you will re-train your eyes to see the world around you without judgment. You will learn to communicate with your holy spirit.

It is OK to attend without having done the reading, but we highly encourage you to do the reading (and the workbook lessons on your own) if you can! This course is meant to be experienced rather than simply talked about. You can find the text online here, among other places.

Students of all experience levels and backgrounds are welcome!

Yasuko Kasaki has been teaching A Course in Miracles and offering spiritual counseling and healing since 1999. She has approximately 1,000 students and clients. In 2004, she opened CRS, the first and only spiritual center in New York City devoted to the study and practice of ACIM. Ms. Kasaki is the author of 21 books published by major publishers in Japan. Read more...

You can listen to a sampling of Yasuko's recent guided meditations here:
http://crsny.podbean.com

Christopher Pelham currently serves as teaching assistant for the Monday class and will sometimes lead the group when Ms. Kasaki is away. He is the Director and a co-founder of CRS (Center for Remembering & Sharing). He balances his time between overseeing the growth and health of the CRS community, producing arts/cultural/educational events at the Center, and working as a CRS Healer and student and teacher of A Course in Miracles. In addition to studying ACIM with Yasuko Kasaki since 2003, he studied the Spiritual Psychology of Acting with London-based teacher John Osborne Hughes and Keith Johnstone-based Improvisation with the late Gloria Maddox. Read more...

Another great way to get a taste of our approach is to attend one of our free Healing Events, each of which is open to the public:

Spiritual Healing Clinic 
M 7 – 7:50 pm, Tu 7 – 7:50 pm
Sundays 12 – 1 pm preceding Jon Mundy's Miracles in Manhattan lectures
Healing Clinic suggested donation $20, nobody turned away

Guided Meditation
Tu 6:30 – 7 pm
Free!

results.description:
Guys, This meetup is to talk about the issues we each face. Some of the things that cause a lot of trouble: Problems with the ex. Harm to the children, and how to reduce it. If you have visitation and not custody, there are visitation problems we all deal with. Everyone pays child support. My idea is to kick around our problems and experiences, and see if that helps in dealing with the issues. I have changed the location for the meetup: at TGI Fridays 826 New Jersey 3 Clifton. This is a pretty nice TGI Fridays, and it is easy to get to.

Please come on time, and bring a friend with you. And please be ready to listen as well as ask questions.  This is a bunch of us who have been through it.  It is a good group!

see you then,

Bob Davies

results.description:
• ABSOLUTELY NO CLEATS ALLOWED! NO EXCEPTIONS!!

• Permit Disclosure: No permit but field is usually unoccupied at this time.

• BRING AN ALL WHITE SHIRT (your teammates can see you better when you wear white under the fluorescent vests)

• We play rain or shine!

(Leader- Mohit.)

(Co-leader- Chris W.)

• PLEASE ARRIVE ON TIME - 8PM!! Game starts at 8:15pm sharp .

• NO BALL SMASHING! THIS IS A SPECIAL NIGHT BALL!

• Full rules explained at the game.

Be Positive - Constructive criticism after the game is way better than you yelling at me and complaining during the game.

Be Safe - Want to kick someone really hard? go take jiujitsu. We like our shins.

Be 2! - Play as a team. It take 2 to complete each pass.

Be Generous! - Not just your money (though it helps). We want clapping and good cheers.

The proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

All RSVPs are final. No credits or refunds. (It's all for charity anyway)

If the game is cancelled, get a refund by filling out this form.

If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free. http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G raises money for charities that use soccer for social good restoring dignity where it's been lost through the game of soccer. We share the impact of this movement through multiple channels and promote generosity on the field through safe and supportive play.

PS2G - Local Game. Global Change. 

Disclaimer By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.

(Leader- Mohit.)

(Co-leader- Chris W.)

Hey Guys,

The 5v5 Indoor Co-Ed is back! Matches start Nov 19th at one of the best gyms in Brooklyn, 5 mins walk from Atlantic Terminal subway.


The 10% early bird offer is extended to Nov 2nd! Details and Registration at:


http://www.group-stage.com/futsal-5-a-side/


Located at one of the best gyms in Brooklyn! We use Futsal rules, i.e, a heavier ball and walls are not in play. All players receive team jerseys and post game drink specials at a local bar. It's a 7 min walk from Atlantic Center subway, or 4 min from C train subway.


DETAILS:

• Teams are 5v5, max roster 10 players


• 8 game minimum


•  45min matches, unlimited subs

• Players receive GSF T-shirt


•  Finalists awarded medals

•  1 female player required during matches


•  Drinks specials at a local bar

REGISTRATION:


1. FREE AGENT: $126* Register here.


2. TEAM: $1125* Register here.


Free-Agents that want to be on the same team as friends, just let us know in the comments section. 

*10% Early Bird ends Nov 2nd.



Note: If you don't have enough players for a team, let us know and we'll add players to round out the roster. If you would like to be on a specific team let us know in the comment section. No games over the holiday period (Thanksgiving, Christmas & New Year.)


See you soon, the Footy Fanatics!


Grand FC / Group Stage FC

results.description:
ELECTION DAY - This is it folks, do or die for your Town and County Elections!

Today is the day we have all been working so hard to get to...now we need to make sure we get out the vote. 

This year we are voting on local elections - Town and County elections and several Judicial positions. There are a few special elections this year, several Assembly Districts and NYC Council position.  

Poll Hours:   All polls close at 9:00 pm. 
Polls open at 6:00 am in the counties of Nassau, Suffolk, Westchester, Rockland, Orange, Putnam and Erie and in New York City.  In all other counties, polls open at 12:00 noon. 

Where to vote:   Not sure where you go to vote?  Then use this link to find your local polling place. This is valid for all NYS residents! 
https://voterlookup.elections.state.ny.us/votersearch.aspx

It is UP TO US! 

It is UP TO US to make sure we get our friends and neighbors out to vote. 

It is UP TO US to make sure everyone hears about those candidates who will bring logic to NYS and bring our values into office. 

None of us want to wake up on November 4th and say 'what if I did more?
It will be too late.  

So please do all you can, every little bit helps!

Thank you. 

WE WILL NOT COMPLY

Stephen Flanagan 
Founder, Executive Director 
Conservative Society for Action
results.name: Election Day - Your Vote is your Voice!

results.description:
Professional Business Networking Event in Elmhurst, Queens.

The BNI Dream Team. 

As a reminder here's why we wake up early Tuesday mornings. 98% of businesses rely on referrals to build new business. ONLY 3% of businesses have a strategy to generate those referrals. Our BNI networking meetings are a proven word of mouth marketing referral generating strategy. Last year, members of BNI (Business Networking International) passed millions of referrals that generated billions of dollars of business for each other. Belonging to BNI is like having dozens of salespeople representing your business, and in return you are representing their businesses. What goes around comes around. If I help you, you’ll help me and we will both benefit as a result.

The reason  BNI is so successful is that there is only one person per profession per chapter. If your profession is listed below we invite you to come check us out and show you how we can help you grow your business.

BNI Dream Team is currently looking for these professions to pass a boat load of business to. 

IT Professional, Title Insurance, Moving Company, Reverse Mortgage Broker, DJ Entertainment Company, Florist, Photographer, Caterer, General Contractor, Event Planner, Personal Trainer, Architect, Hair Salon, Nutritionist, Life Coach, Commercial Real Estate Broker, Business Broker.

If your profession falls under any of the above titles I strongly encourage you to come check us out!

Here are the details for our next meeting Tuesday, October 20th 2015

Meeting time is from 7:00AM to 8:30AM

Our Location: Nevada Diner 80-26 Queens Blvd, Elmhurst, NY 11374 (718) 426-2229.

Plenty of Parking, trains: M & R, Grand Ave station

The cost is $15 which includes breakfast.

Please bring 30 business cards to pass out.

STOP LETTING BUSINESS PASS YOU BY AND TAKE ACTION NOW!
results.name: IF BUSINESS IS PASSING YOU BY, YOU SHOULD COME TO OUR BNI

results.description:
We are an independent referrals group dedicated to the business growth of each of our members.  We welcome one member per business category in our membership.    Our 15 members are friendly and focused on supporting one another.  We'd like to grow to 20-25 members - will you join us?

This Meetup group helps us reach business professionals like you.  We welcome guests to visit us in order to network, get to know us, and decide if there's a membership 'fit'.

As an independent group, our dues stay with us and we use them to invest in our weekly meetings with a hot breakfast - as well as public networking events and member-only professional development programs.

Our 'rules' are relaxed compared to other referral groups.  For example, we don't require a sub if you can't make a meeting and our attendance policy allows for an occasional absence.  Instead of fines, we reward our members when they bring in guests.


We don't have a 'requirement' to bring in a referral every single week because we only want qualified introductions - and we know that a connection for another member may not show itself every single week.

We meet weekly to generate solid business referrals for each other. Join us and we’ll talk up your business, too. Partners in Business members have one focus . . . to exchange qualified business referrals.

We cater to the early morning professional, meeting on Tuesdays from 7:00-8:30am.  RSVP and be our GUEST at the next scheduled meeting. For further details, please see our website at Partners in Business.
results.how_to_find_us: www.partnersinbusinessnj.com
results.name: Partners in Business: North Jersey Referrals Group Weekly Meetup

We are BNI-affilliated, and value the philosophy of "Givers Gain". We are committed to help one-another succeed. Somewhat like having a part-time sales/marketing/mentoring/resource team. If you will. "If I help you, you'll want to help me, and we'll both benefit".

RSVP now and come promote your business at an upcoming Tuesday morning meeting!

results.description:
Come join us for an invigorating breakfast and networking event.

There will be at least 15 members at each meeting, regardless of how many people RSVP on Meetup.

Meet successful business owners from different professions to give and pass referrals and grow your personal network.

BNI, the largest business networking organization in the world, is a business and professional referral organization that allows only one person from each profession to join a chapter.  Belonging to BNI is like having dozens of sales people working for you because all the other members carry several copies of your business cards around with them. When they meet someone who could use your products or services they hand your card out and recommend your services. It's as simple as that!  

For 28 years BNI has used a simple but elegant philosophy that exemplifies membership, "Givers Gain," or, "what goes around comes around."

 Last year alone, Business Network Int'l generated over 7.1 million referrals resulting in more than $3.3 billion worth of business for its members!

In Manhattan, BNI currently has more than 1250 members in 53 Chapters. 

BRING LOTS OF BUSINESS CARDS!!!
Cost is $20, which includes breakfast.

results.description:
***Please note: This event requires registration. To purchase tickets visit our eZ Conference Eventbrite Page. ***

Members of the New York eZ Publish Community will receive 15% discount by using promo code: ezmeetupnyc 


For more information about the eZ Content Technology Conference visit the conference website. For the latest conference updates visit the eZ Blog.

-------------------------------------------------------------

About the Conference

The eZ Content Technology Conference is an annual conference where ideas are exchanged, connections are made, and business accomplishments are recognized.

eZ Conference will bring together the largest gathering of members from the eZ community from around the world - from those who use eZ Publish, eZ Publish Platform or forthcoming eZ Platform and Studio, to the developers and designers creating online experiences.

This year marks a special occasion for the conference for two reasons. It will be the first time the conference is hosted outside of Europe, taking place this year in New York City. It will also be time to celebrate the fall release of eZ Platform and eZ Studio, as we discuss the many possibilities for the future platform.

So join us for a week of celebration, talks, learning, networking and awards as we grow our community and conference into the future.

eZ Conference will be held on November 3rd through 5th at the Wythe Hotel in Williamsburg, Brooklyn. Located a short subway ride from downtown Manhattan. 

At the eZ Conference You Will

- Learn the latest - and upcoming - improvements to eZ Platform and eZ Studio

- Network with the innovators in the Web, Digital Marketing, Symfony, PHP and eZ communities

- Expand your knowledge through speakers and workshops and be introduced to new ideas and strategies -there is really something for everyone! 

What Topics will the eZ Conference Cover?

- eZ Platform & eZ Studio Development - Business and Strategy
- Symfony & PHP
- Web Development
- Front End Development
- User Experience (UX) and User Interface (UI) Design 

Guest Speakers Include: 


- Paul Boag - Consultant, Author and Speaker

- Karen McGrane - Author and Speaker

- Deane Barker - Chief Strategy Offices at Blend Interactive

- Bernahard Schussek - Core Developer at Symfony 

- Subrata Mukherjee - VP of Product Management at Economist Digital

- Plus talks from Hootsuite, Connective DX, Blackfire.io, MogoDB, Novactive and many more. View the full list of speakers here.
results.name: eZ Content Technology Conference & Awards

results.description:
NYC Uncubed is an innovation conference and career-focused tech circus unlike anything you've ever been to before. 

Featuring interactive company showcases, product demos, classes on cutting-edge skills & techniques, drinks, music, & live art showcases. 

-- WHY LIVE ART? ---

We have art friends. We have tech friends. The two circles don't interact as much as they should! Tech startups typically develop their products using a methodology where they build as fast as they can and then show the result to people for immediate feedback. We thought it would be interesting for artists to do the same thing on canvas during the event. 

-- INTERESTED IN BEING A LIVE ARTIST @ NYC UNCUBED? -- 

We work with RAW artists to put on live art show, but we are also seeking submissions for independent artists! If you're interested in applying to be a live art participant at this Fall's NYC Uncubed (Tuesday, Nov 3), please send along a link to perry[at]uncubed.com with your online portfolio & you'll be notified. 

-- INTERESTED IN ATTENDING NYC UNCUBED? --

Meet the teams behind 85+ of NYC's fastest-growing companies including BuzzFeed, Rent the Runway, Intent Media, Meetup, Shutterstock and more.

Plus career-advancing + skills-based classes taught by the very Founders, CEOs, Engineers, & PMs pioneering the technology.

>>Register & learn more @ nyc.uncubed.com/liveart 

**Less than 500 Early Bird passes are now available ($20 for 1/2 day, $40 for full-day). Grab yours before prices DOUBLE. 

*Please note, all registrations are reviewed to ensure a match of experience and skill sets with company hiring needs.  If your experience is not currently a match, you will be notified and refunded.
results.name: Live Art at NYC Uncubed

Event Browse - Media Partner

The Best Networking Events in New York 

Why another bloody blog and newsletter about events in NYC? 

We know, there are plenty to choose from already. But see that’s exactly the problem, all these weekly emails try to be as comprehensive as possible, with the result that they are no longer a guide but a list. A very long list. And we don’t read long lists, and we know you don’t (like to) either. 

So, that’s why we made our guide: a weekly selection of the best Tech, Startup, Geek, Business and Social events and conferences for NYC. 

At EventBrowse.com we aggregate data from various platforms, venue websites, and other sources to create a comprehensive database of upcoming networking events in your city or local area, and soon for all of the US.

results.description:
The Archetype of the Designer: It's Emergence in Our Time

Speaker: David Walczyk, EdD.

"We are not what happened to us,
  we are what we wish to become." - C.G. Jung

Ever since the first tools were created over 3 million years ago, humans and their ancestors have been designing. Yet, throughout human history, the archetype of the designer has been activated through the few, while remaining embryonic and in potentia for the many. Change is in the air. At this moment, in our time, the archetype of the designer is being activated throughout the world, through anyone who chooses to relate to it.

Let us then consider the following: What is the archetype of the designer? How is it shifting contemporarily? Why is it emerging so vigorously now?

David Walczyk, EdD, is the founder of The Center for Design + Consciousness and is in training at the C.G. Jung Institute of New York. An award winning designer for over 20 years, he has also served as a Visiting Scholar at the United States Library of Congress, a Policy Fellow at the United States National Academy of Sciences, and was a co-author of the evaluation criteria for the Buckminster Fuller Challenge, named socially responsible design's highest award. Visit davidwalczyk.com.

results.description:
I give a 'free', forever ongoing, astronomy class at the Senior Center.  You don't have to be a senior to join, but you must join the Senior Center for $72/year, which you can defer for at least a month, until you determine that you want to continue.

I never give the same lecture twice.  It would bore me.  My lectures are well prepared, and contain enormous resources from the live web, projected from my laptop to a flat screen TV.  It's all about gaining a perspective of your/my place in the universe.

==================

The class meets Tuesdays at 12:45pm.  Just come.  241 W 72st.  Ask for Laird.  (As of August, 2014, as well as for the last 5 years.)

To make sure the class isn't cancelled (it normally meets every week of the year), please email me at laird wh (one word) at aol dot com.  Make sure the word MEETUP does NOT appear anywhere in the email.  (It gets sorted away from my inbox.)
results.why: Astronomy is about EVERYTHING.  Or at least thats why I became interested in it in 2nd grade.  Now, 40 years post Ph.D. in Astronomy, Astronomy, and indeed all of science is still my passion.   My advisor was Carl Sagan.
results.how_to_find_us: Email me at laird wh (one word) at aol dot com.  Make sure the word MEETUP does NOT appear anywhere in your email.
results.name: Weekly Astronomy Class - (free the first month you attend).

RSVP in the following link and you will get the instructions on how to connect to the free webinar: 


https://www.eventbrite.com/e/webinar-how-to-transition-to-product-management-tickets-17840690987 

If you would like to get a job as a Product Manager, this is the webinar for you!

Making a career switch can be a thrilling and daunting task for many. Whether you are just beginning to think about taking the leap or you're in the middle of the process, it is easy to get overwhelmed. How do you know when to leave your current role and how do you best position yourself for your next?

This is a free ONLINE event at the location of your choice on your device! It does not require anything more than one click here to watch and find out if the Product Management course is the right fit for you. Get your ticket and we will send you the URL of the webinar.

What you will learn:

• Get an overview of the curriculum and course objectives

• Meet the instructor and hear about his professional experience

• Discuss Frequently Asked Questions • Have the opportunity to ask any & all additional questions

Who is this workshop for: 

• Software engineers who want to transition to Product Management 

• MBAs with a finance/consulting background who want to work in high-tech companies as a Product Manager

• Project Managers, Marketers, Designers who are seeking for new opportunities in Product Management 

Timeline:

2:30 - 2:50pm : Presentation and Q&A

Meet the speaker: 

Carlos González de Villaumbrosia


Carlos is CEO at Product School. He has seven years of experience building teams and digital products on 3 Continents. He is a three times company Co-founder. Before Product School, he was the Lead Instructor of Product Management at General Assembly and Co-founder and CEO of Floqq (invested by 500Startups), the biggest marketplace for online video courses in Latin America.

Join the webinar and get to know more about Product School and its Product Management courses.

Weather: Please check back here for any weather updates and/or cancellations.

Transit: 2 or 5 trains to E 174th St stop and short walk. 5 train runs express until 7PM from E 149th St-Third Ave to E 180th St. BX17, BX21 and BX11 within walking distance.

Ready? Play.
_____________________________________________________

What will we be doing at the Meetup?
We will be meeting at the tennis courts for some friendly rallying, doubles, and singles play*. This meetup is open to players at any skill level; from beginner to advanced.

*For those of you who are interested in singles play, please keep in mind that the ability to play singles predicates on the amount of members who have RSVPed as well as court availability at the meetup event's venue. We cannot guarantee singles play in every instance.

How long will the meetup be?
The time listed for the meetup event is when you can expect to the event host to be there. If you would like to arrive earlier or later than the start time listed, please leave a comment in the meetup event you plan to attend. This will give everyone in attendance a good representation of who is showing up at what time.

What will it be like?
Our group is very friendly and loosely organized to allow for a fun experience.

Upon arrival, our event host will announce which court they are on in the comments of the meetup event. If you have a smartphone, we strongly suggest that you download the Meetup app for iPhone or Android to make communication easier.

When you arrive at the courts, look for the event host listed or other members of the group playing on (or near) the courts listed. Use the photos of each host/member on the website as a frame of reference.


Introduce yourself. Let the host know your level of play and you will be assigned to a court immediately.

Do members need to bring anything?
All members must bring their own racquet. Unfortunately, we do not supply racquets.

All members are encouraged to bring a fresh can of new balls. You can always use a marker to mark your initials on your ball if you would like to keep them for future play. Please keep in mind that tennis balls only last a couple of days after taking them out of the can before they lose their bounce.

If you plan to donate to the group, you can leave your donation with the meetup event host or the head organizer, Frank, if he’s in attendance. All donations go towards the fees required to organize the meetup.

Who should come? Are newcomers welcome?
Our meetup event is open to all players whether they're an absolute beginner or an advanced player. Players will be matched up with others based on their skill level. Beginners will be given an opportunity to play with higher level players so they can gain more experience with higher consistency.

It is a high priority for our group to help beginners increase their skill and become better players. If you are reading this and are an absolute beginner, please don't be intimidated. We want you to join us and have fun.

What should a newcomer expect?
If you're new to the group, you'll learn very quickly that our community is extremely friendly. We have a colorful cast of characters from all walks of life who are ready and willing to have a good time.

Whether you're interested in easy-going rallying or competitive play, we can accommodate you.

Questions?
If you have any other questions, concerns, or comments; please send them to our head organizer, Frank Tirado via email.

results.description:
Description:

Research increasingly shows (“Young Adults with Autism Can Thrive in High-Tech Jobs” by Lauren Silverman, NPR, April 22, 2013) that adults on the autism spectrum can succeed in a wide range of jobs, provided they have the necessary tech skills and can qualify for jobs that are well adapted to their individual needs.  Technology jobs are particularly suited to many on the autism spectrum, and yet there are few training programs for students geared to this population. Tech Kids Unlimited is a not-for-profit program which is teaching kids on the autism spectrum 21st century tech tools so they can become the next generation of makers and producers.

Bio:

Beth Rosenberg is an educator who works with teachers, students, technologists, academics, parents, families and schools. She has worked on curriculum, strategic development, program outreach, interpretive educational exhibition materials, partnerships and collaborations between cultural organizations, community organizations and schools.  Beth held education staff positions at Eyebeam Center for Art and Technology in NYC where she was the Founding Education Director and The Solomon R. Guggenheim Museum where she was the Education Program Manager for many years. She holds a BA and an MA in Art History and an MS in Educational Technology. Beth is on the faculty at the Brooklyn Experimental Media Center at NYU-Polytechnic Institute in Brooklyn, NY.  A parent of a teen on the spectrum, she is an advocate for students with disabilities and is the Founder/Director of TechKidsUnlimited.org, a technology not-for-profit program for special needs youth.

results.description:
This is a special event geared for startups, makers, designers, and inventors to showcase products made their own products to other attendees at the event.  While also being able to have it broadcasted and streamed via Periscope.  A great way to get publicity and a great way for video content creators to film content about futuristic products that might change the world.

This will be an exhibition on innovation in two different sectors.  The second floor will be for creative products (example:  fashion, wearables, crafts, original or handmade disposable goods) and the 4th floor for functional (example:  emerging tech, Virtual Reality/Augmented reality, gadgets, wearables, drones,)

Floor 2:

This will be for makers and designers of fashion and craftsman type products to exhibit.  Everything will be products not on the mass market and will not be mass produced or manufactured products.

Floor 4:

Makers of gadgets, drones, wearables, IoT devices, VR/AR products, 3D printers, and other emerging tech makers/inventors/entrepreneurs will be able to show and tell their products to other people.  It is advised that all inventors, makers, and entrepreneurs that will be attending bring more than one product in order to give to a social media influencer or blogger.

Note, everyone who attends with a product of their own gets in for free.  If you are coming with a third party product there will be a $15 fee.  Third party products MUST NOT be on the mass market (example: Apple Watch is innovative but on the mass market and will not qualify).  

Social media influencers and members of the press are allowed to attend by invite only.  If you believe you are a social media influencer or write for a top blog or magazine please email me.

Please make sure to RSVP on Eventbrite https://www.eventbrite.com/e/show-and-tell-makers-inventors-entrepreneurs-the-press-and-social-media-influencers-tickets-18624053044

results.description:
Hello HTFers,

We welcome everyone to join us for a series of pitches by some innovative healthcare start-ups in NYC. You'll get to see firsthand how these startups are providing innovative solutions to problems that we face today while better understanding how startups work. Not only that, but you'll be able to give your feedback on the product. 

We'll have food and beverages along with plenty of time to meet and greet with everyone at the event. Here's the schedule:

6 pm - 7 pm - Check-In and networking

7 pm - 8 pm - Pitch Event

8 pm - 9 pm - More networking and wrapping up the evening.

Companies Participating in the Event:

Iris Interactive (Speaker: Janaki Joshi)

Iris Interactive is a leading provider of innovative cloud based collaboration platform for managing Innovation, Product Commercialization and Execution Excellence. The Iris Interactive platform provides real time visibility for senior management, efficiency for the teams and velocity for the organization. Iris for Life Sciences is purpose built for managing a brand/asset from Proof of Concept all the way to Loss of Exclusivity.

1DocWay (Speaker: Samir Malik)

1DocWay enables psychiatrists to interact face-to-face with patients in clinics in remote and rural settings, such as hospitals, primary care offices and nursing homes. 1DocWay has served over 25,000 patients to date in 11 states via telepsychiatry, helping providers expand their reach of services into underserved care facilities to increase access to psychiatrists and improve community health; and reduces the high cost of comorbid patients suffering both chronic and mental illnesses.

Ribbit.me (Speaker: Gregory Simon)

Ribbit.me’s LoyaltyNetwork for the first time ever is bringing instant gratification to healthy behavior. People are rewarded real-time for incentivized behavior, reducing health care costs and making them wealthier, healthier, happier.

RepDoc (Speaker: Jason Maier)

RepDoc allows doctors to schedule sales representative meetings online, so then can get product information when they need it, to better treat their patients.

Wellth (Speaker: Alec Zopf)

Wellth's mobile app helps chronic disease patients stay motivated by connecting financial rewards to their daily care plans.  Insurance companies and provider systems foot the bill, and everyone benefits as patients avoid costly adverse health events.

Smart Vision Labs (Speaker: Vickram Jain)

Smart Vision Labs was founded to bring vision to everyone. 500 million people around the globe suffer from vision loss due to uncorrected refractive errors. The SVOne is an ultraportable autorefractor powered by cutting-edge technology. Our smartphone-based platform enables you to perform simple, accurate, and fast refractions. 

Roundtable Judge:


Mark Putyanita, Image Reading Center

Come ready to give feedback to these companies. Your opinions could help make their products more user friendly down the road! 

Thank you to our sponsor, Troutman Sanders, for graciously hosting us! 

Looking forward to seeing everyone at the event. The address information is below:

Troutman Sanders

875 3rd Avenue 

New York, NY 10022


17th Floor

Best,

NYC HTF Team

results.description:
Come and join us for an evening 5K walk or run or C25K. Because we are meeting after most are getting out of work the pace will be more conversational.

There will be no bag check. If you need to check a bag please go to the Running Company Store located on the second floor of the Time Warner Center located in Columbus Circle, if you are meeting at the Central Park Entrance at Columbus Circle. If you are meeting at the 72nd Street Transverse (72nd Street inside the park, go to Jack Rabbit located at 140 W 72nd St. Bring a lock for your locker. Please indicate in your RSVP where you are meeting.

As with all of our workouts we will include ab and other workouts as well as stretches to enhance your performance.

Walkers and Runners will start out together. We will establish a point to meet up for workouts mid-way. The course we trek will depend on the interest and experience levels of all who join.

Please bring water with you to stay hydrated. We will provide Gevalia Kaffe Iced Coffee with Almond Milk after the work out courtesy of our sponsor.

If you are running late or need to cancel please contact an organizer as soon as possible. 3 no shows will lead to members being pulled out of the group.

If you have any questions please let us know.

We look forward to seeing you all!

Cheers to happy walks and runs!

Your sole sisters,
@JKORunning

results.description:
Welcome to Drupal NYC!


Our November meetup will feature Howard Tyson, VP of Engineering at Zivtech. He will be speaking about Probo.ci, a new open source continuous integration system designed from the ground up to work with Drupal.

Please note that this meetup will be on the first Tuesday of November, not Wednesday. You must enter your real name on the RSVP question or your RSVP will be removed. Check-in opens at 6pm sharp, see you on the 3rd!


Agenda
• 6:00 - Check-in opens, socializing + pizza
• 6:30 - Announcements
• 6:45 - Who's hiring, who's looking?
• 6:50 - Talks begin!
• 8:20 - Closing Remarks, socializing + leftover pizza
• 8:45 - Afterparty @ Bill’s Bar & Burger, concourse bar (1 block north, 16 W. 51st St., accessible via Rockefeller Concourse) https://goo.gl/maps/Eghs2

Talks & Speakers

==========

Introducing Probo.ci by Howard Tyson

Probo.CI is a new open source continuous integration system designed from the ground up to work with Drupal. It integrates with Githhub to build your pull requests and post the status of your builds back to the Github PR, just like travis.ci. The part that is different from travis.ci is that it does not tear down your environment at the end and instead posts a link to that environment on the github issue for easy code review, client feedback, and project manager evaluation. Learn more at http://probo.ci/</a>

Bio:
Howard Tyson is the VP of Engineering at Zivtech where he architects systems using open source components. He has been focused on automation and a devopsy workflow since before devops was a buzz word and has been working in open source since getting a start with Drupal 4.7. He worked on the team that upgraded Drupal.org from CVS to git and has a passion for building tools that make developers lives and jobs easier and more fun.<a href="https://twitter.com/tizzo"> @tizzo

==========

The Physical Web by Elijah Lynn 

The Physical Web is an approach to unleash the core superpower of the web: interaction on demand. People should be able to walk up to any smart device - a vending machine, a poster, a toy, a bus stop, a rental car - and not have to download an app first. Everything should be just a tap away. Learn more at https://google.github.io/physical-web


Bio:
Elijah Lynn (+ElijahLynn) is a senior software engineer at NBCUniversal. Elijah works on the Publisher team where he helps maintain an internal Drupal 7 distribution for brands such as Bravo, USA, Syfy, NBC, Sprout, Oxygen and more. Elijah is an active contributor to Drupal.org and is the maintainer of the Sticky Edit Actions module.

As a former locksmith Elijah once opened a house for the FBI in an emergency situation (they claimed their locksmith couldn't make it), after a few minutes one of the agents joked "come on, the guys on CSI only take 30 seconds"... a few minutes later the lock was opened successfully.


==========

Monitoring Drupal installations by Lumturio
with Murielle Marie Ungricht and Sam Hermans

Drupal is a powerful CMS, frequently used by enterprise clients, but as an open source platform, it is vulnerable to cyber attacks. Security depends on timely updates and monitoring and even though the stakes for enterprise are high, the necessary maintenance is often overlooked, exposing you and your clients to security breaches. We’ll discuss the context of Drupal security today, common mistakes and oversights when implementing Drupal, easy steps that enterprises can take today in order to reduce risks and give a demo of the Lumturio platform.


Bios:

Murielle Marie Ungricht, CEO

Belgium born co-founder Murielle Marie Ungricht is a successful and soulful entrepreneur, mentor, coach, writer and business strategist. She has a heart for women causes and women empowerment. Together with Sam, she has been running her own web agency for more than a decade. After finishing a philosophy major at the Catholic University of Leuven, Belgium she found her way in the corporate world, working as a web project manager for national and international companies.Her latest consultancy position was with the European Union.


Sam Hermans, CTO

Belgium born co-founder Sam Hermans is a successful entrepreneur, technical specialist and developer for one of the largest and fastest growing CMS platforms. He has been running his own web agency with Murielle Marie Ungricht for more than a decade and has been a technical and security consultant for national and international corporations. His latest consultancy position was as the Head of Web Department, working for the European Commission. The European Commission handles over 300M page views per month.


Lumturio is derived from the Esperanto word for Lighthouse. With an expanding and global world in mind, and a future in which cyber security will be of the most critical importance, we find that this name represents our values and vision perfectly.

==========

Want to present at Drupal NYC?!
We are always looking for new talks and speakers from all skill levels. If you are interested in presenting at Drupal NYC please message Ben Jeavons, our Speaker Organizer, @ http://www.meetup.com/drupalnyc/members/6722489
results.how_to_find_us: Enter of 50th street entrance under the neon sign that says Rainbow Room/Observatory Deck. Then go straight and slightly to the right to the check-in table. Here is a video => http://bit.ly/drupalnyc30rockcheckin
results.name: Drupal NYC Meetup @ 30 Rock - November 3rd

results.description:
Heard about Docker? Want to know what it is exactly? But you're worried it's too complicated? at HH4 you learn to create a Docker container, pull an existing container from the Docker community hub, push your new container to your own Docker repository, and deploy your container to the cloud.

Requirement: 

The recommended way (that I will use in the workshop) is described in the workshop tutorial, see here:

https://ibm.box.com/shared/static/pxlms8upxzo44a4gqnyegtxkpcpkubxn.pdf

Signup for Bluemix:

</a><a href="https://ibm.biz/bluemixnyc">https://ibm.biz/bluemixnyc

Install VirtualBox:


https://www.virtualbox.org/wiki/Downloads 

Download the workshop image with Docker, CF, CI pre-installed:

https://ibm.box.com/s/5vowq9c289bfi9il01ghzysbswdgqt3l


Join Hack Hours at our WeWork Lounge, with a technical demo, then follow the workshop step by step, or code on your own, technical help is always present on site. (Bring your own laptop)


AGENDA

6.00 sit down, have a drink, chat, relax, forget you're in NYC


6.30 today's topic: Docker for absolute beginners, intro and demo


7.00 after the demo, you can do the workshop step by step, ask for help if needed, or work on your own cloud project


9.00 wrapping up


At the end of the evening you should have created your first Docker container, pushed it to the registry, deployed your own Docker container to the cloud, be able to pull and deploy a container from the Docker hub, and who knows what more.


Hosted @WeWork, with FREE FOOD AND DRINKS.

PS. Join our new Free Bootcamp NYC page on Facebook to share your suggestions for new topics, photos, ideas and other tech stuff.


https://www.facebook.com/freebootcampnyc
results.name: Bluemix Hack Hours 4 (w/ Docker for absolute beginners workshop)

results.description:
*Originally posted in the Symfony PHP NYC Meetup Board*

Join members of the Symfony, PHP and eZ Publish community in Williamsburg, Brooklyn for an evening of networking and discussion. We will kick off the meetup with two great talks from two big Symfony users and contributors!

• André Romcke - "Perfect" caching with FOSHttpCache

At eZ we have been lucky to work with so many talented developers in the PHP and Symfony community, and one of the many projects we have so far contributed to and also benefitted from is FOSHttpCache. A super charged Http Cache implementation with tagging of content, varying of cache by user cache, support for Varnish, Symfony Proxy and Nginx, and much more. But it can still be improved, multi tagging support for Symfony Proxy, and Stale cache handling on purges by tags are two currently missing features for handling all possible high load situations while also being easy to use. Talk builds upon previous talk: Going crazy with HTTP caching - SymfonyLive Paris 2015

• Bernhard Schussek (the guy behind Symfony Forms, yes!) - Puli: PHP's Next Package Revolution Puli is a new PHP technology for building universal packages that can easily be plugged into any project. These packages use and discover each other automatically, without additional configuration.

In your enterprise projects, you can use Puli to build powerful plugin systems. But Puli's consequences are far greater: By unifying "bundles", "modules" and "extensions" of different frameworks, Puli has the potential to radically change the PHP community...

If anyone else want to bring a topic, please feel free to suggest in the comment below. We could have room for a 3rd talk. If not, we suggest to end the day with some social time in one of the many sweet spots around the Wythe hotel around a beer, eventually from the Brooklyn Brewery across the street.

After the meetup we will head over to Brooklyn Bowl for networking, food and drinks.

Looking forward to seeing you all there!
results.name: Symfony, PHP & eZ Publish Meetup Event

results.description:
Join us on November 3rd for two phenomenal talks.

One of the most exciting announcements to come out of re:Invent this year was the release of the AWS IoT Services. Rather than doing a broad re:Invent recap as we sometimes have in the past, we will be joined by Richard Threlkeld, an Solutions Architect from Amazon, to present and demo the capabilities of their new services. Following the IoT talk we will hear from Simulmedia who has accumulated a significant amount of leanings from the development of their ETL pipelines and Redshift based Datawarehouse. If you are interested in the Big Data space, don't miss this opportunity to benefit from their experience. For more on the sessions see below:


AWS IoT Services

We will have a brief overview of the AWS IoT service and a demo using industry hardware. This scenario will leverage the Shadow functionality of AWS IoT and invoke automated processes based upon the built-in rules engine. Additionally we'll also dive into some of the finer service details such as MQTT, Pub/Sub architecture and security controls.


Building a Data Warehouse in AWS

Hear from Simulmedia's Data Engineering team about how they built out their Data Warehouse using AWS services like Redshift, S3 and EC2. This will be a deep dive into the stack that supports one of the largest collections of TV viewing data in the world. In addition to this, the data team will also explain two of their guiding principles that have made their lives much easier - immutability in ETL pipelines and maintaining state within the Data Warehouse.


Logistics


Food and beverages will be served. Doors open at 6 PM and the program will begin at 6:30.

A special thanks to Simulmedia's for hosting this event! Simulmedia, Inc., a New York based marketing technology company founded in 2009, is the leader in driving guaranteed business outcomes for advertisers through traditional TV marketing. Simulmedia’s VAMOS platform is powered by the world’s largest database of information on what people watch and buy, combined with access to TV inventory that reaches 95% of U.S. TV households. Using its proprietary science and software, Simulmedia reaches specifically-defined audience segments on TV at massive scale, matches consumer purchase data to TV viewing data, and determines the actual sales impact of the advertiser’s TV campaign. The results Simulmedia delivers are guaranteed. For more information, go to www.simulmedia.com or contact [masked].
results.name: IoT & ETL Pipelines

results.description:
You're invited to hack along with the New York Linux Users Group!

***

***

***Please have a government issued form of ID with you. ***

***We will be meeting at a new location, the North Academic Center of CCNY***

This is a peer-supported workshop where we get together to share current challenges and approaches to solving problems or just work alongside like-minded individuals and learn through osmosis.


This event is NOT a lecture-style meeting. The agenda is generally set when someone posses a question, so bring questions!


Some topics of discussion are:
-Install/configuration assistance/ (possibly a "getting started" guide)
-Documentation/Standards/"Best Practices"
-Current events/Conventions
-Release testing/bug reporting
-Other projects (Pi/Arduino/Analog devices)


You may also find someone willing to debate VI vs Emacs (however don't expect a conclusion to it ! )


A laptop is not required but strongly recommended.

(If you are working a problem , some log/debugging information will be required)


Bring a project, topic or questions and work with other enthusiasts on using Linux or get assistance with your own Linux/Open Source projects.
(Geeks are more sociable solving problems rather then just talking about themselves )

The coordinators can also provide pointers based on their experience on how to get up and running as well as documentation and other resources for new users.
results.how_to_find_us: Enter the North Academic Center and ask security where NAC 5/110 is. You'll need to show ID. (The 137 st. City College stop on the 1 and the 145th stop on B/D)

This week I am going to see Rock the Kasbah I will arrive at 6:30 for the 7:05 pm showing. I  have seat D6 If you are coming post your seat #   Also if anyone wants to we can go to the  Red Oak Diner after the show for snack, just meet in the lobby after to discuss.


Hope to see YOU at the movies!    Love, Cassie


Ok who LOVES the movies as much as me? Who has a limited entertainment budget like me? LOL Well this is the event for YOU!

My local theater has discount Tuesday every week and if you sign up online they will even send you a coupon for the concession stand, each week a different one (this weeks is free small popcorn with a drink purchase). They also have those awesome new reclining seats! And you get to choose and pay for your seat in advance so there is no rushing in at the last minute and sitting in the front row and straining your neck!  Here is the link to the theater for more details: http://www.cinemark.com/theatre-detail.aspx?node_id=83854

So here is how it's going to work each week. I will choose a movie when the new schedule goes out (Thur/Fri) and choose the movie and showtime. I will buy my seat online and post what row and number. Those of you who wish to join me can buy your seat near me. There are two ways to buy seats: 1) online in advance is your best bet but there is a $1.25 service fee per ticket unless you buy a gift card at the theater and pre-load it. 2) At the theater no service fee but you really need to driver there in advance if you want seats near us. OR you can just show up that night and sit wherever there is space available.

 Hope to see YOU at the movies!!  Love, Cassie

if you can't make it, no need to post why. We understand and will catch you next time!

results.description:
MBrace is an open source library for the .NET framework that lets you easily declare scalable and extensible distributed computations. Dubbed "Async for the Cloud", the core programming model uses F# computation expressions for composing and distributing code and data. Its client-side integration enables instant deployment of scalable computations directly from F# interactive in Visual Studio.

In this talk I will giving an introduction and overview of MBrace and its programming model. I will also be discussing the project itself, its architecture and future development directions. Join us to learn how can use MBrace to target your own cloud infrastructure, or how you could possibly contribute in the overall development of the project.

Eirik George Tsarpalis is a mathematician who's been a professional F# developer for the past 4 years. He's core developer and primary contributor to the MBrace project and has authored an assortment of open source tools including FsPickler, Argu, Vagabond and QuotationCompiler.

Per usual doors open at 6:30pm, talk begins at 7:00pm. The meetup is at the 67th floor conference center.

Don't forget a photo ID for security!
results.how_to_find_us: Sign in with security (north side of the first floor) and head to the 67th floor conference center

Topic

Spring Boot has become very popular in the two years since its inception. A major factor in this success has been a great demand for fast application development while a key "secret" has been to provide an opinionated solution without sacrificing power and flexibility.

Come to this session to hear the story of Spring Boot, find out how it works, and learn how it can improve your web development experience. We’ll start with a basic REST service and we’ll gradually expand the feature set to see how Boot can help to create more real-world web applications by adding functionality such as security and serving of static resources.

About the Speaker


Rossen Stoyanchev is a committer on the Spring Framework team with a strong focus on web development including Spring MVC and WebSocket messaging. Previously Rossen consulted and trained Spring teams for several years. He has been involved with Java and web development in various industries and domains since the mid 90s.<a href="http://lanyrd.com/profile/rstoyanchev/bio/"></a>

results.description:
To bridge the gap between modeling tools and WebGL engines, Khronos has recently introduced glTF (GL Transmission Format).  glTF is a simple, efficient, extensible, interoperable format for the transmission and loading of 3D content.  This tech talk introduces glTF and the open-source ecosystem of pipeline tools and runtime engines that support glTF.

Patrick Cozzi, @pjcozzi

At Analytical Graphics, Inc. (AGI), Patrick leads the development of Cesium, an open-source WebGL virtual globe and map engine. He is the editor of WebGL Insights, co-editor of OpenGL Insights, coauthor of 3D Engine Design for Virtual Globes, and a member of the editorial board for the Journal of Computer Graphics Techniques. Patrick frequently presents at SIGGRAPH and contributes to other book series. As part of Khronos, he is the co-creator of glTF.  Patrick teaches GPU Programming and Architecture at the University of Pennsylvania, where he earned a master's degree in computer science.


We will be serving pizza and drink courtesy of the Khronos Group.

Patrick will also be giving away free copies of WebGL Insights - an essential book for any WebGL programmer!

results.description:
EVENT TYPE: Dining

DESCRIPTION:
Shanghai dishes usually look red and shiny, for they are often pickled in wine and their cooking methods include baking, stewing, braising, steaming, deep-frying, etc. Fish, crab, chicken are "drunken" with spirits and are briskly cooked, steamed, or served raw. Salted meats and preserved vegetables are also commonly used to enhance the dish. Sugar is an important ingredient in Shanghai cuisine, especially when used in combination with soy sauce. Another characteristic is the use of a great variety of seafood. Rice is dominantly served over noodle or other wheat products.
Shanghai cuisine stresses on using condiments and keeping the original flavors of the materials and has features of being fresh, smooth and crispy. It aims at lightness in flavor, and beautifulness in decoration. The raw materials of Shanghai dishes are well cut, and the colors harmoniously arranged.
Now, special attention is being paid to low-sugar and low-fat food, a good quantity of vegetables and nutritional values.
Generally Shanghai cuisine is mellower and slightly sweet in taste. Sweet and sour is a typical Shanghai taste.

MENU:
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/21-shanghai-house-new-york-4?tab=menu

• Wu Xi Ribs

• Basil eggplant

results.description:
Get Creative with IoT @ littleBits™ with littleBits™ Lab + More


Learn about littleBits and get a chance to create cool creations at the new littleBits Pop-Up Store!

About littleBits

littleBits™ is on a mission to Democratize Hardware by empowering everyone to Create Inventions, large and small, with a platform of easy-to-use Electronic Building Blocks. The company was founded in 2011 by MIT Media Lab graduate, TED Senior Fellow, and cofounder of the Open Hardware Summit, Ayah Bdeir.

The littleBits library includes 10 kits and nearly 70 interoperable modules, with products sold in more than 100 countries around the world and in over 2,000 schools and maker spaces. littleBits products have won more than 25 tech and education awards.

About Lance Weiler: Digital Storytelling Lab @Columbia

Lance Weiler is a founding member and director of the Digital Storytelling Lab @Columbia. The lab explores new forms and functions of storytelling.

Lance is a storyteller, entrepreneur and thought leader. An alum of the Sundance Screenwriters Lab, Lance is recognized as a pioneer because of the way he mixes storytelling and technology. WIRED magazine named him “One of twenty-five people helping to re-invent entertainment.”

Lance is the Director of Experiential Learning and Applied Creativity at Columbia University. The appointment is part of a campus wide initiative entitled Learn Do Share an effort to R&D the future of learning and work by harnessing storytelling, game mechanics, design thinking and technology.

We thank Atmel an ongoing sponsor of IoT Central | NYC.


IoT Central will be charging a nominal fee for this event to help defray the cost of the lab experience. For registration online before Nov. 2 the cost is $7.50 per person. For registration online after Nov. 2 the cost is $12.50 per person. Payment is required for RSVP and you must be on the RSVP list to attend.

Agenda


6:30pm    Arrive, Pizza, Networking

results.description:
Given by Yasuko Kasaki
Tuesdays from 6:30 – 7 pm
Free

Please join us in the sharing of miracles. Here, your mind can come to rest and you can remember true peace. No experience with meditation is required, and everyone is welcome. We ask only that you make it your intention to sit still, quiet in body and mind, and to listen to; receive and follow my instruction to the best of your ability. You will learn to meditate as you practice. Please arrive for Meditation before 6:30 pm as we don't allow latecomers to enter.

We at CRS are dedicated teachers and students of A Course in Miracles (ACIM) who are waiting to share miracles with you through our ACIM Healing. We ask the Holy Spirit to bring us directly to whatever seed thought is causing your current issues and we share forgiveness and bear witness to the miracles that are happening in your life. Each week I will share with you a different inspirational message from Holy Spirit. This may take the form of creative visualization exercises, or instruction about the nature and purpose of meditation, or about our true nature and relationship to ourselves, to one another, and to the world. In a sense, this is both a meditation practice and a meditation class.

Some students have been coming regularly for a number of years. Others drop in and out as they have time or need. Some come to learn and grow, others more so simply to calm down, to take time out from the frenetic pace of their busy lives. If you are new and feeling uncertain or shaky, do not hesitate to introduce yourself to some of the other students, to ask questions before or after. Try to observe and emulate the stillness and concentration of others around you whom you sense are most grounded. Soon, you, in turn, may provide inspiration and guidance for others.

While the principles are based on ACIM, it does not matter if you are unfamiliar with ACIM or are not prepared to study it outside of this meditation. You can still take from this practice some very practical, effective lessons, tools, and experiences that can enable you to lead a more peaceful, purposeful, fulfilling and loving life.

Namaste,

Yasuko Kasaki,
Founder
CRS (Center for Remembering & Sharing)
123 4th Ave, 2nd FL (between 12th & 13th streets, above Think Coffee)
New York, NY 10003
[masked]
www.crsny.org
results.name: ACIM-Based Guided Meditation

results.description:
Learn JavaScript Fundamentals w/ In-Person Instruction!

Fullstack's JavaScript Jumpstart is a two-week night course that teaches the "ABCs" of programming and JavaScript.

WHO IS THIS COURSE FOR? 

It's designed for students with little programming experience who want to get a "jumpstart" on their journey toward becoming a Fullstack developer. This course is also a great way to prepare for Fullstack Academy's admissions interviews. 

HOW IS THE COURSE STRUCTURED? WHAT IS THE SCHEDULE? 

The course will run over 3 evenings in two weeks. The three sessions will cover JavaScript fundamentals. Each concept will be covered by a practical hands-on workshop. You'll develop core programming skills and use them to build a cool final project, which will be created remotely after the 3rd class.  There will also be remote work to be completed during a portion of the off-nights.

HOW SHOULD I PREPARE FOR JUMPSTART?

All students will need to complete approximately 4-5 hours of pre-work before the first class.  Students are also required to bring their own laptop.

IS JAVASCRIPT JUMPSTART AN IN-PERSON OR REMOTE CLASS?

Both! There are two options for attending this course:

Live/In-Person - Jumpstart is taught at Fullstack Academy's campus in downtown NYC. Choose this option to attend all 3 evenings in-person, get in-person instruction and TA assistance, and see the Fullstack campus.

Remote/Online - If you can't make it to the Fullstack campus, you can attend JavaScript Jumpstart remotely. All lectures will be video-streamed, and workshop assistance will be available for remote students.

HOW MUCH DOES THE COURSE COST?

Tuition for this course is $295

HOW CAN I REGISTER? 

You must register through Eventbrite to secure a spot in the class. Head to the link below to signup for the class. Exclusively for our Meetup group members - Use the coupon code "jsmeetup" to take 15% off the price!

**Event Signup Link:https://november-jumpstart.eventbrite.com**

** More Info:JSNP Class Details** 


Class space is limited, sign up today to secure your spot!

Course Schedule: 6:45pm - 9:30pm, All Classes

Day 1: Tuesday Nov. 3, 2015

Day 2: Thursday Nov. 5, 2015

Day 3: Tuesday  Nov.10, 2015

There are new rules and <a>regulations</a> concerning the Tuesday <a>night</a> games. Please scroll down and read them all before signing up for the event.


There may not be space for you if you don't.


<a>Table</a> Top Role <a>Playing</a> Game Night!


This is the official <a>RPG game</a> night of the NY SciFi/Fan Meetup Group.

Every Tuesday night we get together to indulge in <a>Table Top RPGs</a>. There are <a>multiple games</a> going on at once, so getting involved in a game is <a>easy</a>.


For those of you unfamiliar with the term, a Table Top RPG (Role <a>Playing</a> Game) is a type of game where the players create characters based on the  story/system available and one person acts as a storyteller. Everyone interacts and works together to <a>create a story</a> and have a few laughs as well.


New Rules for Signing Up:


How to <a>sign up</a>: There will be at leas two <a>games running</a> each week.  You will be able to see who is running, what games are being <a>played</a>, and who is <a>playing</a> below. There will be a total of six spots <a>open</a> in each game, so if a game has filled up you will not be able to join that game. 


When you <a>sign up</a>, leave a comment stating which game you would like to participate in and your name will be added to the roster. If you would like to leave a game or switch over to another game in <a>progress</a>, simply speak to Justin or Cat. They will let you know if there is <a>open</a> space to do so.


If it is your first time <a>attending</a> a game, we have pre-made characters for you to <a>select</a> from. Beginning on your third RPG event, you may choose to make an original character for whatever game you're currently participating in.


Can I run my own game?: If you would like to run your own game, please contact Justin or Cat to reserve a slot.


Need Dice?: Please bring yours if you have some if you need extra I will provide some.

Games Currently Running:

Jutin: Full Steam Ahead 

A new steampunk-inspired RPG by Justin.

Cat: Monster of the Week

A game of investigating and fighting the things that go bump in the night. This campaign is set in a fictional California city a few years after WWII

results.description:
Maximize your potential with Russian Martial Arts!

CONQUER THE FEAR of a violent encounter.

INCREASE YOUR STRIKING POWER and learn practical self defense methods that will work ANYTIME, ANYWHERE


Develop a STRONG, FLEXIBLE, MOBILE PHYSIQUE and MENTAL FOCUS that will carry over into every aspect of your life.


Learn all this and much, much more at NJ RMA Self Defense Group, the official Meetup Group of System of Combat NJ.  Start your FALL with with Russian Martial Arts, your first class is FREE.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1tm6NW32NdI


Enjoy your first class for free and after that, it is only $10 per class with discounts available for pre-payment. No contract required! Classes are held at 7:00pm on Tuesday and Thursday evenings at the YMHA OF UNION on 501 Green Lane, Union, NJ 07083.

About Us

If you are interested in Systema, Reality Based Self Defense,  Martial Arts, Grappling, Street Defense, or Mobility and Body Awareness, this is the Meetup Group for you.  Men and women, seasoned martial artists and raw beginners alike will benefit from our dynamic classes which are tailored to the level and needs of the students. We focus on providing comprehensive instruction, plenty of personal attention and a relaxed atmosphere where you can train at your own pace and intensity. Individual classes are fast-paced and varied, ranging in subject from striking mechanics, grappling and ground fighting, evasive movement, weapon defense, sparring, and dealing with multiple attackers to women's self defense and street safety.
Copyright © 2013 System of Combat NJ                                   

About Systema

Systema is a combat style based on ancient Slavic fighting methods which were collected and codified by the Russian Soviet special forces.  It is a devastatingly effective and versatile combative program that can easily stand alone, or augment your existing practice.  The overarching focus is on responding to a threat spontaneously with natural, instinctive movement which strengthens and restores the body, clarifies the mind, and provides a framework for healthy, safe, life-long activity 

About the instructor 

Jim has over 25 years of martial arts experience in various styles including Brazilian Jiu-jitsu (BJJ), Silat, Boxing, Mixed Martial Arts (MMA) and Karate.  He is certified to teach Systema by Alex Wilkie (Alex Wilkie's Martial Arts Academy).

Directions

When you arrive, let the front desk know you are there for the martial arts class and they will direct you. (You do not have to be a Y-member to attend this class).  For general inquiries or more information, message organizers Jimi D or Drew here on the Meetup page.  If you need to reach the instructor, Jim, for any reason, call

results.description:
Our Tuesday night Central Park training workouts are typically tempo runs or hill repeats.  These workouts are usually very well attended with a wide variety of paces.

The meeting spot is at the 72nd street transverse by Bethesda Fountain. There we'll give the full workout details, including distance, pacing groups, expected run time, and where we plan on meeting at the end. You can expect a typical workout to be between 5 and 8 miles (or less during hill workouts).

A note on warm ups: We do not do a full warm up as a group in Central Park, so we encourage you to show up at 7 p.m. having jogged an easy mile or two ahead of time.

If it's your first time meeting us, feel free to come a few minutes early with any questions.  There are many other groups who meet on 72nd St so look for the one with folks in Whippet singlets.

Please note that there is no place to store bags inside Central Park. Pack light, or store your bags at a nearby gym if you are a member. Another option is the New York Running Company at the Time Warner Center, which stays open until 9pm: http://www.therunningcompany.net/new-yorks-homepage

results.description:
How often do we take the time to slow down, tune in to what our body needs, massage and stretch our muscles?

We live in a culture that values always being in action, either at our computer or at the gym (or even the yoga studio!).

But taking the time to stretch is just as important, both for its physical benefits as well as its psychological, emotional and spiritual ones.

It improves our range of motion, while also stretching our range of emotion.

- Release tightness and tension from your muscles
- Improve flexibility and circulation
- Relieve lower back pain
- Stress relief
- Deeper breathing, which leads to feelings of spaciousness and well-being
- Reconnecting with the body, leaving us feeling more whole, aware and capable of dealing with life's challenges
- Release 'happy' hormones
- Connect with the senses, sensuality and release shame around our body

We will start with a guided meditation, followed by deep breathing and slow stretching.

Please bring a yoga mat, a pen and journal, and dress comfortably.

See you on the mat!

Love always,

Melody

Sensual Meditative Stretching: Release Stress and Befriend Your Body

Tuesday November 3, 7-8 pm

Location TBD in New York, NY

$5 donation until Oct 30, $10 after

Register

NOTE: in order to cover costs, this meetup requires at least 4 people to be signed up and paid for through the link above 24 hrs prior for it to happen. Please RSVP mindfully.

----------------------------
ABOUT MELODY KIERSZ
Melody Kiersz holds a degree in Happiness from the prestigious New York University, is a Certified Holistic Health Counselor graduated from the Institute for Integrative Nutrition, a member of the American Association of Drugless Practitioners, and a Certified Yoga Teacher through Jungle Yoga Ashram.

Melody is a deep listener and reads between the lines to guide you in discovering the ways you're holding yourself back from your true expression. She specializes in healing our relationship with our bodies, our selves and others, improving body image and self-esteem, increasing our ability to speak up, share, and allow ourselves to be seen and loved as we are. As the Founder of Naked Wellness, her goal is to guide you as you peel all those layers of resistance so you can turn yourself on for a life full of health, passion, power, freedom, joy and pleasure.

Based in New York City, Melody offers in-person and long-distance private sessions, and is really passionate about everyone really getting that they are absolutely perfect exactly as they are.

Find out more at nakedwellness.com

results.description:
Dorothy Cummings and Orly Krasner will call a lovely program of English country dance with live musical accompaniment by The Gotham Gals.

Come dance to a live caller and band with Country Dance New York.  We are an intergenerational, multiethnic, smoke and alcohol free, inclusive community with one thing in common:  we love to contra and English country dance! 

English country dance is choreographed community dancing, with repertoire ranging from court dances of the 1650s through dances composed this year. If you’ve seen any of the Jane Austen movies, you’ve glimpsed some kinds of ECD.

Please bring a pair of clean, soft soled shoes {no spike heels} to dance in, and a water bottle.  We ask that you not use strongly scented grooming products as the smell can become overwhelming on the dance floor when things start to heat up. 

Country Dance New York has been hosting contra dances most Saturdays, and English country dancing most Tuesdays, at Church of the Village for almost 70 years.   COV is located at 201 W. 13 St., on the northwest corner of 7th Avenue.  

Beginners' session on Saturdays {for contra} is from 7:30 to 8:00.  Dancing for all from 8:00 until 10:45.  Hang out with us at a local diner after the dance.

Beginner's session on Tuesdays {for ECD} is from 7:00 to 7:30.  Dancing for all from 7:30 to 10:30.

Cost:  $15 for general public; $12 members and for full time students with ID.  Be sure to tell the people at the door if this is your first time dancing with us.  They will give you a free pass to return as our guest! 

To see what contra dancing looks like, click here:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mM5vNzFxxBs 

To see what English country dancing looks like, click here:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rB40AvJnMUY 

Join us on Facebook:  https://www.facebook.com/groups/2449906414/

For a complete schedule of our upcoming season, and for more information, visit our website.

See you on the dance floor!

results.description:
Turandot

Exquisitely dramatic.  Nessun Dorma, one of the most beautiful songs from opera you will ever hear, is one you are promised to hear tonight in one of the most spectacularly produced operas, Turandot by Puccini.


Christine Goerke, Lise Lindstrom, and Nina Stemme, three of opera’s greatest dramatic sopranos, take turns in the title role of the proud princess of legendary China. Tenors Marcelo Álvarez and Marco Berti are Calàf, the brave prince who sings “Nessun dorma” and wins her hand. Franco Zeffirelli’s golden production is conducted by Paolo Carignani.


Turandot in Verona 2014:  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-aUyBvFpY7k

Luciano Pavarotti with Nessun Dorma:  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lMD_5UzjdqQ 

Act I 


Outside the Imperial Palace in Peking, a mandarin reads an edict to the crowd: any prince seeking to marry the princess Turandot must answer three riddles. If he fails, he will die. The most recent suitor, the Prince of Persia, is to be executed at the moon’s rising. Among the onlookers are the slave girl Liù, her aged master, and the young Calàf, who recognizes the old man as his long lost father, Timur, vanquished King of Tartary. When Timur reveals that only Liù has remained faithful to him, Calàf asks why. She replies that once, long ago, Calàf smiled at her. The mob cries for blood but greets the rising moon with a sudden fearful silence. When the Prince of Persia is led to his execution, the crowd calls upon the princess to spare him. Turandot appears, and with a contemptuous gesture orders that the execution proceed. As the victim’s death cry is heard from the distance, Calàf, transfixed by the beauty of the unattainable princess, strides to the gong that announces a new suitor. Suddenly Turandot’s three ministers, Ping, Pang, and Pong, appear to discourage him. Timur and the tearful Liù also beg him not to risk his life (“Signore, ascolta!”). Calàf tries to comfort her (“Non piangere, Liù”) but then strikes the gong and calls Turandot’s name.

Act II 


Inside the palace, Ping, Pang, and Pong lament Turandot’s bloody reign, praying that love will conquer her heart and restore peace. The three let their thoughts wander to their peaceful country homes (Trio: “Ho una casa nell’Honan”), but the noise of the people gathering to hear Turandot question the new challenger calls them back to reality.

The old emperor asks Calàf to reconsider, but he will not be dissuaded. Turandot enters and describes how her beautiful ancestor, Princess Lou-Ling, was abducted and killed by a conquering prince. In revenge, she has turned against men and determined that none shall ever possess her (“In questa reggia”). Facing Calàf, she poses her first question: What is born each night and dies each dawn? “Hope,” Calàf answers, correctly. Turandot continues: What flickers red and warm like a flame, yet is not a flame? “Blood,” Calàf replies after a moment’s thought. Shaken, Turandot delivers the third riddle: What is like ice but burns? Tense silence prevails until Calàf triumphantly cries, “Turandot!” The crowd erupts in joy, and the princess vainly begs her father not to give her to the stranger. Hoping to win her love, Calàf offers Turandot a challenge of his own: if she can learn his name by dawn, he will forfeit his life.


Act III 

In the Imperial Gardens, Calàf hears a proclamation: on pain of death no one in Peking shall sleep until Turandot learns the stranger’s name. Calàf is certain of his victory (“Nessun dorma!”), but Ping, Pang, and Pong try to bribe him to leave the city. As the fearful mob threatens him to learn his name, soldiers drag in Liù and Timur. Calàf tries to convince the crowd that neither of them knows his secret. When Turandot appears, commanding Timur to speak, Liù replies that she alone knows the stranger’s identity and will never reveal it. She is tortured but remains silent. Impressed by such fortitude, Turandot asks Liù’s secret. It is love, she replies. When the soldiers intensify the torture, Liù tells Turandot that she, too, will know the joys of love (“Tu, che di gel sei cinta”). Then she snatches a dagger and kills herself. The crowd forms a funeral procession and the body is taken away. Turandot remains alone to confront Calàf, who impetuously kisses her (Duet: “Principessa di morte!”). Knowing emotion for the first time, Turandot weeps (“Del primo pianto”). Calàf, now sure of winning her, reveals his identity.

Once again before the emperor’s throne, Turandot declares she knows the stranger’s name: it is Love.


Tickets

Please visit metopera.org.  Click on calendar.  Select November 3's date.  Select the Turandot evening performance.  Then, select your seat of choice. 

Meeting Details

7:00 pm We will meet in the lobby, in front of the gift shop.  It is located on the right side of the ticket office. I will send out my cell phone number via group email the night before the event. 

We will also meet at intermission on the lower level (parking level) lounge for drinks or tea. There are high tops there and it is less frequented so it will be comfortable for making conversation between acts. 

See you soon!
results.name: Turandot!  Metropolitan Opera

Opening Night of JCC Rockland's Festival of Arts, Books and Culture
Register online at jccrockland.org/abc

Tickets: $18 in advance / $23 at the door

A moving and revealing exploration of Hasidic life, and one man’s struggles with faith, family, and community.

Shulem Deen was raised to believe that questions are dangerous. As a member of the Skverers, one of the most insular Hasidic sects in the US, he knows little about the outside world—only that it is to be shunned. His marriage at eighteen is arranged and several children soon follow. Deen’s first transgression—turning on the radio—is small, but his curiosity leads him to the library, and later the Internet. Soon he begins a feverish inquiry into the tenets of his religious beliefs, until, several years later, his faith unravels entirely.

Now a heretic, he fears being discovered and ostracized from the only world he knows. His relationship with his family at stake, he is forced into a life of deception, and begins a long struggle to hold on to those he loves most: his five children. In All Who Go Do Not Return, Deen bravely traces his harrowing loss of faith, while offering an illuminating look at a highly secretive world.

Event followed by dessert reception

About The Author: Shulem Deen is the founding editor of Unpious, an online journal for voices on the Hasidic fringe. His work has appeared in The New Republic, Salon, Tablet Magazine, The Jewish Daily Forward, and elsewhere. He serves as a board member at Footsteps, a New York City-based organization that offers assistance and support to those who have left the ultra-Orthodox Jewish community. He lives in Brooklyn, New York.
results.name: Author Shulem Deen: All Who Go Do Not Return

results.description:
Brian introduces the oldest computer language there is - one that predates the Turing machine and digital computers both: the Lambda Calculus.  Despite being the oldest computer language there is, this language serves as the basis for the most powerful and advanced languages of today - Lisp and Haskell (as well as being a basis for mathematics and logic).

Brian will describe the entire langage, and give implementations for some "advanced" features - like numbers, booleans, tuples, and lists.  This will hopefully shed interesting light on the boundary between what qualifies as code and what qualifies as data.
