results.description:
In this informal group we will consult this timeless oracle and use it as theme setter for contemplation. The I-Ching (Yijing, Book of Changes) is a helpful way to frame the energies of life and life matters, and leads us to self-understanding. It is also an enjoyable way to explore perennial philosophy and Taoist arts - the latter of which it actually predates. 

Did you know there is an Edgar Cayce’s readings version of the I-Ching? Yes, we will reference this too!  

Participants will be coached in framing queries, and as a part of a brief meditation allowed to privately select a query for response. The class will include consulting, drawing out an image, discussion and a few short periods of silent meditation with feedback.

Dress comfortably and be prepared to sit for a few periods of 3-5 minutes in silence, as you formulate your question and reflect on the answer. A notepad will be useful for those that wish to keep a record. Participants may bring their own version of the I-Ching if they wish. The workshop aims to give you a response on a personal matter and improve your knowledge base and skill in the I-Ching system. All are welcome.

Cost: $20 (ARE Members 15% off)

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, time it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

No fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds: Cancel your RSVP 24 hours or more before the game and we will make the refund. No refund for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

Name of the school William J. O’Shea (100W): The school entrance is located on West 77th street between Columbus and Amsterdam avenues (pretty much in the middle of the block) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right), Please wait and someone will open the door for you.  the court is on the second floor. 

For questions: Use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

results.description:
Dear Enneagram Group,

We'll continue the music series in November, in a new format intended to make it more interactive.  For those new to the series, we are exploring the world of music through an Enneagram lens, looking for how the Enneagram type of a musical creator manifests itself.  Typically, this means identifying the real-life type of a composer, and trying to see if we can "hear" something of the essence of this type in some aspect of his/her music.  In some cases (e.g., where a particular performance of a piece of music is very famous or influential), a performer might also be considered a co-creator (or a lyricist, choreographer, etc.), and the type of these co-creators might then also be relevant.  See the announcement for our Sept., 2015, meeting for more background.


New Format

At the suggestion of a group-member last time, we'll try asking everyone to try to contribute one short piece - a piece that for you evokes the essence of a particular Enneagram type (whatever type you choose).  Ideally, you will know the actual type of a principal creator of your piece (presumably, this will be the same type evoked), but if this isn't possible, just focus on the human qualities the a given piece of music evokes for you.

You shouldn't tell the group what type you have in mind - we'll just play the pieces contributed, and have a group discussion about how they strike all of us.

Of course, if you can't think of a piece to contribute, you are still welcome to attend, but if as many people as possible pitch in, it would help make for an interesting meeting.  There is no "right answer" - we're just looking for an example of a piece that means something human to you, in a type-identifiable way.  If you can think of many examples, consider picking a historically-important piece of music - one that's likely to mean something to others in the group.

Please pick a short piece of music - say, around three minutes - or, if you are drawn to longer pieces - try to identify a 2-3 minute important segment we can excerpt.  You can identify more than one piece if you like -we'll arrange as time allows.


Advance Submission Requested

Given that we might receive a pretty wide variety of types/genres, I think it would be helpful to arrange the contributed pieces thematically, rather than jumping all over the place - i.e., from classical, to rock'n'roll, to hip-hop (or, whatever) and back again.

Accordingly, if you could please email me with one (or perhaps two or three) pieces at least a bit ahead of the meeting - say by Monday, November 2, at noon - that would be a great help towards preparing something easier and more interesting to listen to than a random jumble.

You can email me by clicking the "contact" button below my picture under "Organizer" at left toward the top of the pages associated with our group.  A pop-up window should appear.

(There is no need to tell me what type of you have in mind, either.  We'll get to that part later.)


Media for Submitted Pieces


Last time, we played music using several media - some CD's I prepared, YouTube videos, and pieces on one member's mobile device.  I think the YouTube video medium probably worked best.  It's a practical way to find a great variety of music (for those not familiar, you can find many, many pieces there).  Also, the visuals add something to the group-listening experience - obviously, this is most significant for a singer-songwriter performing his/her own music.  But even for a long-dead classical composer, listening while watching an expressive soloist, group, or conductor can open up a another dimension.

Accordingly, please email me a YouTube link (or two or three), if you can.  You can copy and paste the link from another widow in your browser to the Meetup pop-up message-window.  If you can't find the piece you want on YouTube, try bringing a CD - or your own device, if nothing else works.  I will again have the large tablet-device I used last time, so we can all watch and listen together.


Looking forward to see you,

Nicholas

(Group Organizer)

PS - note on schedule - last time, I spoke of possibly moving our monthly meetings to first Mondays -  this may still happen, but not until early next year at the earliest.
results.name: Music Series (pt 2) - New Format

ABOUT MOVIE
BROOKLYN tells the profoundly moving story of Ellis Lacey, a young Irish immigrant navigating her way through 1950s Brooklyn. Lured by the promise of America, Ellis departs Ireland and the comfort of her mother's home for the shores of New York City. The initial shackles of homesickness quickly diminish as a fresh romance sweeps Ellis into the intoxicating charm of love. But soon, her vivacity is disrupted by her past, and Ellis must choose between two countries and the lives that exist within.

The Better Angels of Our Nature: Why Violence Has Declined by Steven Pinker, the Times bestseller will be discussed at this month's book club.

Believe it or not, today we may be living in the most peaceful moment in our species' existence. In his gripping and controversial new work, New York Times bestselling author Steven Pinker shows that despite the ceaseless news about war, crime, and terrorism, violence has actually been in decline over long stretches of history. Exploding myths about humankind's inherent violence and the curse of modernity, this ambitious book continues Pinker's exploration of the essence of human nature, mixing psychology and history to provide a remarkable picture of an increasingly enlightened world.


This event is hosted by Bob Braine. for information on this month's book, email [masked]. This event is FREE and OPEN TO THE PUBLIC.

PLEASE NOTE that we limit attendance to better insure that all get a chance to have their writing critiqued.  If our maximum for the week is reached, you have the option of being notified when someone changes their RSVP to no.  PLEASE DO NOT RSVP YES UNLESS YOU ARE AS SURE AS IS HUMANLY POSSIBLE THAT YOU WILL BE ABLE TO ATTEND AND CHANGE YOUR RSVP TO NO IMMEDIATELY if your situation does change, for the sake of those waiting for a spot.  


Join us for a weekly get together of sometimes frank and hopefully always constructive criticism of your literary work. There is no restriction on the type of genre and only a few rules:

1. Bring up to 6 double spaced typed pages of your work for reading. Additional copies would be helpful in order to allow others in the group to follow along.

2. The author is not allowed to speak while feedback is being provided.

3. The same piece should not be reread at a future workshop.

We will meet every Tuesday at 7 PM on the first floor of the Central Library, unless a meetup is not scheduled for that date due to a holiday or other event. A floor plan link is available at http://www.brooklynpubliclibrary.org/sites/default/files/files/pdf/central/floorplan.pdf.

Hope to see all of you there.

David

results.description:
At the initial stage of business development it is not an easy task to look into the future to determine who will share and in what proportion in the value created by the company. Outside investors and other circumstances may significantly change the initial structure of ownership. However, there are certain matters that founders must consider and implement in the company’s formation documents should they want to preserve certain control over the company in spite of the possible changes, ensure certain privileges for themselves as being the originators of the idea, and avoid undesirable tax consequences should the price of the company’s stock raise.

During this meet up we will review the following considerations:

•  Should founders pay for their stock in cash or contribute intellectual property?

• Should founders stock be subject to vesting before a venture financing?

• What should the vesting terms of founder stock be before a venture financing?

• What is an IRS 83(b) election?

• What is qualified small business stock?

• What is Series FF stock?

• What is Class F common stock?

and many other substantial issues.

Followed by informal networking.
results.name: FOUNDERS ISSUES

results.description:
Thank you to everyone for coming to October's Smutty Book Club.  It was clear passions and opinions ran hot with This Man by Jodi Ellen Malpas - loved it or hated it, we all finished it and most bought the next two books :)  We are eagerly waiting for Heidi to post Benedict Cumberbatch's description of Sherlock Holmes' take on sex. It was great seeing some of you at Comic Con, sorry to those we missed! Please bring your pictures to the next book club! 

The book for November 3rd is A Hunger Like No Other by Kreseley Cole.  Recommended by Lindsey, AKA Batgirl if you saw her at NY Comic Con.  

In keeping with tradition, this is a Supernatural book for Halloween!  But don't worry, we are promised the book doesn't take forever setting up the universe, it's pretty self explanatory.  

Here's what the publisher says: 

A mythic warrior who'll stop at nothing to possess her...
After enduring years of torture from the vampire horde, Lachlain MacRieve, leader of the Lykae Clan, is enraged to find the predestined mate he's waited millennia for is a vampire. Or partly one. This Emmaline is a small, ethereal half Valkyrie/half vampire, who somehow begins to soothe the fury burning within him.
A vampire captured by her wildest fantasy...
Sheltered Emmaline Troy finally sets out to uncover the truth about her deceased parents—until a powerful Lykae claims her as his mate and forces her back to his ancestral Scottish castle. There, her fear of the Lykae—and their notorious dark desires—ebbs as he begins a slow, wicked seduction to sate her own dark cravings.
An all-consuming desire...
Yet when an ancient evil from her past resurfaces, will their desire deepen into a love that can bring a proud warrior to his knees and turn a gentle beauty into the fighter she was born to be?


Here's what the people say: 

Jessica H on Goodreads: This book had a slow start, but finished with a bang!


Vered on Goodreads: A nice story, nice writing, nice sex.Two problems: 1. This I'll kidnap you and hold you prisoner until you love me thing is a bit hummm unsettling. 2. It seems like too many of the PNR/UF heroines tend to be, well, annoying. Either the kick ass annoying or the wimpy annoying. 

So there you have it. Download, pick-up, or borrow the book.  Enjoy these sexy vampires, werewolves, demons, valkyries, shape-shifters, wraiths, witches and more.  Have a Happy Halloween and see you on November 3rd at Smutty Book Club! 

Dawn 

http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B000GCFCXW?keywords=a%20hunger%20like%20no%20other&qid=1444673772&ref_=sr_1_1&s=books&sr=1-1

• Transition from UX to Design with Sketch

• Style Guides in Sketch

• Sketch Plugins

• UX Case Studies


Special guests include owners of GigLeaf, the invite-only community for hiring and staffing opportunities at top agencies.

Space provided by Motivate Design, a user research firm in NYC.

IMPROV FOR ACTORS - Just for Fun

This Improve with Improvworkshop will focus on having more fun on stage. Many actors get so bogged down and overwhelmed with learning and practicing their craft, preparing for auditions, competing for jobs, etc., that they stop enjoying themselves.

This workshop will be a series of games, exercises and scenes done just for the sheer fun of it! Get back in touch with the childlike enjoyment of performance that inspired you to pursue acting in the first place.

A fun safe and non-competitive environment is created in which each participant will learn how to work through inhibitions and tap into their imaginations.

Suggested Donation: $15*

*most improv classes in NYC cost $35-$50 per session or more.

results.description:
Join us for our weekly Boardgaming Meetup. This week we'll be at TGI Friday's on Austin Street. We're a friendly group of gamers that play everything from Monopoly to Ticket to Ride to Zombicide! Everyone is welcome - all ages (must be over 21) but must be young at heart!

If you don't recognize the games, don't worry, everyone is happy to teach new players the rules.

We usually go for about 3-4 hours but people drop in any time and leave when they need to. If you're looking for a chill, fun way to spend a Tuesday night - come!

To support the venue, please purchase a bite to eat or a few drinks (soda is fine!).

If anyone has a specific game they wish to play, feel free to ask. I am sure between us all, we should have it.

We also have a Facebook group. Everyone in the Meetup is welcome. Just click the link and ask to join. Someone will add you once they can.

results.description:
Open Office Hours

Meeting every Tuesday evening, 7:00PM - 10:00PM

This month's host: devbootcamp

Office hours is open to developers of any background and skill level. Newcomers to programming, Python, or NYC are all welcome, as well as experienced programmers and locals. The purpose of this event is to promote learning and community involvement within the NYC Python community.

Activities vary and may include (but are not limited to):

Informal tech talks: Topics can be anything related to Python or programming. Have a topic you'd like to see presented? Leave a comment starting with "Talk topic suggestion". Want to present? Message the organizers.

Technical discussions: Bring your code and / or questions about any relevant topic, and there will most likely be someone present who can help. For questions about a specific topic, please leave a comment in the form of "Need help with Django / Nginx / SQL". If you're able to help with a particular topic, please leave a comment in the form of "Can help with Flask / Apache / NoSQL".

Note: Recruiting and other solicitation are not allowed at these events. These are run for developers by developers. Behavior that makes others uncomfortable will not be tolerated, and offenders will be asked to leave.

Profuse thanks go to our sponsors for loaning us this space and providing refreshments.

Thank you, and see you Tuesday night!
results.name: Tuesday Office Hours

results.description:
A Course in Miracles Healing Clinic at CRS
 Mon. & Tue. 7 – 7:40 pm
Sun 1 – 2 pm (12 – 1 pm on 2nd Sun of the month)
Suggested donation $20. No one is turned away.

Bring any issue you are facing right now — physically, emotionally, mentally, and/or spiritually. With eyes closed (you will be seated and a healer will stand nearby; no touching is involved), a CRS healer, trained in A Course in Miracles and spiritual reading/healing, will observe you with his inner sight, free of any judgments, as your truly are, a perfect shining spirit. Together, will ask the Holy Spirit (or Inner Guide if you prefer) to bring us directly to whatever seed thought is causing your current issues and ask for guidance about how your spirit really wants to make use of your present situation for its growth and sharing of love. After about 10 minutes of meditation, we will share the inspirational guidance that we receive. 

Aside from sharing the message that we receive from the Holy Spirit, we don't talk during this meetup event. We share healing quietly and provide you with an opportunity to come to rest, reflect, and remember who you truly are, in a supportive, non-judgmental, meditative environment.

We'd like to offer you an opportunity to experience stillness of mind and peace so that you can return to harmony with your true nature and purpose. Then you will find that rather than needing "solutions" to "problems" you will realize that you have no problems except those that you project.

We call this spiritual healing but it is not religious nor connected with any church or group. It is simply a practice of meditating together on our true nature and connecting with universal spirit/energy or what you will.

A Note About the Role of Words in Healing: "Strictly speaking, words play no part at all in healing. The motivating factor is prayer, or asking. What you ask for you receive. But this refers to the prayer of the heart, not to the words you use in praying. Sometimes the words and the prayer are contradictory; sometimes they agree. It does not matter. God does not understand words, for they were made by separated minds to keep them in the illusion of separation. Words can be helpful, particularly for the beginner, in helping concentration and facilitating the exclusion, or at least the control, of extraneous thoughts. Let us not forget, however, that words are but symbols of symbols. They are thus twice removed from reality...." — A Course in Miracles Manual for Teachers, Section 21

"Since only the mind can be sick, only the mind can be healed. Only the mind is in need of healing." —"PSYCHOTHERAPY: Purpose, Process and Practice,"Supplements to A Course in Miracles
results.how_to_find_us: CRS is located one block east of Broadway and one and a half blocks south of Union Square, above Think Coffee shop.

results.description:
Questions/Scriptures to be discussed include:

1. Why does God permit so much evil in the world?
2. What does mankind's future look like, as per the Bible?
3. Are science and faith mutually exclusive? Could they be reconciled with each other?
4. What happens when a man dies?
5. What has happened over 2000 years of church history and how has that changed Christianity from its original version?
6. Can the Bible be harmonized from Genesis to Revelation? Does it contradict itself anywhere?
7. What is the Kingdom of Heaven?
8. Why did Jesus tell so many parables (more than 90%) about his upcoming Kingdom?
9. What's the purpose of this Kingdom of God?
10. Why is it taking so long to come? Hasn't it been 2000 years since Jesus?
results.name: Tuesday Evening Bible Study (Newport)

results.description:
Let's participate in Hudson Valley Restaurant Week by going to the Twisted Oak in Tarrytown on Tuesday Nov 3rd starting at 7pm. We will be seated at 7:30.  Your $3 fee will secure your spot. 

The region is celebrating Fall Hudson Valley Restaurant Week presented by The Valley Table from November 2-15 with an impressive list of restaurants. You have two whole weeks to eat your way through the Hudson Valley, giving you plenty of time to try new eateries and return to old favorites, all offering amazing prix-fixe menus at a discounted price.

From Yonkers to Kingston, restaurants will offer special three-course lunch ($20.95) and dinner menus ($29.95), plus tip, tax and drinks of course!  Guests (21 years of age and older) can pair those meals with the local wines and cocktails.So what are you waiting for… lets eat!

Chef Michael Cutney's newest Venture The Twisted Oak, takes a fun and casual approach to New American Fare with Italian Influences. Sourcing from Local Farmers and Growers,The Twisted Oak offers a daily changing menu featuring ingredients from the Hudson Valleys' Bounty. Located just steps away from the famed Tarrytown Music Hall, the Restaurant is set in a turn of the century photography studio. The main dining room is dressed with paintings from local artists and the bar, which was handcrafted from Oak Wine Barrels, you can expect to find boutique wines, seasonal cocktails, and local brews. The Twisted Oak is quickly becoming a neighborhood favorite with its delicious food, refined service, and excellent hospitality.


Check out their menu and picts on their facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/The.Twisted.Oak.Restaurant?fref=ts

They haven't posted their RW menu yet, but when it is posted I will add it here.. in the meantime, rsvp - as they do not take parties larger than 6 !  Your $3 fee will secure you a spot for this hot upcoming restaurant..
results.how_to_find_us: please find us at restaurant or via cell phone
results.name: Let's go to the Twisted Oak in Tarrytown for HudsonValley Restaurant Week

results.description:
In this group, you'll learn new ways of communicating in order to share more vulnerably and openly, bring attention more fully to the present in order to discover the richness of whats happening in relationship with others, and begin to see and co-explore aspects of yourself you may have been unaware of before in service of greater self-understanding, expression and awareness. You'll have the opportunity to learn and use new tools to participate in circles by sharing yourself, understanding others, and growing in both enjoyment of and capacity for presence and deep connection.

The more Ive seen people Circle the more genuine, " in the moment" conversations Ive seen become possible for them.

Likewise, the more Ive seen them become comfortable in their own skin, get clear on what their feeling, wanting or needing in any moment, grow in a sense of presence and natural interest in others, and generally embody a deep capacity for presence and authenticity.

If connecting profoundly with others, developing present moment awareness, and learning new communication skills inspires you, come try Circling out! The cost is $20

results.description:
In this course you will learn how to use the Arduino to control many types and sizes of motors - from tiny motors the size of a fingernail to hacked cordless drills.  After this two hour course you will know how to select motors for their various purposes and how to write the software that drives the motors at different speeds and direction and to confirm that the commands have been carried out properly.

Reviews from our previous courses:


• "Awesome! I'd definitely go to a follow-up."

• "Great workshop, just the right touch to whet my appetite."

Requirements

We will provide laptops and Arduinos for participants.


About The Rockland County Makerspace and CILK119


This course is hosted by the Rockland County Makerspace @CILK119 (www.cilk119.com), a co-working space located in Nanuet, NY.  

Dr. Duncan Bell is a life-long tinkerer who graduated from making go-karts and skateboards to designing industrial robots that support pharmaceutical research. Along the way he earned a PhD in Botany and Biophysics and conducted research in Scotland, Italy, and the United States in photosynthesis, cancer, and arthritis. In addition to spreading the word about the fantastic capabilities of the current generation of microcontrollers, he heads up a small company that develops custom storefront displays with coordinated motion and lighting—all driven by Arduinos. Recently, his Arduino-based float was a prize winner at the Nyack Halloween parade and his Persistence of Vision special effect was featured in Elmwood Playhouse’s recent production of “Sunday in the Park with George.” 

Attendees at a recent Arduino Course
results.how_to_find_us: http://www.cuppapulp.com/cilk119/location-directions/
results.name: Using Motors with the Arduino
Discuss ways to help us grow in all areas of our life.

results.description:
Universal Basic Income is a public system under which every citizen of a country receives an unconditional sum of money, either from the government or other public institution. 

Over the last several years, this concept has begun to take traction, as tests of UBI have been met with success in pilot groups within Nimibia and India. Researchers report that there are major benefits to this type of system, including higher productivity and employment.

Brendan Lauer will kick off this Think Tank with an overview of the research behind UBI. We'll then launch into a detailed discussion on various applications in the US and developed countries (including negative income taxes). 


A brief overview of UBI can be found here >>>

Can't wait. RSVP now to save your spot - a resource list will follow in the next few days.

Cheers!

Dan
results.name: Universal Basic Income with Brendan Lauer

SPECIAL NOTE TO MEMBERS:

:::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::

Please join us at our November General Meeting of the Rockville Centre Tea Party Patriots-  Tuesday, November 3rd, at 7:00 PM.

This month we feature the movie "IRANIUM"

Iran’s nuclear program presents a threat to international stability.  Yet successive American administrations—Republican and Democratic alike—have misread the intentions and actions of the Iranian regime.

How dangerous is a nuclear Iran, even if it never detonates a weapon?  What are the guiding principles of the Iranian leadership?  To what lengths would the regime go to carry out its agenda?  How far have Iran’s leaders already gone to fund the world’s most powerful terrorist organizations?  And why have American leaders failed to gain the upper hand in relations with Iran during the past 30 years?

In approximately 60 minutes, Iranium powerfully reports on the many aspects of the threat America and the world now face using rarely-before seen footage of Iranian leaders, and interviews with 25 leading politicians, Iranian dissidents, and experts on: Middle East policy, terrorism, and nuclear proliferation.

Iranium documents the development of Iran’s nuclear threat, beginning with the Islamic Revolution of 1979 and the ideology installed by Supreme Leader Ayatollah Khomeini.Iranium tracks Iran’s use of terror as a tool of policy, beginning with the 444 day seizure of the U.S. Embassy in Tehran, through Iran’s insurgent actions in Iraq and Afghanistan.Iranium details the brutal nature of the Iranian regime to its own citizens, and the Iranian people’s desire to rejoin the international community.Iranium outlines the various scenarios the greater Middle East and the Western world may face should Iran cross the nuclear threshold.

**************************************************************************

Also, "Bob Dann's Tea Party University", and his specially  hand picked "Video(s) of the Month".


***************************************************************************

Don't forget to purchase your 50/50 raffle tickets at all of our meetings. Last month's winner walked away with  $150.00! Get a full arm's length of tickets for only $10.00. You can use your arm, our arm, or the really tall guy with the long arms sitting next to you!!

Remember, we use the proceeds of our monthly raffle sales to help offset the costs of running our meetings. Please participate, and be generous!

*****************************************************************

Please Note:

Speakers and agenda times listed above are subject to change. With only a few exceptions our General Meetings are held the first Tuesday of every month from 7:00 to 9:00 PM at the American Legion Hall, 197 Maple Avenue Rockville Centre. All of our meetings are open to the public. Doors open around 6:30 for early-birds, shmoozers, and those wishing to help us set up the meeting. Our actual meeting begins at 7 PM.

All are welcome. Bring your neighbors, bring your friends!

We respectfully request that you RSVP your attendance to all of our meetings and events regardless of if you are able to attend or not. Simply click the link contained inside this invitation to RSVP.  Please do it now. Thank You.

Fun Home is one of Broadway's biggest hits -- winning this year's Best New Musical Tony Award! But did you know it was adapted from a graphic novel memoir by cartoonist Alison Bechdel? This meeting we'll explore the world of Beech Creek, PA, as we discuss the book version of Fun Home (though thoughts on the show are welcome as well). 

Pick up a copy of the book at the Bellmore Library, just ask for it at the Circulation Desk, and mention that your with the coffehouse graphic novel book club. This club is open to all, Bellmore residency is not required, so join us!

Questions or comments? Call librarian Valerie Acklin at (516)[masked] or email at [masked].

results.description:
7:15PM- 8:15 PM
We will accommodate all levels so if you are New or have been shaking it for awhile come down and join us. There is plenty of room to grow here.

Zumba for ALL! - The Zumba® program fuses hypnotic Latin rhythms and easy-to-follow moves to create a one-of-a-kind fitness program that will blow you away. Our goal is simple: We want you to want to work out, to love working out, to get hooked. Zumba® Fanatics achieve long-term benefits while experiencing an absolute blast in one exciting hour of calorie-burning, body-energizing, awe-inspiring movements meant to engage and captivate for life!

The routines feature interval training sessions where fast and slow rhythms and resistance training are combined to tone and sculpt your body while burning fat. Add some Latin flavor and international zest into the mix and you’ve got a Zumba® class!

Prices: $15.00 walk-in or $100 /10 class punch card $75/6 class punch card  *Our current specials - *1st time at our class your walk-in price only $10!       *Bring 2 Friends Get $5 off your next walk-in or punch card purchase.
results.name: Ozone Park Zumba

results.description:
Please Join us on November 3rd

Guest Teacher

Carl Chimon Viggiani, Sensei

We are fortunate to have Carl Viggiani, Sensei visit with us.

Carl is a Dharma Heir of Robert Kennedy, SJ, Roshi.

Carl began formal study of Zen Buddhism with the Japanese Teacher Eido Roshi in 1987, later moving to Dai Bosatsu Zendo, Eido Roshi's monastery in the Catskills, where he lived and practiced until 1993. He continued with Daido Loori Roshi at Zen Mountain Monastery, and with Roshi Robert Kennedy at Morning Star Zendo in Jersey City.

He will sit, offer daisan (one to one teaching) in the second period and a Dharma talk in the last period.

Please Join Us!

Questions or comments? Contact us at:

E-Mail: [masked]

website: whiteplainszen.org
<a>[masked]</a>
St. Bartholmew's Church
82 Prospect St.
White Plains, NY 10606

results.description: Tuesday runs start and end at (now closed) Tilted Kilt. We meet up in front of the pub, run a 5 mile course in Liberty State Park and finish back at the Tilted Kilt. From there we walk over to Grove Square bar for some food and drinks. The Happy Hour special includes $2 domestic beers (Coors, PBR) and $3-$4 premium beers (Sam Adams, Sierra Nevada).

results.description:
Meditation leads to inner peace, overcomes loneliness, improves relationships, and has many other benefits for mind and body. We will investigate how meditation works to calm our mind throughout our busy life. Find out how to fit an enjoyable meditation practice into your present lifestyle, and learn time tested methods for improving mindfulness, concentration, and happiness. Beginners and those wanting to continue to learn meditation are welcome in this class.

Concetta Lamore has been a Kadampa meditation practitioner for over 7 years. She exudes gratitude for the wisdom derived from her study of Buddhism and her joyful daily practice. She feels blessed to be able to share the many ways in which our lives can be filled with inner peace and happiness.
results.name: Learning to Meditate ~ Everyone Welcome 7:30pm with Concetta Lamore

results.description:
Join us Tuesday for West Coast Swing at Slate, a cool venue with wood floors, mood lighting, great sound system, yummy drinks & fun dancing. Extended Happy Hour for dancers from 4pm until 9 pm!

Leveled Lessons We are excited to offer two leveled classes from 7:30 - 8:30 pm, NO PARTNER needed! Dancers rotate during class. Each week will focus on a different set of skills and will help take each dancer to the next level of their dancing! The level 1 class is for anyone who would like to learn the basics of west coast swing. The level 2 class is for dancers who have learned and are comfortable with the basics. Click for complete Class Details.


Free Games Slate is offering free games to dancers from 7:30 - 8:30 pm when you buy a drink or food. You can play pool, ping pong, shuffleboard, and more. It is an awesome deal and a great way to relax after work.

Dance Party Party with rotating DJs spinning fantastic West Coast Swing tunes from 8:30pm until midnight! The party is $12 at the door or prepay online for $10. Get $5 cash back if you spend $20+ at the bar.

Credit cards accepted at admission desk.  Credit cards accepted at admission desk. No outside food, water or drinks. 21+ over event only ID required.


Check out NOWDancing.com for more information and to Register!
results.name: West Coast Swing Dancing @ Last Dance Strictly Tuesday

results.description:
This event is proudly brought to you by Soccer Beyond!

Learn more on SoccerBeyond.com or Facebook.com/SoccerBeyond.

Details - Fun, interactive, effective.

60min. This is a Coed Soccer Lesson covering soccer techniques for passing, receiving, dribbling, turning, and much more. 

Please bring your own ball. Sneakers, running and turf shoes are fine. Bring some water or sports drink and maybe sun blocker. Please note our Waiver of Liability and 24hr Cancellation Policy below. More details follow.


Rain or Shine - If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Our sessions will be held as scheduled if weather allows. Thunder or snow and ice are among the reasons for sessions to be canceled/ moved. BUT: Don't make assumptions - you will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved. As the weather changes quickly in NYC, occasionally we may make the final decision about 90min prior to session start. If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Cancelled/ Moved Sessions - You will always get notified!

Every time we have to cancel a session, if possible, we move it to the same day and time of the following week. In this case, all players keep their spots. Please email us prior to the rescheduled event, if you can't make and wish a refund or credit. The 24 hours cancellation policy applies. You will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved.

Requesting a Refund

To request a refund 1) change your status to "not going" and 2) send us a note with the Paypal transaction number related to the payment for the respective session. Refunds are processed once a week - please be patient.


24 Hours Cancellation Policy

A full refund/ credit will be given if cancellation is received at least 24 hours prior to lesson start. Full payment is required thereafter. Our cancellation policy also applies to package holders.


Waiver of Liability and Hold Harmless Agreement

By RSVP'ing for this event you certify that you are physically fit such as you are able to participate in this program. You therewith voluntarily release CoachFrankNYC/ Soccer Beyond, LLC from any and all liability resulting from or arising out of your participation and/ or receipt of instruction. You read and agree to the WAIVER OF LIABILITY AND HOLD HARMLESS AGREEMENT to be found on SoccerBeyond.com/pages/waiver.

Please let us know if you have any questions or suggestions.

Coach Frank  
M. [masked]

SoccerBeyond.com
[masked]


Feel free to like us on http://www.facebook.com/SoccerBeyond.

TZC Group Meditation

Thursday Evening Meditation Group 7:30 - 9 :00PM

There are two 20 minute sitting meditation periods with one 10 min walking mediation period in between. You may only enter and exit the Zen Center during the walking meditation period. You may choose to sit for one period or for both periods. This is a time for quieting the mind and refocusing on who you are.

Visit: Taegozencenter.com

General Schedule - (Entry times are firm 7:30pm, 8:00pm )

7:30 - Start - Opening service

7:40 -Sitting Meditaiton

8:00 - Walking Meditation 8:00 - Start - Peroid 2

8:10 -Sitting Meditation

8:30 -Dharma discussion /Social / Questions

9:00 - End


We look forward to sitting with you!


Palms together,

Taego Zen Center

Join us as Dumbo Kitchen hosts the event and offers $4 beer! They have a great selection on tap including beers from Brooklyn's own Other Half Brewery. The show is free so come early, grab a bite and a drink and then enjoy some music and comedy.

results.description:
Bring out your best poems, stories, memoir excerpts, flash fiction… it's open mic night for writers, hosted by the Art Cafe Nyack and River River Writers Circle. Sign-ups start at 7:30 p.m., with a 5-minute limit per reader. We'll have the quiet, back-porch room of the cafe. There's no requirement to order anything to participate, but if you would like to, please order and pick up at the counter.

We'll continue this open mic on the first and third Tuesday of every month, so, mark your calendars and spread the word!
results.how_to_find_us: Find us in the back porch room of the Art Cafe.
results.name: read!
The Montclair Socrates Cafe Weekly Meetup

results.description:
Help make freeganism happen in NYC! After brief report-backs on ongoing projects, we will have an open, facilitated discussion on a topic of freegan interest. Bring your ideas and opinions and let's talk! We welcome both those with experience taking part in non-hierarchical consensus-based groups and those participating for the first time. At 9pm, we will end our business meeting and have a brief, newcomer-friendly discussion about freeganism before the trash tour. The meeting is NOT open to media.

Newcomers are always welcome and encouraged to attend our full meeting, but if you ONLY want an introduction to freeganism and to dumpster dive, DON'T sign up for this meeting! See the next one (Freeganism 101 and Trash Tour, later the same evening).

If you have trouble finding us, call Janet:[masked]-6954.
results.how_to_find_us: We will be seated in view of the door at the Wall Street Entrance.

results.description:
Is it possible to have too much Origami? In the world of OMG never!

This is our Weekly Tuesday Folder's meeting at Argo Tea on University Place near Union Square!

If you have models you would like to learn or teach, let me know and we will try our best to accommodate.

This meeting is free and open to all level of folders from beginners to advanced. bring paper and your books and also there will always be free paper available to share so you can just show up and fold!

hope to see you there! happy folding!!

It would be great for you to RSVP if you plan on attending so others will know you will be there. Thanks and happy folding!

-Sok

NOTE: reminders emails for WTF will not be sent out because it will always be at the same time and same place and same day of the week and I am trying my best not to send out too many mass emails for the group! So check back here on the website for any changes and updates or cancellations ;)

results.description:
We cordially invite you to the latest installment of Polyglot Bar NYC!  :D 


Modeled after Paris' famed weekly Polyglot events, this meet-up will allow people studying all languages at all levels to practice and find others who share their interest from all over the city.

Once again, we'll be meeting at Jake's Dilemma, a bar in the Upper West Side near the Boat Basin where we used to meet. 


You don't need to be a "polyglot" to stop by -- if you have any interest in languages, we'd love to have you!


"LIKE" OUR PAGE TO STAY UPDATED ON NEW EVENTS!

results.description: • Austerlitz is the story of a man’s search for the answer to his life’s central riddle. A small child when he comes to England on a Kindertransport in the summer of 1939, Jacques Austerlitz is told nothing of his real family by the Welsh Methodist minister and his wife who raise him. When he is a much older man, fleeting memories return to him, and obeying an instinct he only dimly understands, Austerlitz follows their trail back to the world he left behind a half century before. There, faced with the void at the heart of twentieth-century Europe, he struggles to rescue his heritage from oblivion.
results.how_to_find_us: Ask the doorman for the Meetup Group in the Library off the Lobby
results.name: Austerlitz by W. G. Sebold

results.description:
Come on out and enjoy a night of food drink, conversation and a little friendly competition! Test your skills as New York Social Network Founder Dave Cervini hosts a fun evening that will have you thinking, laughing and learning about pop culture, music, TV, Movie, History, NYC and more.

Most questions are easy and others you may have to rely on your teammates for help. Come alone or with a friend. Even if you think you don’t know much trivia, it is still a great way to meet others in the group. We will have special sections set aside for NYSN members to meet and team up.  Pay as you go for food and drink. There are several rounds and prizes awarded for each round!

Can I come alone? Yes! If you do not know anyone there we will introduce you to others and make you part of teams.

What should I wear? Most come from work but The Firehouse is a pub with a very casual atmosphere.

Can I eat there? The Firehouse is known for it's wings. But they also have burgers, quesadillas, veggie sandwiches, salads, pizza, burrito's and more. If you want to eat with the group, plan to get there around 7pm.

How long does it last? We have 3 rounds of 15 questions each.  The trivia usually lasts until about 9:30pm.  After that some stayb and socialize and other head home.

How do I get there? It is near the corner of west 85th and Columbus Avenue.  The B,C stop a block away at CPW and 86th and the #1 stops at B'way and 86th.

This event is being hosted by The New York Social Network  WWW.NEWYORKSOCIALNETWORK.COM  and several of their partner Meet Up Groups.  The number of RSVP’s below reflect only a portion of those attending.  Please only sign up for this event if you are serious about attending. (We have a 3 flakes and you’re out rule). If you have any questions regarding this or any of our events please contact Dave Cervini directly at [masked] or call[masked]
results.name: Fun & Easy Rotating Team Trivia Night ~ Free Night!

Please consider your RSVP seriously and update RSVP if you can't make it. Also, email me at [masked] with your contact number if you can come. I will send mine so we can communicate better when the meet up happens.

The class fee will be $15 per person. Once you commit for 4 weeks series of classes it will be $40.  Please, note you won't get a credit if you cancel your attendance on the same day. Be prepared for the class! :)

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, time it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners.

results.description:
If you are new to the city, recently out, just looking for friends, or whatever experiences brought you to us - we also offer a safe space where we can mingle and talk about our experiences as an LGBT person in New York City. We hold a space in the Manhattan Center and the Brooklyn Pride Center for icebreakers and discussions. You can hit up one or both in a month! We recommend this to anyone who is looking for a more casual space to explore their sexual/gender identity. 

We will be screening the film "Paris is Burning": a documentary focusing on drag queens living in New York City and their "house" culture, which provided a sense of community and support for the flamboyant and often socially shunned performers.

We accept a $5 donation. 

There’ll also be refreshments! 


Bring friends! 

IMPORTANT: The center can be a tad hard to find. It is on the corner of Gold Street and Willoughby Street, in the lobby next to the Subway restaurant. We will have a post outside of the lobby also telling people where to go.
results.name: First Tuesdays at the Brooklyn Pride Center! Screening "Paris is Burning"!

10Below Ice Cream is New York’s first establishment serving Thai-inspired ice cream rolls. This concept was created on the streets of Thailand, serving fresh, made-to-order ice cream. Inspired by this ice cream art and by the way bartenders artfully craft cocktails made to order, 10Below blends the two approaches to create an experience for ice cream aficionados with an eclectic palette. We roll each individual ice cream order with the freshest ingredients right in front of your eyes, meaning no preservatives or stabilizers are added. It’s ice cream in its rawest form -- fresh off the plate.

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, time it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

No fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds: Cancel your RSVP 24 hours or more before the game and we will make the refund. No refund for late cancelations; no exceptions.

Do you like getting up early and starting the day with inspiring conversations or even better: pair programming on your pet project? This is your meetup! :) 

Skip the morning run and instead meet us between 6:30 AM and 9:30 AM bi-weekly to chat, code and have the first coffee together to start the day off with developers or other software professionals who care about the quality of the code and passionately looking for ways to improve themselves. 

The venue: There is a Starbucks open from 5:30 am and behind it the lobby of The Lexington NYC hotel, which is a pretty cool space, they have free, fast wi-fi, plenty of seating and a lot of sockets in the wall :) I asked, and we are allowed to gather so don't be shy and have a look around. There are seats downstairs and on the mezzanine as well, upstairs, where the restrooms are too. See you there!

Business owners, managers, and salespeople learn about each other's business and we share referrals. Now, more than ever, business people need to network to stay in business. BNI Business Developers provides a positive, supportive, and structured environment to share ideas, contacts, and business referrals.

results.description:
Big Data Everywhere New York is a half-day conference focused on Hadoop and surrounding technologies that will bring together users and developers to share their experience about these projects via multiple presentations and user success stories. Industry experts will exchange Hadoop knowledge, share best practices, and discuss Hadoop use cases.

Tickets are half-price for SQL/NoSQL NYC Meetup members (join at http://www.NYCSQL.com) - we can attend a big data conference for just 24-bucks!

Registration includes free breakfast and a networking lunch!

Register NOW, seats are limited!
https://www.eventbrite.com/e/big-data-everywhere-new-york-tickets-18655442932

50%-off discount code: SQLNYC

Hear about real-world Hadoop delployments and other tales from the trenches of big data!

Speakers include:

• Vice President of IT for Morgan Stanley

• Chief Application Architect at MapR

• CTO of Nvent Data

• Cisco's Big Data Consulting Systems Engineer

• CIO of Pico

• Apache Mahout, Drill, & ZooKeeper Projects Committer

• CEO of Zaloni

Topics include:

• ​Morgan Stanley's Big Data Journey 

• Secure Collaboration on Big Data: Locking Down Doesn't Mean Locking Out

• Leverage a Hadoop Data Lake to Address Risk Data Aggregation and Risk Reporting

• The Transformational Influence of Big Data in the Global Capital Markets

• Odyssey: A Look at The Evolution of Big Data Ingestion Pipelines

• Cisco IT's Hadoop Journey

Register TODAY, seats are limited!
https://www.eventbrite.com/e/big-data-everywhere-new-york-tickets-18655442932
50%-off code: SQLNYC

Conference sessions:

Leverage a Hadoop Data Lake to address Risk Data Aggregation and Risk Reporting by Ben Sharma, CEO, Zaloni

Addressing risk data aggregation and risk reporting (RDARR) is a challenge today for many reasons, including data accuracy and integrity, data completeness, and ensuring that you have a data architecture that can support normal and high stress scenarios. During this presentation, Ben Sharma will address how a “managed” Hadoop data lake can serve as an ideal data acquisition hub for RDARR analytics and reporting. He will address architectural considerations and required capabilities.

Odyssey: A Look at The Evolution of Big Data Ingestion Pipelines by Steve Morin, CTO, Nvent Data

Get an overview of the maturing Big Data ecosystem as companies move more towards real-time analytics tools that ingest, extract, translate, and then clean up data for analysis. You'll also get a look at a data ingestion pipeline architecture, how it has evolved over time, and its use cases in today's big data landscape.​

Cisco IT's Hadoop Journey by Robert Novak, Big Data Consulting Systems Engineer, Cisco

In this talk, you'll get insights into Cisco’s own Hadoop journey and how Cisco implemented a highly agile enterprise Hadoop platform, delivering multiple use cases including ETL migration, content management, smart analytics and compliance.

The Transformational Influence of Big Data in the Global Capital Markets by Paul Cassell, CIO & Daniel Bartucci, Director of Corporate Development, Pico

The business of financial and global capital management is bursting with hundreds of millions of transactions every day. Recent volatility in the financial markets is driving increased message traffic from electronic trading, stretching systems that simply aren’t equipped to handle such volume. With growing financial data sources and data types (such as social media, audio, and video), the need for big data technologies that can store, process and analyze this financial data is more important than ever. Join Paul Cassell, Pico CIO and former U.S. chief information officer for NYSE Euronext and the New York Stock Exchange, along with Daniel Bartucci, Director of Corporate Development, as they provide details on scalable, cost-effective, best-of-breed big data technologies that you can leverage for financial data management, regulation, risk analytics, and trading analytics. You’ll come away with a better understanding of how you can harvest and leverage this data so that you can stay one step ahead of your competitors.

​Secure Collaboration on Big Data: Locking Down Doesn't Mean Locking Out by Ted Dunning, Committer for Apache Mahout, Drill, & ZooKeeper Projects & Chief Application Architect, MapR

Mobile payments, online banking, smart kiosks, etc. are the platforms driving bank growth for the next 20 years. All of them produce gobs of data and all of them provide opportunities for fraudsters to steal. In order to keep up, new kinds of predictive analytical models will have to be built. In order to develop these new kinds of models, we need all hands on deck, both inside and outside of financial institutions. Unfortunately, cooperation on new modeling technologies is very difficult to do without sharing sensitive data in ways that just isn't acceptable.

I will describe some recently developed techniques that break this logjam. These methods are simple enough to deploy widely but provide very robust security against even the most advanced de-anonymization attacks.

Morgan Stanley's Big Data Journey by Erwan Le Doeuff, Vice President Information Technology, Risk and Security, Morgan Stanley

Morgan Stanley will highlight some of the exciting things they’re doing as they expand big data projects throughout the organization, including how to start out with test projects, choose open source projects, scale systems, and produce meaningful results.

Register at https://www.eventbrite.com/e/big-data-everywhere-new-york-tickets-18655442932

I will describe some recently developed techniques that break this logjam. These methods are simple enough to deploy widely but provide very robust security against even the most advanced de-anonymization attacks.

Morgan Stanley's Big Data Journey by Erwan Le Doeuff, Vice President Information Technology, Risk and Security, Morgan Stanley

Morgan Stanley will highlight some of the exciting things they’re doing as they expand big data projects throughout the organization, including how to start out with test projects, choose open source projects, scale systems, and produce meaningful results.

Register at https://www.eventbrite.com/e/big-data-everywhere-new-york-tickets-18655442932

results.description:
Big Data Everywhere New York is a half-day conference focused on Hadoop and surrounding technologies that will bring together users and developers to share their experience about these projects via multiple presentations and user success stories. Industry experts will exchange Hadoop knowledge, share best practices, and discuss Hadoop use cases.

Tickets are half-price for SQL/NoSQL NYC Meetup members - we can attend a big data conference for just 24-bucks!


Registration includes free breakfast and a networking lunch!


Register NOW, seats are limited!
https://www.eventbrite.com/e/big-data-everywhere-new-york-tickets-18655442932

50%-off discount code: SQLNYC


Hear about real-world Hadoop delployments and other tales from the trenches of big data!


Speakers include:

• Vice President of IT for Morgan Stanley


• Chief Application Architect at MapR

• CTO of Nvent Data


• Cisco's Big Data Consulting Systems Engineer


• CIO of Pico


• Apache Mahout, Drill, & ZooKeeper Projects Committer


• CEO of Zaloni

Topics include:


• ​Morgan Stanley's Big Data Journey 

• Secure Collaboration on Big Data: Locking Down Doesn't Mean Locking Out


• Leverage a Hadoop Data Lake to Address Risk Data Aggregation and Risk Reporting


• The Transformational Influence of Big Data in the Global Capital Markets

• Odyssey: A Look at The Evolution of Big Data Ingestion Pipelines


• Cisco IT's Hadoop Journey


Register TODAY, seats are limited!
https://www.eventbrite.com/e/big-data-everywhere-new-york-tickets-18655442932
50%-off code: SQLNYC


Conference sessions:

Leverage a Hadoop Data Lake to address Risk Data Aggregation and Risk Reporting by Ben Sharma, CEO, Zaloni

Addressing risk data aggregation and risk reporting (RDARR) is a challenge today for many reasons, including data accuracy and integrity, data completeness, and ensuring that you have a data architecture that can support normal and high stress scenarios. During this presentation, Ben Sharma will address how a “managed” Hadoop data lake can serve as an ideal data acquisition hub for RDARR analytics and reporting. He will address architectural considerations and required capabilities.

Odyssey: A Look at The Evolution of Big Data Ingestion Pipelines by Steve Morin, CTO, Nvent Data

Get an overview of the maturing Big Data ecosystem as companies move more towards real-time analytics tools that ingest, extract, translate, and then clean up data for analysis. You'll also get a look at a data ingestion pipeline architecture, how it has evolved over time, and its use cases in today's big data landscape.​

Cisco IT's Hadoop Journey by Robert Novak, Big Data Consulting Systems Engineer, Cisco

In this talk, you'll get insights into Cisco’s own Hadoop journey and how Cisco implemented a highly agile enterprise Hadoop platform, delivering multiple use cases including ETL migration, content management, smart analytics and compliance.

The Transformational Influence of Big Data in the Global Capital Markets by Paul Cassell, CIO & Daniel Bartucci, Director of Corporate Development, Pico

The business of financial and global capital management is bursting with hundreds of millions of transactions every day. Recent volatility in the financial markets is driving increased message traffic from electronic trading, stretching systems that simply aren’t equipped to handle such volume. With growing financial data sources and data types (such as social media, audio, and video), the need for big data technologies that can store, process and analyze this financial data is more important than ever. Join Paul Cassell, Pico CIO and former U.S. chief information officer for NYSE Euronext and the New York Stock Exchange, along with Daniel Bartucci, Director of Corporate Development, as they provide details on scalable, cost-effective, best-of-breed big data technologies that you can leverage for financial data management, regulation, risk analytics, and trading analytics. You’ll come away with a better understanding of how you can harvest and leverage this data so that you can stay one step ahead of your competitors.

​Secure Collaboration on Big Data: Locking Down Doesn't Mean Locking Out by Ted Dunning, Committer for Apache Mahout, Drill, & ZooKeeper Projects & Chief Application Architect, MapR

Mobile payments, online banking, smart kiosks, etc. are the platforms driving bank growth for the next 20 years. All of them produce gobs of data and all of them provide opportunities for fraudsters to steal. In order to keep up, new kinds of predictive analytical models will have to be built. In order to develop these new kinds of models, we need all hands on deck, both inside and outside of financial institutions. Unfortunately, cooperation on new modeling technologies is very difficult to do without sharing sensitive data in ways that just isn't acceptable.

I will describe some recently developed techniques that break this logjam. These methods are simple enough to deploy widely but provide very robust security against even the most advanced de-anonymization attacks.

Morgan Stanley's Big Data Journey by Erwan Le Doeuff, Vice President Information Technology, Risk and Security, Morgan Stanley

Morgan Stanley will highlight some of the exciting things they’re doing as they expand big data projects throughout the organization, including how to start out with test projects, choose open source projects, scale systems, and produce meaningful results.

Register at https://www.eventbrite.com/e/big-data-everywhere-new-york-tickets-18655442932

results.description:
New York Passive House (NYPH) is pleased to be Urban Green Council's (UGC) event partner for this exciting event. 

- REGISTER BY CLICKING HERE - 


What will it take to bring the largest residential Passive House in the world from conception to completion? Join project leads from Related, Hudson Companies, Handel Architects, and Steven Winter Associates for an in-depth presentation on Cornell University’s high-rise residential tower, designed to Passive House standards and currently under construction on Roosevelt Island. Part of their new tech campus, the 26-story building will house students and faculty members in 350 apartments, making it both the largest and tallest PH building in the world upon completion.

UGC thanks event partners AIA New York and New York Passive House (NYPH)

SPEAKERS

Lois Arena, PE


Senior Mechanical Engineer, Steven Winter Associates, Inc.

Ms. Arena has over 20 years experience in building science, including work with both new and existing buildings. She holds both US and international Passive House consultant certifications and is currently consulting on multiple Passive House projects.

Luke Falk
Sustainability Manager, Related

Mr. Falk supports the implementation of Related’s corporate sustainability strategy, which includes enhancing the energy performance and resilience of new and existing buildings, incorporating innovative technologies into Related’s development portfolio, and managing the LEED certification process for new developments. 

Deborah Moelis, AIA
Senior Associate, Handel Architects

Ms. Moelis currently serves as Project Manager for Cornell University’s new residential tower under construction on the Roosevelt Island campus. Previously, she oversaw construction of Millennium Place, a 256-unit residential building in downtown Boston, as well as design and construction of Aire, a 42-story 315-unit residential tower on Manhattan’s Upper West Side.

Arianna Sacks Rosenberg
Senior Project Manager, The Hudson Companies, Inc.

Ms. Rosenberg has over 9 years of experience in real estate development and design, and oversees a broad range of residential and commercial development projects in Manhattan and Brooklyn, including the development of the Cornell Tech residential building.

- REGISTER BY CLICKING HERE -

results.description:
Other than strict RSVP rules (if you say you're coming and you don't show, you're out of the group), this is a chill game, open to anyone who <a>signs up</a>.

Here's what separates this group from many others:

• Chill, positive attitudes. (People without forgiving personalities don't last long in this group, let alone in a given game.)

• Good quality equipment: $145 match balls; solid small goals - not pop-ups!

• Freshly laundered, adult-size, pillowy soft pinnies.

• We won't ever over-crowd a game. The size of pitch we use is best suited for 7v7. We're happy to make the pitch smaller if numbers are low. But we won't make it bigger or allow more than 7 players per team. 


• The small fee we ask of each player (at least $3 per session) supports a non-profit that we created and run: a high school soccer league for under-funded schools that don't have sufficient resources for after-school programming. 

See nyisl.com or the below video for more info. about our <a>program</a> for under-served public school students.


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WzbNWu-N-ig

We use your game-fee to help pay for our high school players' new soccer boots, socks, shin guards and much more (e.g., the league website, goals, and other equipment). 

We're particularly fond of in-kind donations: soccer boots, socks, shins, shorts, etc. 

If you have any of these, please bring them to your game and we'll be more than happy to waive your game fee!
results.name: Sign-Up Soccer for Social Change
Let's get together for some socializing and exercise!

results.description:
The elite parenting center at the 92nd Street Y hosts a weekly new parent get-together tackling a new topic each week.  It's an amazing space to learn and socialize with other new parents who are facing many of the same challenges as you are.

New Parent Get-Together: A warm welcome to all new parents and their babies up to a year-old.  Join in and drop-in for a lively discussion and gathering each week to share, learn, and make new friends.  Wednesday's from 10:30am - noon.  

The new parent get-together is mainly attended by new moms, but extremely welcoming to all dads.

Price: $10 per week.  Come when you can, no registration required

Sep 16: Choosing Child Care

Sept 23: Bonding as a Family

Sept 30: Grandparents, Good advice/Bad Advice

Oct 7: Financial Planning

Oct 14: Baby's Temperament

Oct 21: Baby Sleep

Oct 28: Can you spoil your baby?

Nov 4: Traveling with your baby?

Nov 11: Gender expectations

Nov 18: Safety Tips

Dec 2: Introducing Solids
results.name: New Dads at the 92Y Weekly New Parent Get-Together

venue.name: Bench just inside the Mosholu Gate

results.description: Wed. Nov. 4. Bronx Botanical Garden. Forecast is for a beautiful day -- sunny skies and high temperature around 70. Fall foliage should finally be at its peak. We'll also take a look at the Rose Garden (yes, some roses are still in bloom!), The new Native Plant Garden, and the Perennial Garden, as well as walk through NYC's only primeval forest. Around 2 miles at a very leisurely pace. Take the 10:25 Harlem Line train from Grand Central, arriving at the "Botanical Garden" station at 10:45. Alternatively, take the 4 or D subway to "Bedford Park Blvd." and then the #26 bus east to the Mosholu Gate entrance. We'll meet just inside the Gate at 10:47. Admission to the Garden is free on Wednesdays, but the conservatory (optional) will set you back $25 ($22 for seniors). If driving, park in the parking facility by the station ($12) or on a nearby street (free). No coordination of rides. The 3:37 train gets you back to Grand Central at 3:59, or you can take the bus and subway back. Lunch in the cafeteria, or bring your own. Please call or email me to let me know you are coming, and if you have any questions. No need to let me know if you are not coming. No pets; no smoking. Bob Susser[masked]; [masked]
results.name: Bronx Botanical Garden

group.name: Appalachian Mountain Club New York-North Jersey

results.description:
ok all the weather is going to be perfect for some mid week exercise ,

 so if your free and want to enjoy some small town living  along side some beautiful fall leaves  then come along . ill wait inside the starbucks in scarsdale  Train station which I believe is the 1st hidden gem spot on this tour .. also I like to start our tours by a bathroom  so everyone can use facility before we head out walking :) Scarsdale is a very cute town  they have recently installed a parking garage next to train  and some long term  meters which will help with parking issues  we will head out to see a few of the speciality stores in town  as we walk to the path and then see some amazing fall foliage and little bridges  which are picture perfect . so I know this is short notice but  charge up your cameras , lace up your sneakers and come learn a bit about this charming town & enjoy a few hours for your self . BRING SMALL MONEY  FOR PARKING & IF YOU WANT TO BUY ANYTHING ALONG THE TOUR  .
results.how_to_find_us: ill wait for you in starbucks in side train station
results.name: Walk thru the wonderful woods of scarsdale

meta.description: Searches for recent and upcoming public events hosted by Meetup groups. Its search window  is the past one month through the next three months, and is subject to change. Open Events is optimized to search for current events by location, category, topic, or text, and only lists Meetups that have **3 or more RSVPs**. The number or results returned with each request is not guaranteed to be the same as the page size due to secondary filtering. If you're looking for a particular event or events within a particular group, use the standard [Events](/meetup_api/docs/2/events/) method.
meta.title: Meetup Open Events v2
